hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: With several Hilton hotels all in this complex together it is very busy, however there are SO many shops and dinning areas that you could stay here and not have to venture out far when shopping and dinning is on the agenda

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hawaii has a lovely climate and scenery. However this place does not give value for money. Restaurant food and cost of Hotels is grossly overpriced.If you want a beach holiday seriously consider the smaller pacific Islands or the east coast of Australia.We came here full of excitement but do not see us coming back or recommending to our friends

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you want the downtown, big city, close quarter beach vibe, this place is for you. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed our stay. The overall campus is huge, and has a little bit of everything. That being said, booking excursions and spa events is best done on site.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have stayed and preferred this place because of its excellent location.However, the most recent Feb 2020, was less satisfactory. The rooms need to be updated .The carpets looks old,the bathrooms needs more modern refurbishing

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Fantastic, first class, and over the top everything was perfect. The room was clean and when we asked for more towels they were there in a matter of minutes. Every thing was within walking distance and the beach was beautiful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you love to be close to the shops and yummy food, and still have a beautiful view and resort to stay in then this is the place. We stayed in the one bedroom suite partial ocean view and LOVED it!! Most evenings we sat out on the balcony and watched the beautiful ocean, lagoon and a few nights of private luaus on the grass below. The kitchen was stocked with almost everything we needed. It was just my husband and I so we ate out evenings, but it was nice to have things for breakfast and snacks ready. This would be perfect for families to save and cook their meals in the hotels. We were in the lagoon tower by the way. We also commented that the insolation was so good in our room, we never even heard anyone in the hallways.We loved having so many shops to walk around so close to the hotel - the village has a little of everything. We ate at the Blue Shrimp the first night we got in and were surprised at the quality and decent prices! And of course Lapperts was a frequent stop.We just enjoyed everything so much!!Even the last day was so pleasant, we had a late flight out and were able to check our bags in with the bellhop and walk around Waikiki and play on the beach then shower and print our boarding passes in the lounge provided for just that circumstance. We would definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I would prefer not to post this but I’ve asked them to clean it two days in a row and showed them pictures and video Gross not discoloration. Nothing was done The water temperature is comfortable and we love the peaceful atmosphere

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We arrived at 3:00 p.m. on a Saturday in the Lagoon Tower. Check in was a breeze, less than 10 minutes. The Bell Desk delivered our luggage immediately. We had a corner room on the 12th floor. The room was well stocked with the exception of a needed blender, which was requested and delivered timely from housekeeping. No kitchen towels were supplied. The room was clean with the exception of the doors which needed a good cleaning. The doors were white and had finger prints and dirt that was extremely visible. I did wipe down the doors as the Corona Virus is spreading and I was concerned with the germs. The Luau and fireworks shows were enjoyed from our balconies, what a nice treat. We had an incredible view of the ocean and saw several Whales from our balcony as well. We attended the Big Game (super bowl) party at the Tapa Bar. The location was good as the kids could remain at the pool and were visible from our seats. . However, the food could have been better and was cold by half time with no heat on the Chaffing Dishes. Lappert's Ice Cream by our Tower was great, although pricey we still enjoyed 4 times. We utilized the National Car Rental onsite 1 day, which was easy to reserve. We had no issues with finding a seat each day by the pool or the beach. We were able to snorkel with the Turtles and many varieties of fish. A short taxi ride to go to Costco for supplies the first day. The Bell Desk helped unload and delivered to our room. Close proximity to everything.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It is a beautiful resort for kids and we had4 grandkids with us. So much to keep them busy and happy and I could watch the dolphins all day. The only negative was breakfast. The only spot open had a $40 buffet and it wasn't worth it. The kids don't eat that much and it was hard to pay $40 for juice and cereal. The waitstaff was amazing and I wish I could remember her name.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a two bedroom, oceanfront room and the view was absolutely stunning. From our 11th floor room, we enjoyed lovely sunrises, sunsets and views of the lagoon! The front desk staff was absolutely superb and checkin was very quick and efficient. However, the valet staff is especially deserving of special lauding as they were ALWAYS amazingly quick in bringing our car....but do note valet parking is not cheap! There is a self park option but we decided to treat ourselves! We last stayed at the Lagoon Tower over a decade ago and the property, while beautiful, needs a refurbishment as the room decor and common areas such as the hallways and elevators are in need of a makeover which is due to how busy this property is year wide and how difficult it is to take down rooms or areas to refurbish! The Hilton Hawaiian Village is HUGE! Besides countless stores and too many restaurants to count or mention...there are numerous (5 I think) pools, a lagoon which offers paddle boats, surfing lessons, kayaks and other forms of entertainment and of course a beautiful stretch of beach on the famous Waikiki Beach. The super pool was unfortunately always very cold which explains why it was also always, relatively speaking, fairly uncrowded. Our favorite pool, The Paradise Pool, was located right next to the Lagoon Tower and was always packed. The pool includes several water slides, two hot tubs, a waterfall or two and a small grill offering hamburgs, hotdogs, a few Hawaiian staples such as Kalua pork sandwiches, and drinks. This pool was significantly warmer than any other pool on property explaining why it was always packed and why finding a chair after 9:30am was almost impossible. The most significant issue with this pool was the failure of the staff to enforce posted rules. Although there were security personnel present and the hot tubs had signs clearly stating in English and Japanese that the maximum occupancy was 9 people, I often counted upwards of 17 - 20 people in the hot tubs. This was not an infrequent issue but constant unless you used the hot tubs early in the morning! Something needs to be done as this level of occupancy is both unsafe and unsanitary! It is also annoying as parents bring infants, very young children jump into the hot tubs, teenagers congregate and adults can often barely maintain a space. There is no control and there is going to be a very unfortunate accident unless something is done to enforce the occupancy standards especially when counting 9 people in the hot tubs is fairly easy to do and enforce! Another issue involved a lack of coordination of Hilton Honor perks. We were never given or informed of a mythical passport book, which offers numerous discounts throughout the massive Hilton Hawaiian Village, until two days into our stay and purely by accident. And when we did find out about this program, the books were still using the 2019 books even though it was two months into the new year. This resulted in our missing at least four opportunities to save 10 - 15% on meals we had consumed in the Hilton Hawaiian Village which were all quite expensive. The books should be included with the the packet of information provided at checkin and not have to be discovered by visiting the concierge.The last major issue involved the perks offered to HGVC Owners after attending an owners update. I completely understand HGVC sales is a separate and independent beast from the Lagoon Tower!! However we were offered a experience card and told it offered 20% savings on food purchased at ALL restaurants in the Hilton Hawaiian Village and select restaurants out in town on both Oahu and Hawaii (Kona specifically) AND 15% savings on ALL merchandise and activities purchased at the shops in the Hilton Hawaiian Village and out in town at select stores on Oahu and Hawaii (again specifically Kona). Needless to say these promises were all lies as this card was not recognized at most of the restaurants on property and was not even recognized by one of the Lagoon Tower Resort Managers. As a long-time HGVC Elite member I should have known better! However, senior managers should know what perks are being offered by the sales team! Kudos to Resort Manager Sausito Sato for taking the time to walk with me to various places to try and find out about the card offered by the sales team. He was extremely patient and willing to even walk to a restaurant to try and address the issue with me. He exemplified the traditions and values espoused by Conrad Hilton more than any other staff member I encountered and should be lauded for his absolutely superb customer service!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: First time to Hawaii and we were recommended to stay here. We really enjoyed the stay. Great layout of the village. Our tower had a gym, star bucks and pool. Pool was great. Was adult only so we visited everyday. Very close to the main strip. Bus just out on the main road for the Ala Moana Mall.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is the perfect resort for everything! you do not need to leave the premises at all if you don't want to - there is everything at your fingertips. Staff are wonderful and accommodating, so friendly and easy to deal with. We had a great time in our 2 bedroom suite and would stay again for sure.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our 2 bedroom ocean front condo has the best of everything! Beautiful furniture, beautiful ocean views, beautiful view of diamondhead. Beautiful waterfalls, pools, koi. Lots of shops, grocery store. Beautiful beaches, lots of activities for the entire family! One of the most beautiful places on earth!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location for Waikiki area. The rooms are great, clean, complete kitchen, dining area. Nice living room area. Many restaurants near by, good pool on site. Great location for large family gatherings with so many venues close by so everyone can go separate ways if they wish.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I was only here for one day, but the experience was wonderful. Even as an elite member, the there was a line, and wait for a clean room. However, there was so much to walk around and see, the wait did not seem as long. It was apparent the staff worked extremely hard, so I understand, they may not have been as perky. Nevertheless, no staff was rude, and for their extreme effort for receiving and caring for so many from different places across the globe, I really wish I had the resources to increase my tips to 100 bills instead of 10s. My stay for the long term ended up at another Hilton property, which we enjoyed. But, we did have a happy time with this one day, and certainly recommend this location for a nice vacation stay!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have already submitted my feedback to the HHV. We LOVE this place but were not very impressed by several issues on our last trip. Hopefully management will get back on its game.Short version of issues: Dishwasher broken for all 10 days, Alarm going off all night for two nights on a generator of some sort, hot tub broken for several days, key maker did not work when we checked in.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at Tapa Tower, had read reviews and was a little worried after I booked. I must say everything was great. Checking in and out was not along wait. The swimming pools were not packed. Restaurants are not that pricey as the concierge gives you a free gift and hotel passport. The passport contains discounts for the restaurants and specialty shops. Staff are very helpful as it is a small village of hotels and pools. Thank you to Hilton Hawaiian for a nice stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We loved our stay, the grounds & staff were excellent But we will never stay here again due to the ridiculous noise of the maintenance crew in the middle of the night. The service trucks and banging of pipes and loud noises kept us awake each and every night for the entire 12 days that we stayed

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have just returned from a 7 day stay in a 2 x bedroom condo in the lagoon tower. It is actually a 1 x bedroom suite that interconnects with a twin studio room. It was absolutely fantastic and suited our needs perfectly. We had ample space and the kitchen meant we had a coffee machine and refrigerator to store snacks etc. The kitchen could do with a top up of items such a cutlery and tea towels as its very bare. We didn’t cook our own food but if you wanted to you would find it very difficult with the limited utensils in the room. We couldn’t even find a tray to heat up pizza! The food in the village is all over prized rubbish food that is typical of hawaii, chips, burgers and salads that are 90% lettuce. There is limited food options outside of the village nearby and its at least a 15-20 min walk to anything semi decent food wise. However the lagoon pool was fantastic for families. Has 3 slides and is heated to a lovely warm temperature so our kids literally spent all day there. As long as u are down at the pool by about 10.30am u can always get a sunlounger. I had read many reviews complaining about the wait for elevators, we had no such problem! All in all a great stay but a bit let down by a lack of nutritious food options at a reasonable price. But the room and amenities at the hotel were fantastic. If u like to ear burgers, hot dogs and fries all week at twice the price then you will be right at home. If not, then staying somewhere closer to Kalakaua Ave is more convenient but being hawaii, nothing is cheap!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Love this hotel and proximity to the beach which is always kept clean. Lots of activities can be booked at the hotel for convenience and staff is very friendly and helpful. We booked a two bedroom suite and had kitchen and laundry facilities for our use. There are a lot of hotel towers on this location so there are a lot of people around always. I think they may need more restaurants as all the restaurants on site were always very busy at night.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We returned to the Hilton Hawaiian Village nearly 24 years after being there for our honeymoon. This time our party of 5 stayed in the lagoon tower at the Grand Waikikian. Arriving late in the afternoon on a nasty rainy day Ronald at concierge was our ray of sunshine - a welcoming aloha smile, calm and willing to take the time to answer all of our many questions, provide dinner recommendations and maps and try to track down a wheelchair we reserved that was delivered to another property. He was amazing!!! Thank you Ronald for making the start of our trip a smooth one.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This place has everything. Almost no need to venture off the property. Grocery store close by. Great beach and great service. Good view out any of the towers. Walking distance to most things including the Ala Moana mall. Highly recommend

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent our last night here and it was wonderful. Kids wished we had an extra night in the 1 bedroom villa. We had the Lagoon tower with the pool view. A little noisy but normal vacation noise, 7th floor. Has a balcony. The suite was spacious, comfy, and the king bed with down comforter was wonderful! Full kitchen and the kids’ favorite part? The heated toilet seat! The hotel is so convenient and walkable to Ala Moana and the International Marketplace. The hotel is surrounded by pools, shopping villages, lagoon with water activities, and the beach! Even with checkout, there was a Changing lounge if your flight is much later. We enjoyed our last day at the resort before our 11 pm flight, including walking towards the Marketplace for an early dinner.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The views from this resort are arguably some of the best in Honolulu and the rooms are exceptionally spacious. I would love this resort if it had not been for its totally disinterested and unresponsive management who hide themselves behind multiple administrative layers so as not have to deal with guest issues. This place has more "resort managers" than I have ever seen and the senior management shields themselves behind junior management that has no authority whatsoever but make empty promises regarding fixing issues. HGVC honesty should be ashamed as this is a total misuse of members fees. Here is a typical example of how problem resolution is handled at this property. A Junior manager 2 short weeks ago during a stay gave me his email to avoid future stay issues and said I should contact him prior to future stays to avoid repeat problems at this resort. I thanked him and specifically asked him for information on who to contact if he was unavailable. He told me not to worry but said he would get me alternative resort contact information. I sent 3 emails requesting the alternative contact information. I never heard back until today when I received an automated response that yesterday was his last day as he retired. I guess he didn't remember he was retiring 2 weeks ago when he said I should contact him before future stays !!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We love Oahu. But during the holidays it can be ridiculously crowded. Food and drink is expensive but all great quality. Plan ahead if you have a group. Get the condo rooms if you can so that you can make your own coffee and drinks when feasible.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The resort is beautiful and very welcoming. The swimming pool area and amenities should require a wrist ban for access for resort guest only as other resorts require. There were multiple locals/non guest utilizing the swimming pool area and amenities reducing the number allowed for guest.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites and this was the first time we attended a Hilton timeshare presentation. A van came to the hotel and took us over to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Our representative Julie was amazing to say the least. The inventory rep Chris was also excellent. They both stayed late to get the purchase processed. We did buy and then changed our minds and cancelled later. It was a two hour presentation that became five hours due to the many questions I had, weighing options, paperwork... After additional research upon returning to our hotel room, we decided to cancel as we were unsure about the amount of points and the home resort we bought into. Home resort is a big factor if travelling during holiday season (priority booking).However, the biggest drawbacks are the fees associated to any transaction (to book your points, roll your points , transfer your points...) and parking fees. Their motto is “you only pay for what you use” which isn’t accurate - if you touch your points, it’s going to cost you. Although annual fees seem cheaper than Marriott or Disney vacation clubs, they are comparable to Hilton when transaction fees are added. I haven’t received the refund of my deposit yet so I won’t comment on the cancellation process. If the refund gets processed promptly, I will certainly re-consider buying after visiting their big island resorts. Although it’s a no pressure sales presentation, all offers are off the table once you leave. This tactic is rather stupid if you ask me. It would be much wiser to give people 48 hours otherwise it’s just a waste of everybody’s time when someone buys only to cancel later. So we had to buy in order to think on it.Their presentation is quite well done but I would prefer an opportunity to research the points charts and benefits of various resorts on my own before deciding. Upon pulling up all the vacation club resorts in Hawai’i, I found that all the studio suites only hold 2 people. This was the deciding factor in cancelling as both Marriott and Disney have 4 person occupancy in their studios. I did ask to see a studio suite but was never shown one. Their new tower Grand Islander has beautiful suites. We have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village before and very much enjoyed our stay. Hence our interest in their vacation club. There are many benefits like no expiration of Hhonor points and open season rates (last minute rates only for vacation club owners).If you’re serious about buying, plan to be there for about 4 hours and do some research ahead of time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were happy to see the rooms have been updated since our stay a couple years ago. We began our stay in the Lagoon tower, using our timeshare, then ended in the Diamond Head tower. All the restaurants & the buffet were pricey (our average meal cost for family 4 was $125; 2 adults & 2 kids under 13). There’s a lot to do. The kids spent a lot of time between the activities in the lagoon (kayak & paddle board), and the water slides at the timeshare pool. We stayed during Christmas week, and it was PACKED. I don’t advise visiting during the same time. It’s the most crowded I’ve ever seen Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: December 2019 Family Trip Great Location at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Rooms was spacious, clean. Everything worked. Pools were nice and the beach was great. Staff were excellentParking costs are a bit steep. Things can be expensive but it is Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This resort is huge, with every conceivable amenity provided somewhere on site. It has its own shopping village, markets, numerous swimming pools and lagoons, and is absolutely beachfront. Fireworks display every Friday night of the year! It’s fantastic. Plenty of places to walk around and explore, heaps of restaurants and eateries, and all without even leaving the resort. It’s busy though, with lots of people and kids. Expect to wait for the elevators, and if you eat at the ‘peak’ times for lunch and dinner. We ate a very late lunch or very early dinner to avoid extensive waiting times. Can’t recommend this place enough, it’s awesome!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I recently stayed. Granted I only reserved a room 6 weeks before my trip, but if I booked a room with an ocean view, and did not even come close. So when I checked in, I had to be in the furthest tower from the ocean. Then all the parking issues. That is not only the worse parking lot, but the parking machines, which you are suppose to use your room key to access did not work from Day 1. Had 3 days of the parking issues. Then the garbage cans are so small, can not even throw out a 12 oz cup. The towels are so ragged looking. Then the cleaning crew would not knock on the door, they just entered. Unprofessional. Not worth the price I spent. It also took so long for towels or food to be delivered

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The lagoon tower is old and outdated especially related to the appliances, countertops, and safety of the shower/tub combo. I booked a one bedroom Oceanview and the view was actually of the Ilikai. Management made no effort to place me in a different tower.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I made a reservation 9 months ago.There was no room available except 4th floor near elevator.I was so disappointed to experience how hilton treat vacation member like this poor. It's better to book with money.
user_name:
Ryanchoi1959
Old Tappan, NJ, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is so Hawaiian style living. Sun, beach, food, relax. The staff treats you like family. No rushing around, take it slow and enjoy. Parking is pricey so get transportation to and from the airport. Take the bus or walk, so easy to get around.Food is pricey, but if you have a unit with a kitchen eat in breakfast and lunch,, then go out for dinner, treat yourself, On Fridays, there is a Fireworks display in the evening, highly recommended. Go to Ala Moana Mall food court (short distance away). If you are military, you can eat at Hale Koa Hotel next door. Great food, not too pricey.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in Lagoon Tower which was conveniently located near the ocean and lagoon. We had a group of 7 including grandparents, parents and children between 3 and 8. Plenty to do within the village property without needing a vehicle. We were there for Thanksgiving which was much busier than we imagined. Make your Thanksgiving dinner plans early or you will be eating Italian food as we did. It was extremely hot and humid, which didn;t matter to the young ones, but made it difficult for the grandparents. There is alot of walking. The luau on the property was okay, but do not spend extra for diamond seating, it wasn't worth the price. Mostly the kids loved the beach and the pools. The ocean was refreshing. Rent chairs and an umbrella to get out of the sun and heat. Restaurant food is outrageously expensive - over $200 for breakfast for 4 adults and 3 children. Get groceries if you can to do some cooking in the room. The 2-bedroom condo units were very nice, but the elevator situation was stressful. No service elevators so you are competing with staff and guests for 3 smaller sized elevator cars for a 23 story property. No restaurant on the property - you have to walk to the other properties in the village to find food. Overall a nice vacation.
user_name:
Jan P
New Britain, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is by far the best Hawaiian resort we’ve seen! Very large property with tons of shopping and restaurants! Some restaurants are a little pricey, but you can always buy food and bring it back to the room if your staying in a condo tower like we did. Pools are great one with 4 water slides the kids loved. There is also the salt water lagoon where you can swim, lay on the sand and tan, or rent water trikes, paddle boards or other water toys. We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great room, layout and patio. BUT husband and I are not resort people so the amount of people, children and large resort feel is not for us. Takes forever to get an elevator and you have to cover plenty of distance just to get out of resort. Clean and pretty but wouldn’t return.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: everything is always great but the mattress was hard on our backs....other than that it always is excellent or we would not keep going back every year. the view of the room is wonderful...kitchen has everything that you may want...all in all we couldn't ask for more

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: this property is a city unto itself. many restaurants in village. use the passports for good discounts at restaurants and shops. also use charlys taxi to and from airport a flat fee of 29 for all that fit into taxi. numerous pools to choose from and you have a large beach front but chairs are rental on beach. a 5.99 breakfeast is available if you walk one block from resort. a food pantry store is also a one block walk . mahalo

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are HGVC Elite Plus owners and stay at a lot of properties. We stayed in the Lagoon Tower and were quite disappointed as to the overall condition of the furnishings and general cleanliness of this tower. This is on of Hilton's older towers on Oahu and is in need of updates and overall care. This is not typical of Hilton properties which usually get above average to excellent rating.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There are multiple high rise HGVC resorts on this very busy property, including on-site parking along with extensive retail, restaurants and activities. It is a short strand walk (15 minutes) to Waikiki Beach.Our 2 Bedroom/2 Bath 20th Floor corner condo was very spacious and comfortable. King Bed in Master, 2 Twins in 2nd Bedroom and Queen fold out couch in Living Room. Flat screen televisions in both bedrooms and living room with Games/DVD access on the living room television. Balconies off the living room and dining room presented wonderful sunset views of the Harbor and Mountains.Full kitchen with adequate cookware for preparing simple meals.Very comfortable for our family of 3 adults and 1 child.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Tower the night before I flew Home to NH. Great Room, Way up in the top Floor of the Hotel overlooking the ocean. Next time I'll bring a Friend and Share Paradise. I was there for my 60th Birthday. I had spent close to 20 years there being stationed in Pearl Harbor aboard 7 different Los Angeles Class Submarines. That was not a tough 20 years. i saw the Pacific, and Most of the Countries around it. Hawaii looks to be my Favorite with Maui as my Retirement Home, I'll see. Now I just need to find someone to join me.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a great week in the Lagoon Tower. Check in was easy, the staff brought bags up to our room along with a crib. Our 1 king bed oceanview room was spacious enough for the 4 of us (1 child on the sofa bed) and we had a great view. The room felt quite dated, especially compared to photos we'd seen before visiting and it wasn't exactly spotlessly clean with thick layers on dust on top of the fridge & light shades. There were also rips in some of the bedsheets which was a little disappointing given how much we had spent on this accommodation. Maybe not a big issue for some, and to be honest it seemed to be the norm in Hawaii and then in California afterwards, but there is no recycling option! We only had a garbage bin in our kitchen, and don't get me started on those plastic bags with coffee whitener and sugar in them. It's very old school and completely unnecessary in this day and age when the environment is such a big topic. But hey doesn't appear to be in the US! anyway, the other thing we REALLY didn't enjoy was the daily sales pitch and push to attend a presentation where they try and sell you a condo. Can they not just ask you once and if you decline make a note on their computer system that you've already been asked? Back to the positives, we loved being right on Waikiki beach and having the lagoon, as well as all the shops and restaurants on your doorstep. I very much enjoyed the poke bowl at Tropics Grill. All the extras are very expensive eg 50USD for an hour on a pedal boat?! So factor that in if you're booking. We also attended the lu'au one evening which was worth it for the experience. With experiences like the lu'au or a spa treatment it's worth waiting until you're at the village before booking as you can get a money off voucher. We had previously booked things and then couldn't redeem the offer. All in all it was a very memorable trip and we had a great time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Resort facilities are great and room was amazing.Expect to be harassed at every chance and every day about attending their time share presentation regardless of your response the day before. Considering the cost of the place, this is so unprofessional.Everyday (several times they were 'out, try again later') you are made to go down to the concierge desk to collect water and get a spiel about the time share presentation. They phone the room during the day to ask you to attend. We had to take the phones off the hook as one of these unsolicited calls woke our sleeping toddler which as any parent knows, created a cranky and sleep deprived child meaning we had to change our plans that night for dinner as we were not subjecting other restaurant goers to our irritable child. To be fair i didn't even want to be around her...hahaAs mentioned it's a great resort and location however considering the price, we were really, really disappointed in being made to feel like we were there as sales targets rather than high paying guests.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This resort is huge. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment in the Lagoon Tower and loved having the space and the kitchen so we didn’t have to eat out all the time. They have fire works every Friday night too which was great. We also had a balcony which was a great spot to watch the beautiful sunsets.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Easy walk to shopping centre and more restaurants if you are looking to leave the resort. Waikiki beach close by.The water in Hawai'i is so warm and the salt heals skin - it's perfect.Many excursions from the hotel can be booked directly but pre holiday bookings are recommended to avoid disappointment.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This property is very busy folks.... yes its a tourist destination.... and its on the ocean/beach of course its gonna be busy.... there are tremendous views from your balcony....we had many rooms with many different views and trust me most were amazing... there are great restaurants for dinner and deli's if you prefer.. breakfast? it's your choice... there's shopping and across the street from the property is a great pizza joint , coffee shop and much more ... at less prices than the hotel probably... It's a great area with everything at your hand.. We enjoyed the Wiki Wiki market was really cool for sandwiches.... It's a great property... oh and the Red Lobster around the corner is good too... you gonna love it! It's nice to be close to everything

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Parking spaces are tight and you can’t even park on the first two levels, because of valet parking. The parking rate keeps going up every year. I think $45 a night of self-parking is a highway robbery.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hawaiian village is an amazing location. There a so many shops placed within the village that allows you an intimate shopping experience. Please use your island map or you may miss a quaint shop. There are so many activities available for your family, let me not forget the amazing sunsets and Friday night Fireworks.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful property. Helpful staff. The pool was nice. The gym was clean and enjoyable. We would stay there again anytime. Everything was within walking distance especially the beach. The room was nice

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is our second visit to the HHV. Always a great place to stay and you dont need to leave the resort if you dont want to as everything is there for you. It is a bit of a walk into the heart of Waikiki but at the same time a nice strol. My only complaint this time around was the resort fee of $41 PER DAY that is not mentioned until you check in. At $500 a night to stay there I find the resport fee a bit of a cash grab.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful resort what can I say. Its Hawaii so it's expensive but other then that everything is within walking distance. This resort has restaurants beach pool mall grocery store and lagoon all in walking distance

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Not the best experience. Small Room and very noisy, next to the elevator shaft. No maid service for 4 days. Promised a kitchenette delivered a microwave. Stuck with a tax and room bill when I am a owner of the time share. Charge you for every fee including the reservation fees that I did MADE ON LINE. Made me check out early before 10 AM and check in is not until 4 PM. A whole day gone out of your vacation.. NOT HAPPY. also No attempt for room upgrades as I am a Hilton Diamond Status not worth spending money to acquire points status. DISAPPOINTED OVERALL.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great hotel but rooms are small. Requested for a bigger room but rejectedFar from Waikiki Beach - the beach outside the hotel is not great for swimming with little kids that's why we always had to go to Waikiki Beach for a swim. They have a Lagoon to compensate the not-so-good beach they have. I love the Lagoon but recreational activities are pricey which is expected being in Honolulu
user_name:
imjgt
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I loved this place! It is well located, the facility is beautiful and I always felt welcome. The service is grant and I especially enjoy having supper and listening to music each evening. Great beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A solid 4.5 stars. We stayed in the Lagoon tower and were upgraded to a far superior room than we had booked (2 bdrm/2 bath/ocean view/kitchen/living room) - it goes without saying that the suite was 5 stars. Immaculate, modern, spacious, elegantly decorated with a well appointed full kitchen (dishwasher, full oven, microwave, garburator, full sized fridge, everything necessary for basic cooking and eating including silverware, mugs, glasses, etc.) This tower was definitely quieter than others and had a short check-in time (we had no wait at 9 pm). The concierge and other staff were personable, friendly and attentive at all times. We have been to Waikiki several times with children and stayed in a variety of places along the strip. This was a first 'resort experience' in Waikiki and I doubt we will ever choose anything but this. The property is far enough away from the strip that it isn't completely overrun with crowds. Most people on site seemed to be actual hotel guests which builds in a safety and community feel. The grounds are immaculate and gorgeous, with a variety of shops (including ABC), restaurants and activities (music, fireworks, luau, etc.) We felt comfortable letting our teens wander by themselves. We enjoyed Lappert's icecream and coffee, Hatsuhana Japanese food, teppanyaki (a highlight) and the Tapa open air bar at night for live music. Getting to the strip is a bit of walk, but we easily took Uber from the designated Uber pickup location (it's approx a $9USD ride to mid-strip). It's a 10 minute walk to the International Marketplace grocery to stock up, but the on-site ABC has an impressive selection of tourist needs including fresh food and dairy, alcohol, salads, fruit, coffee. The lagoon in the front is perfect. It's drained and cleaned often (we saw staff walking around it with a garbage bag and metal detectors early morning for cleanup). We will definitely stay here again and encourage other families to do so. I took .5 stars off for:- Lack of recycling (I know this is a Hawaii issue, but perhaps some small changes can be made to reduce water bottle and disposable toiletries waste, such as water filters in the rooms or on the floors with water jugs, and soap/shampoo dispensers). It felt terrible throwing away piles of water bottles and plastic). - The beach right in front of the property has coral/stones. Not a huge deal as it's a short walk to better sand, but it's good to know- The parking lot next door to the lagoon by the marina has a small homeless camp set up. There is no locked gate to the parking lot. We were never bothered or concerned for our safety, but it was an unnerving and sad discovery. Again, this is not a Hilton issue, but as a parent it's a good thing to note. I realize that Oahu has a big homeless issue and they are trying to help people. - You have to rent beach chairs and umbrellas. Towels are available for guest use. - The elevators are incredibly busy at checkout times - they send a notice about it. We waited for elevators with our luggage for about 15 minutes as we were on a lower floor and people checking out above us filled them up with luggage at this time. We realized that sending a teen down, then having them take the elevator back up to our floor allowed us to get on into an empty elevator, in order to work our way to the lobby. All in all, this was a fantastic resort!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Room was not cool enough. Had to call and was on hold for 45 minutes before anyone would pick up let alone being hung up on the 1st time. Simple request to have the room cool down to 65 degrees is not that hard. Bathroom shower curtain had stains and smell of mildew. Beds were uncomfortable as the felt worn and haven't been replaced in years. As a loyal Hilton daimond member you get treated the same as regular members. No need to be a loyal member anymore. Hilton just wants to nickel and dime you and charge exorbitant fees for a low level of service

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed on the 5th floor, ocean view.The building is a bit old but the room was clean and spacious.We saw fireworks on Friday night. It's amazing since we could see the launch location.I strongly recommend you to stay!Thank you.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Staff was very good. In my opinion, there weren’t enough valet people working. Several times I had to wait 5-10 mins. I’m gonna say 60 percent of the time, staff was fast in getting our car. Hotel did have an activity office which made things convenient.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The room was great but this resort is way too busy. It felt like a burden to try and go to the pools because you knew they were super crowded and you were unlikely to get a chair. If you are looking for relaxing, I recommend looking to for property.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I loved staying here so much, it was so comfy and I felt like I could snuggle up with my bae and have some fun in privacy! ;)It also had an amazing view of the pure blue ocean, and easy access to the beach! I would totally use Hilton again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower on 7/19. The location is awesome. The rooms are a little dated. The rooms need renovation in a next few years to keep up with The Grand Islander. Location, location......

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our second time at the facility and it was terrific. The facility is crowded but we knew that going in and adjusted our times at the gym to avoid the crowds. The pool is also very crowded but the lagoon and beach are nearby so we opted for those instead. This is Waikiki so expect crowds and adjust your time a bit and you can still have a great time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a 3 bedroom penthouse and everything about the unit was good. Great views. View of the luau. Nice pools. Friday fireworks. The only issue was the unit we had 2472 was next to the elevator. The noise was loud and constant. I see why it was an rci exchange. If i had paid 700 a night i would have been furious. But i also feel like i should have been informed before my stay. I might not have booked had i known. Cool resort/great room vs. 7 days limited sleep.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Always stay at the Lagoon Tower every year, love the location. Also enjoy the lagoon for soaking up the sun and playing in the water. Wish I could visit more than once a year. Every morning I sit on the balcony and watch the sun come up, a beautiful feeling.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Loved the one bedroom ocean view in the Kalia Tower. Everything was up to par except the bathroom which was tiny and very out of place.Love the restaurants, shops and amenities on site.Check in was 5 minutes on July 4th. Very impressed.The biggest downfall of this resort is that there is nothing preventing locals using the pools and amenities. It was apparent that many were parking in the garage and walking over to the pool and not staying on property. The pools were very crowded. If they could get a policy in place that would restrict the pools to guests on property it would be excellent.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Fantastic family vacation! Beautiful location with outstanding service. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We were very impressed with the abundance of amenities. The restaurants and shops were great. We were fortunate enough to have the pleasure of two nights of outstanding firework displays over our Fourth of July vacation week!! It was a very memorable vacation!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were a family of seven members which included a 90 year old and an autistic 25 year old. Our stay in the Penthouse apartment of the Lagoon tower in the Hilton Hawaiian Village was most enjoyable. The views from the balcony were fabulous. The apartment was clean and comfortable. The staff were very helpful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Loved the unit beautiful view, within walking distance of restaurants, shopping and water activities. Staff very was courteous and helpful. Easy hassle free check in and out. Definitely would recommend.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Property was off the most desirable beach location and the beach was rocky. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Many activities and restaurants were available in the property complex. There was nothing relaxing about the available amenities.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What a great experience we had with HGV at Hawaiian Village. The rooms are so huge and felt more like a condo. The kids enjoyed all the extra space as well. You can't go wrong with this property! Mahalo

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations in Lagoon Tower 364 for 1 week. It’s a 1 bedroom suite overlooking the great lawn, Lagoon and in the distance, beach. Gorgeous spacious rooms, comfortable bed, kitchen has everything you need, bathroom is great and enters from the main area.Resort is beautiful, pools beautiful, and service is wonderful. You don’t really need to leave, but when you do, concierge or activities desk are very helpful. Resort has arrangement with Charley’s taxi for airport and places like Pearl Harbor. Hanauma Bay is gorgeous and worth the visit! Walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and downtown Waikiki. The resort is busy and family oriented, but this adds to the atmosphere. Try some of the activities like lei-making or hula lessons! They have a cool fireworks on Fri nights too.The HGV side has its own check-in and lounge if you arrive early or leave late. They have additional activities as well, like bingo.We had an outstanding time and would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This property is in Hilton Hawaiian Village but under Hilton Grand Vacations. Newly built and well maintained they are like individual apartment style residences in the famous Hilton Hawaiian Village with access to all different pools, hot pools and other amenities to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. Lot of options for food and entertainment in Hilton Hawaiian Village with easy access to shops and restaurants and eateries. Good customer service and you will enjoy your stay with family if staying for a week or longer in this new property from Hilton Grand Vacations.
user_name:
Mitrasl
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have been Lagoon Tower owners for 15 years (2-bedrm overview and 1-bdrm garden view, then trade-up to 2 weeks of 3-bdrm penthouse) We wouldn't keep trading up if we do not enjoy coming here! Our daughters and 5 grandchildren look forward to coming back the following year immediately after we return home!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location, corner room suite had the best view. Clean property. Rooms were spacious and updated. Customer service and overall staff at the property were friendly and quick to respond to our needs. Great pool and beach access.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our 7th trip to hawaii. We have always stayed at Hilton properties and have the best time as a family. Lots to do, warm ocean water. Food can be a bit pricey, but Safeway and walmart deliver groceries to the hotel. Come experience what my family fell in love with.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the lagoon tower. The room was big and clean.Service was disappointing. The wait for shave ice was ridiculously long, the beach towel hut was not open until 9:30, the staff did not acknowledge or greet us when we got to the counter to rent the aqua cycle.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I’ve had great experiences with Hilton Grand Vacations until this stay. Tiny room, poor service, and overpriced. I would stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village again but not this HGV. Even some of the basics like a final bill, ice machine, and a desk in my room were lacking.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Wow ,what an amazing hotel. Perfectly situated in central Waikiki the Grand Waikikian offers everything you could want in a fully contained apartment. Modern and quiet you have everything you could need for an amazing vacation. The hotel grounds are beautiful with a brilliant pool . The Hilton village has access to great restaurants, several pools and a lagoon. The best part is the beach. Absolutely magical ! A brilliant hotel - we are already planning our next holiday.The only downer is ( not surprising ) is water sports are really expensive. Spa is great !  · Water sports are really expensive. Not surprising but still a negative. The staff were brilliant and so helpful.”

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Well what a place lagoon 4 pools bars restaurants everything you could want but let me tell you the bell boy on arrival less than helpful secondly $40 fee a day to use the facilities after you’ve already ready paid for your room then you go down for a continental breakfast too find out it’s $39 per person that’s US $ works out too $123 for breakfast give me a break this place is a giant cash cow you pay the whole way so be aware it’s not all what it’s cracked up to be overrated for me

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Lagoon tower was GREAT! Clean, convenient and staff were friendly and very helpful. Rosalinda at the check-in counter was the best. We had trouble with our credit card when we first go there and she was so patient and helpful while we got everything straightened out. All the pictures you see on the website represent the property completely. Beautiful scenery. Breakfast buffet although pricey was very good - so was breakfast at the Tropic Bar & Grill. Pizza at the Round table was good and the ice cream at Lapperts was delicious. With all the guests staying here we never had to wait more than a minute or so for the elevator. Did most of our shopping at the ABC stores (more than 1 on the resort property) and Honolulu surf company. Other stores tended to be on the pricey side. If you're staying at the Lagoon tower and you are setting up tours with transporation pick up tell the tour company youre staying at the Grand Waikkian which is attached to the Lagoon tower and your pick up with be either at the tower or a 2 min walk away. If they pick you up at the hilton hawiian village bus stop its a bit of a walk to get there. Mattress was very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again if given the opportunity.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Everything was beautiful kids loved it only wished the slides were open longer . But other then that rooms were clean and big so much room for the kids to have there own space . Lagoon pool was handy as well

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here for a family staycation (we live on island). Everything was great. My only complaint is that the pillows and bed weren't that comfortable for me, but everyone else said they were comfortable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a great time at the Lagoon tower of the Hawaiian Hilton. We had a 2 bedroom apartment and had access to all facilities. We were a family of 6 and had plenty of space in the unit. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed her for 4 nights and was our first HGVC rental. Would highly recommend. We had a 2 bedroom and thoroughly enjoyed having the kitchen, living room, and separate bedrooms. Patio had beautiful view of the harbor and ocean

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent great view and only small potential problem for Hilton on threshold on new sliding doors to lanais. Extremely clean and will stocked for my needs. Love the staff. Consultation was very helpful to me.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beware when you book your room at this hotel. They have several towers on property that are not close to the water. I booked online in a “Lagoon Tower” which was supposed to be on the Lagoon by the ocean. All of my confirmation emails stated Lagoon in the heading.When I arrived, they placed me in a tower overlooking the top of their parking deck. Both the GM and the tower manager said it was my fault for not booking correctly. They said that even though my confirmation read Lagoon Tower, when you click through the actual room description states a different tower. Having never been to this property in the past, how could one know there are several towers and which one is which? Apparently the customer is always wrong when they book at this location.Do yourself a favor and book Marriott properties when in Honolulu so you don’t go through this bait and switch!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Accommodations were excellent. When anything was needed the response was immediate. Quality room, quality service, best of all worlds. Amazing grounds and so much within walking distance. I would highly recommend this resort!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We first visited the resort in 2009 as a couple on the hotel side and enjoyed it, despite the old decor and condition of the Diamond Head Tower (I was told it has not been renovated since then!). This was our first trip back with kids as a family and we stayed on the vacation rental/timeshare side (Lagoon Tower) which we booked via Chase Reward Vacations. We were fortunate to be assigned the 22nd floor and had a 2 bedroom 2 bath booked, which gave us a very spacious condo to enjoy for a week with a view of the marina and ocean. The reservation came with daily cleaning service and pool towels were plentiful at all the locations (though quite worn out). I would say overall it is a super busy like a popular cruise, people are Everywhere so don't expect quiet and peace like the North or West Shore. There are decent restaurants though very pricey (we only ate one time on campus and chose to cook every meal except our first). On resort Starbucks is very popular and expensive (30% more than CA). Pools were chilly in April, but I imagine they would be perfect in the summer. The kids' pool with waterfalls, slides, etc. was literally teeming with children; like way TOO many for me to enjoy being in the water LOL ;-). As a result my kids, who were in there for hours at a time, had a skin rash after a week in the chemical laden pool; they had a ton of fun though so probably to them it was worth it. Lounge chairs were sometimes hard to come by, but if you were patient you'd eventually get one. The beach sand is gritty and tough, so go past the dock/pier where it is much much softer. We indulged in the submarine ride which was a good one time experience and found cheaper fares online, which the staff were willing to match. Overall a cheerful fun atmosphere despite the crowds and costs. One major advantage is the easy walk to Waikiki shopping and eating. Island Vintage Shave Ice stand is truly delicious; fresh fruit flavors that I dare say are better than Matsumoto's (not the mochi rice balls though, tiny and dry). Here are some tips for condo dwellers who plan to cook:1) ask for more plate ware and an extra water pitcher. Filtered water was downstairs and we used our 2 pitchers to avoid paying for bottled water (plus the wasteful plastic).2) kitchen is not as equipped as Marriott Ko Olina in case you are comparing the two. Not as many appliances to choose from or space to cook etc. you will have to make do with an 8" frying pan (I had to cook pancakes for 3 kids individually Gah!), but if you don't mind being creative it's not terrible.3) Laundry, while not in the suite like Ko Olina, was easily available on the floor. 4) Grabbing a taxi/lyft/etc is easy to get to a decent grocery store (Safeway, Whole Foods is about 10 mins with the traffic) and much better prices. We saved by not renting a car since there is plenty to do around the Waikiki area and we have been to Oahu many times before.5) Ala Moana Shopping Center is a 15 min walk and there are many food courts to choose from. The special Japanese focused one has every type of food prepared so you don't have to cook at all. We walked there and took a taxi back to save some $.We enjoyed ourselves plenty and had a positive experience, but upon reflection we will return to Ko Olina on the West Shore for the quieter resort and better equipped condo. The only thing Ko Olina really lacks is a decent hotel spa in case you want that for your vacay. Aloha!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great facility, lots to do, but very expensive. As an owner, they should include parking and “Kamahaina” pricing on beach rentals.The staff at the Concierge desk were not very friendly. I felt the International tourists, especially the Japanese visitors were given priority service.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our accommodations were very nice. Full kitchen, two bedrooms/bathrooms, and our villa was spacious and comfortable. The beds were especially comfortable and there was lots of closet and drawer space. Staff couldn’t have been nicer- everyone we encountered thanked us for choosing the resort. Littles had a great time at the man made lagoon, and pool areas and landscaping were beautiful and maintained. Lots of choices for cuisine with many restaurants and snack venues, favorite coffee stores and wonderful shopping. My family is looking forward to years of wonderful vacations here!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It was all the little things that made this Resort amazing, the variety of eateries, the boutique shops the open spaces, the beach, the Submarine ride, the Trolleys out front to catch to Alamoana Shopping Center or Market Place for $2 and so much more, my only critique would be the 'check in' process was very chaotic, we stayed in the Rainbow Tower which has amazing views next time I will book the The Ali'i Tower which has its own check in!. but otherwise AMAZING! can't wait to go back.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a beautiful resort! Probably the most lavish in the area; however, we discovered bed bugs the first night we stayed! Check very carefully when you arrive: between the mattresses, in the corners of the bedskirt. The management gave us a different room and did not seem surprised!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: First of all, I stayed at Hilton grand vacation Lagoon tower. It was one bedroom with almost full kitchen and nice size living room with balcony. Very spacious and clean, also pretty impressed that kitchen had almost everything needed (even rice cooker). Although I live in Hawaii, and had a lot of cheaper options to stay as an active duty soldier (like Hale Koa right next to Hawaiian village for $150 a night), I wanted to spend little more to show my sister who visited me from Canada some good resort experience. I stayed 3 nights and the last night I stayed, we got a burglar came into our room and stole my camera bags with wallets and car key fob in them, and my sister's purses with her and her daughter's passports, wallets with all their identifications on the day she was supposed to fly back to Canada.Long story short, after spending all day dealing with police, embassy and TSA at the airport, she had to spend tons money to change her plane tickets, and we lost over 6K worth stuff (my camera and lenses were more than 4K) while this burglar went out and made so many transactions with our credit cards overnight. Yes, burglary can happen anywhere, but I'm writing this review 40 days after the incident because I'm very disappointed with the hotel. I spoke to the manager, she told me that hotel's insurance company will contact me. I got in touch with them a week later. The insurance company then got back to me that hotel had no fault on this so no compensation will be given.  First of all, Hilton grand vacation doesn't have a key scanner at the elevator. Which means anyone can come to any floors. Also they said they don't have cctv in the hallway which It's hard to believe...not even the elevator area?  secondly, the person broke into the room while we are sleeping! this could have been much worth problem than losing some cameras and wallets. To me this is so obvious that we (two asian ladies with small children) were the target by someone who works there, thinking 1. no man in the room 2. they look like Japanese tourists so they will be gone before they can do anything, which I heard later that this happens a lot downtown to tourists and they can hardly charge anyone even if police catch them..because they are already out of country so they can't work with the case. (additional statements or going to court)  Obviously there was some kind of security bleach on hotel part while they charge me $1535.00 for 3 nights (this include $40 resort fee a day and $45 parking fee a day!). I don't mine spend money for good service and quality accommodation but I also expect they would handle something like this better. I ask question about case to the manager, she tells me to talk to insurance company who doesn't respond my email for over 3 weeks. Very disappointing!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had an amazing time here! This is our favorite place to stay! We love the pools and restaurants at the the village. There are amazing pools and activities to do! We highly recommend this place and we will be back soon!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Spent the week before Easter at the Lagoon Towers. Got a room with a great view of the Ala Moana beach and marina. The accommodations were super, the Hilton Hawaiian Village area had lots of places for shopping, dining and entertainment. It was a brief walk from the hotel area to the Waikiki beach area. Very friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is our second time at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. You can’t beat the location on Oahu/Waikiki. The resort is beautifully landscaped with several pools and beach/lagoon access. The staff was friendly and service was excellent. The village includes many shops as well as restaurants. You could spend your entire week just at the resort and have an enjoyable time. That said, please be aware that you will pay for much more than the price of your room. Hawaii is expensive no matter where you go, but nowhere more than this resort. Despite a resort charge of $45/day, you will pay for renting beach items like paddle boards. You will pay $175 for breakfast for a family of 4 and more than that for lunch or dinner onsite. We opted to go to the IHOP or Starbucks instead for breakfast and we were out and about during lunch and some dinners. And if you have a car, which you need on Oahu unless you plan to book tours all over the island, be prepared to pay over $50/day to valet park your car and about $7-10 less to park it yourself. The resort charge covers things like DVD rentals and two waters per day, but for $45/day, I think parking at least should be included. Further, at least for our family, we spent most days exploring the island. I am not going to be renting DVDs to watch in my room when there is so much to see and do. We have stayed here twice and will likely stay here again if we return. We were well aware of the expense having stayed here before. As long as you are aware of what you are financially in for, this is a top notch luxury resort and excellent choice to stay at while in Oahu.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: First time to stay here and very impressive. My daughter enjoyed playing in the pools a lot. Very close to beach! Great view!! It's quite than I expected during the night. Easy checkout! Definitely will come back again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Loved it here! So perfect! We stayed in the Kalia tower of the Hilton Grand Vacation. Location was perfect- right next to the kids pool. Then there’s the lagoon for more water activities. Then there was the beach. All by our hotel. The suite was prefect with everything you need in the kitchen (microwave, fridge, dishes, utensils, etc). There’s also table and chairs for you to eat at inside and outside on balcony. Room was spacious and clean. We can’t wait to come back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Having a horrible experience with these people. I booked and paid for a 7 day stay, phone call was recorded and thought we were on our way to a great graduation celebration with my family. This is the 4th time I stay at the Hilton and have brought them so much business through referrals. My sister in law even got married here due to our recommendation. So far, you can directly tie me to 60 nights spent there between fiends and family. So I decided to join and that’s where my problems started. Everything was confirmed and now they tell me it was a mistake. Recording was pulled and verified. Still no solution. No one manager or Regional has reached out to attempt to resolve. Please Help! Need a District Manager to make this right!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Too much people in the pool area. They have too many towers and they dont add any more pools or hot tub. Getting in the hot tub is hard to get into. The front desk has a little attitude problem. I feel like if your not Asian they dont pay attention to you. Staff seems short staff at night. I stand in the lagoon tower was very nice to be close to beach area, but the elevator was horrible. The staff uses the same elevator so coming down was hard when they have all their equipment and these no room to get in.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This beautiful resort made our trip extra special and memorable. We had a spacious 2 bedroom suite with 2 nice sized bathrooms, 2 balconies with lagoon and ocean view and an extra large living room area. The full size kitchen was stocked with utensils, and the dining table was large enough for all six of us. Although we didn't use it because we couldn't resist the balcony view which easily accommodated 4 chairs and a large table. One small little thing which could have been better was that we were registered as 4 adults and 2 children, so they should have known we would be needing the fold out sofa bed? When we arrived we had to pull out the bed, and the mattress didn't have linen. We had to find someone and ask for bedding. A staff member returned quickly with two sheets, one blanket and one pillow. I was told "Here you are". After a long flight with 2 small kids we weren't really in the mood to make a bed. The sheets didn't fit and we were one pillow short. Not a big deal, but that was the only complaint with our stay. Everything else far exceeded our expectations. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I got several text messages asking if there was anything we needed. The entire resort was clean and updated- it IS absolutely gorgeous! It was by far our favorite resort!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We've been visiting Hawaii annually for the past 2 decades and stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Lagoon Tower for the past 7 years once we became parents. We chose the Lagoon Tower as the units offer the amenities of a condo such as kitchen and laundry plus the offerings of a full service hotel ... housekeeping.This year we stayed in unit 461. We're extremely pleased with the room and housekeeping service. We will be booking for our next stay in 2020 for the kids March break.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The property is located on the beach as part of the Hilton resort. Our rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and efficient. There are fireworks every Friday evening and we had a great view from our balcony. Our only criticism relates to the evening noise coming from the Hilton. There seemed to be a band at the Hilton pool playing until 11pm every night. So no sleep before 11!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We really enjoyed our time here. It was a beautiful location with a lot of options nearby. Our room was nice and clean with prompt service when we needed more items. We didn't have issues with the elevators as other have noted. Having access to free laundry machines is nice-just bring your own detergent. It wasn't a quiet area if that is what you are looking for-but that didn't bother us at all. I recommend taking an Uber, etc to WalMart when you get there to have food/snacks. Food isn't cheap in that area, especially for a family of four. Overall, a great experience!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Vacation was great until the last two days. The last two days I was awakened by a guy on a microphone right outside my window. They had an outdoor conference or party. Came on vacation to relax and sleep in.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a gorgeous resort to stay at when in Oahu! The amenities of the shops and restaurants and the landscape design of the property make for a tropical paradise within a a paradise.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is the third time I have stayed here and enjoy it every time. The location is fantastic and those who stay here have full access to everything in Hilton Hawaiian Village. The accommodations are spacious and clean. Staff are friendly and accommodating. We had an oceanfront two bedroom that had two lanais overlooking the lagoon. The full kitchen is well equipped. We had a gorgeous view of the sunsets over the Pacific each night and each morning we got up early to watch the sunrise over Waikiki. We had a perfect view from our lanai for the Friday fireworks over the lagoon. I can’t wait till We go back again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a great property with everything that you need on this single campus. There is recreation, shopping, dining, and entertainment. It is truly a unique property and one that I would highly recommend.
user_name:
David Russell R
Spring, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hotel location and facilities were exellent - we were close to great shops and beaches. The room was unbelievable - spacious and immaculate with everything you would ever need. The staff were amazing - super warm and friendly.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Apartment was bigger & better than expected, would had a great view to see the fireworks, it was central to and easy to get around, the village has everything you need without having to go very far it you don't need to, would stay again

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We loved staying at the Hilton Grand Vacation resort. The location was fabulous. You can walk to the beach, to restaurants and stores. The rooms are huge and have full kitchens. The lagoon is amazing. We are coming back next year with our grandchildren.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful resort, so much to do. Excellent for families. Would recommend the Hilton Hawaiian Resort as an excellent vacation resort. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The property is well maintained and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a great family spot where you can get everything you need. Right on the beach and walking distance to the city. Great food spots and fun things to do. Get a car and head to the North shore or the other side of the island.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This place was great. Family friendly. Ocean beach was great. Private lagoon was great. Definitely would stay again. I stayed for 3 nights, could have stayed for 5. I didn’t even use the pools because the lagoon and ocean were just as good. Highly recommend this resort.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The facility is showing its wear. Could use a little updating.The staff was very nice, accommodations were satisfactory, expected a little more luxury. They do want to sell you - wasn't quite as nice as when we stayed there 5 years ago.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have stayed at Hilton Hawaiian Village many times and this trip happened to be our first in the Lagoon Tower - garden side. For a relaxing stay on Oahu, this was the most disruptive stay because of excessive noise.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Visit to Oahu with the family -- it was fabulous. We stayed in a PH 3BR and enjoyed ourselves tremendously. The fireworks were a special treat. The accommodations were relaxed and spacious. While the furniture and carpet were slightly (and I mean only slightly) worn, it did not detract from the spectacular views or the inviting activities. We had a blast and would come back again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Close to amenities, stayed atLagoon Tower. Close to the lagoon, pools and ocean. You can watch the surfers from the balgony. Great staff, especially Don Rowley. He helped with tours and dinner reservations. At the lagoon, they charge for lounges we bought one at Walmart and gave it to a local surfer when we left.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Absolutely gorgeous resort. I stayed in two bedroom which was very large and comfortable. Great location on Waikiki beach with lots of restaurants nearby. Resort staff very friendly and helpfull. We had balcony overlooking ocean that was breathtaking

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We enjoy this hotel in Waikiki. It’s right on the beach with beautiful views. It’s convenient, walking distance, to just about anything you want to do. Restaurants are easily accessible. The pools are beautiful and very enjoyable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I loved the location of this resort. On the beach and minutes fro m he city. Plenty on site to keep you busy. I was there with my husband and would grandly consider returning to this same hotel. Staff were very friendly with chatting about local news and suggestions.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Here for business meetings. Weather is great especially considering it is WINTER in the Midwest. Getting lots of walking in. Couple of hitches with feathers in room when we requested feather free room due to allergies. Pools are not heated and can be quite refreshing. Few eating choices on the resort. They are good but expensive

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton Hawaiian Village is a home away from home. This is the longest stay of our family of 4 for 10 nights.
