We haven't had enough chance to the facilities they offered because we choose to stay in our room and spend more quality time and mostly roaming around Oahu island and still we enjoyed our laid back vacation. We really appreciate the value of our time Hilton Grand Vacation has to offer. It is sad to say good bye but looking forward to come back soon!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The hotel is ok, could use upgrades. Bed not great, much too soft, I'm guessing old matresses. The area, aka the village is cool, lots of restaurants and stores. Hotel staff is good,and hotel is clean.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is amazing. The accommodatios were beautifil and spacious. The view was unbelievable. There were restaurants of every type imagineable and shops for any wants or needs. Therewere multiple pools and cabanas for rent. The beach was just steps away. There was an on-site luau but we chose to go to a different one. Transporation was very convenint. This was my favorute vacation ever.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our family of four stayed at the Lagoon Tower in the Hilton Hawaiian Village which made our stay completely relaxing & totally enjoyable, providing us with the total resort experience. Staff are always helpful & friendly. Everything you need is in the one place.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are a family of six staying in the Lagoon Tower on the Diamond Head Side. We were/are here from Dec 29-Jan 5. The luau was on the great lawn for the holidays as well as the New Year’s Eve Party. We were able to watch both from our balcony. New Years Eve fireworks were viewed from our balcony as well as so it was perfect! Short walk to lagoon, beach, and paradise pool (the one with the water slides). Just across the driveway is an ice cream shop, ABC store, and tons of restaurants and shopping. Rooms are spacious. Master bath has a bathtub and shower head within it plus a Toto toilet. Second bathroom had a tub/shower as well. Laundry is free and on each floor. Balcony has a table and four chairs plus inside there is another round table and four chairs. Kitchen has two stools that pull up to the bar to eat so plenty of seating. PlayStation 3 in living room and huge tv. Great for kids.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in both the Lagoon Tower and the Grand Waikikian tower. Room in the lagoon tower was bigger and in my opinion a better layout. The Grand Waikikian room was more modern and had the price benefit of in room laundry. The resort has everything you need to relax and enjoy such a lively location. Bus stops close by. Walking distance to shopping and the beach is right there. Would totally recommend this to anyone. One of the best locations I have stayed at. All the services you would want are at this resort

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: As always it is a great experience from start to finish at Hilton Hawaiian Village. We will defiantly be returning to enjoy the awesome atmosphere, weather and locals! It is a short walk to get anywhere and everyone is always happy to help you out! Mahalo!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: stayed here for 8 day before the marathon. We stayed here 2 years ago and got roughly the same room but on a lower floor. They did accomodate my request for a diamond head view and since we were checking in on a Thursday we couldn't get a higher floor which worked out. Before arriving I sent several packages from Amazon to the hotel. They were delivered however upon checking in with the resort manager they couldn't find the one with the snacks, gopro, chargers etc in it. They had my small packages but somehow they managed to lose a big box. I checked in with them a week after it arrived and they said they couldn't find it even though the tracking shows it was delivered. Several back and forth and because it was over thanksgiving that slowed things down. Basically they didn't take ownership of it. I asked for some sort of compensation since I was out money and had to quickly reorder the items again so it'd arrive in time. When I got there the resort manager who I was dealing with the whole time kinda brushed it me off. Maybe shes used to dealing with tourists from another country? I'm not sure but basically i needed to spend even more time dealing with this so they can start an insurance claim...really? just deal with the facts you have. I'm still dealing with this after i've come back as I did not want to spend another minute on it.Other then that, the elevators were troublesome. As I said we were on the 5th floor so we could just take the stairs down. Some ladies were complaining that they waited 30 minutes...not sure where they got from complaining to the front desk.Pool boys were cool with the towels and the pool itself was great, the kids didn't want to leave. We'll probably be back again in 2 years however we are looking elsewhere as this is the 2nd time there has been a problem at HHV. I'm not sure if its due to management and the lack of training but given the price they charge, it should be pretty damn good. Oh yeah the bell boys were awesome. Parking is expensive but honestly its Waikiki, way more convenient having a car. Only ate at blue water shrimp on site otherwise it was foodland and take out.Laundry was convenient..used it every other day. The dishwashers are horrible and we used it mainly as a drying rack..the place is getting dated, hope they have plans to refurbish.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It would have been a perfect stay if not for the Suite we had was on Level 4. The resort is beautiful and very convenient, great location and plenty of pools for everyone.Beach was great and watching the sunset from the beach was such a wonderful experience. We also got to watch the fireworks on Friday evening at 7.45pm. Go earlier if you want to get good front seats.Resort Manager - Kaoru Robinson was very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very good resort hotel with lots of facilities, restaurants, pools etc. Good for families (we had a suite) which was great for our young adult kids. Some parts of the complex were getting a bit tired - but not a concern. Only minor downside is that it is not in "central Waikiki"

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The hotel seemed a bit dated not only did it seem like our room was ran down, other hotels around the property had issues and broken down features such as the hot tubs, door knobs, and the shower head. Our room wasn't horrible however cooking was a pain the kitchen was extremely small and you cannot open the stove without it rubbing on the fridge. To further difficulties with the oven you are providided no pot holders. Being an owner is supposed to get you small discounts and deals. It is however super inconvenient when you bring it up to surrounding businesses they second guess you and ask for proof. Which is fine except for the pamphlet to prove you're a member is large and inconvenient to bring around.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I would have given this a 5 out of 5 if the food there hadn’t been so expensive.We arrived really early in the morning and they gave us an early check-in only a few hours later at no charge.Right on the beach, our view was beautiful.Staff are friendly and helpful.Has a good gym.The food is expensive but there are enough places around that it doesn’t bother too much.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent 9 nights at the Hilton Grand Vacations at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We were fortunate enough to get a two bedroom suite with kitchen from HGV overlooking the Paradise Pool (Lagoon Tower). Room was in excellent condition with everything you could need for an extended stay. It was great to be able to do your own meals at your own times with the kitchen. Our only complaint was that the pools were not heated - I think the Pacific was actually warmer. If coming back to Oahu, would definitely plan to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: stayed in a 2 bedroom with kitchenette.4 adults and 2 children.Location- great- close to the beach- shops and including restaurants.staff were friendly and were ready to assist when questioned.easy access to get around- walked everywhere.It also helps if the weather is fine- which it was.All in all a great time was had by all.would i go back there - YES..

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed four nights in the Lagoon Tower and four in the Kalia tower. Loved both, but found the Kalia Tower a better ocean view and a bit quieter. Didnt rent a car, easy to take trolley, bus or uber and save the nightly parking fee. Food is expensive, but options are available.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We used Hawaiian Village as the last stopover for a week following 6 weeks in USA. We love the location and facilities of the Lagoon tower. The accommodation is excellent. We had 2 x 2 bedrooms for 8 and 9 days. Very pleased all round.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location is great; however, the parking fee is too high. The water was too cold in the resort pools so my daughter had to swim in the lagoon was warmer water. The bellman wasn't nice once he realized I was planning to park across the street at the military parking facility. I believe the $43 self / $50 valet parking is too high.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent a week at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The first couple days were at the Lagoon Towers, which were nice -- a good kitchen, a decent view, right by the lagoon. We enjoyed our time there, but the last several days we moved over to the Kalia Suites, which are older, but we just loved. GREAT view of the ocean, a bit quieter, it's own quiet pool (away from the kids), a Starbucks in the lobby. A bit smaller, but but we thought it was a great hotel, and the staff at the Kalia Suites seemed to have it more together than at the other hotels in the Village.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The ocean front rooms in the Lagoon Tower are fabulous. The views are great and well worth the points (if you are using points). If you have the Hilton Grand Vacations app on your phone, you can use it to text them when you need any supplies. We used it to request an extra set of towels, some face towels and garbage bags and each time we made the request by text, we got an immediate response. It makes it easier than having to call guest services.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I traded in thru RCI and I loved this place! You never know what you will get when you trade in thru RCI but we were so lucky to be on the 15th floor in a corner unit with a view of the ocean. The room was fantastic. Clean, modern, well maintained and quiet! The view for the fireworks on Friday night was AMAZING!The communication before arrival was good and on arrival the staff was so pleasant and welcoming it really was great. Because it is $50 a night to park a car every night we did not rent a car for the week but we did go thru National at the hotel to rent a car twice for the day. Average price $110 a day for that. Worth it to drive around the island.Lots of stores (ABC) to get food, beer and souvenirs nearby and some restaurants. Went to Tropics Bar & Grill twice and the food was good. We didn’t do any pools or the lagoon but they looked nice. We used Lyft to get around and that worked good.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: As a timeshare owner at the Lagoon Tower, I have always loved my stay there. We have been many times over the years. This is a great place for a vacation with many things to do. There is direct beach access, swimming pool, good food nearby and easy transportation options.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Big village , good bars, nice atmosphere and beach. Enjoyed Friday fireworks. Good shopping places within Village at very reasonable prices, very convenient. No good restaurant for good lunch or dinner. Staff not very helpful. Very poor experience with National car rental at the hotel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: awesome family vacation, we been looking forward for this trip , 2 sons 2 grandkid 1 daughter in law / mother in law everyone was not disappointed , it is an experience that we will always cherish just like all the other hilton grand club my family been to , las vegas, orlando, big island ...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We’ve been vacationing at the Hilton Hawaiian Village every year for the past 6 years. We have been extremely happy with the amenities and convenience of the resort. It is a very family friendly resort. I’d like to especially thank the Hotel manager at Lagoon Tower, Angie, for going above and beyond to fulfil our request for a room change. She was very professional and courteous in all of our communication. Thank you, Angie, for making our vacation outstanding! We would not stay anywhere else on Oahu.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We've stayed in the Rainbow Tower of the Hilton before but not the Lagoon Tower. The front desk staff were so good! You check in at the Grand Waikikiian. They got for us a really nice one bedroom high up on the 22nd floor facing the sunset and Magic Island.It was so nice - we spent quite a bit of time on the balcony since the sun was only on there from 4-6 pm. Looking at the floor plan, there are not very many rooms per floor and 24 floors. In fact, there is only one 1 bedroom facing west on each floor so we were indeed fortunate. Another reason was that there had been some major electrical issues going on so there was a generator going 24x7 on the east side - would have hated that noise. Also, the east side of the tower overlooks the big green lawn area - where they often have weddings and convention events. We had the Dentist ADA convention going on.What we like about the entire Hilton Hawaiian Village area is the location at the end of Waikiki at one end and close to the Ala Moana Mall and Magic Island the other direction. Perfect for getting around walking. No need for a car here - and you can also take The Bus - which is great and easy to do!The room itself was quite nice and fully furnished. Extremely quiet as well which was good since lots of families with babies and strollers here - but we didn't hear them. And everyone at HGVC was so so friendly and helpful. Not used to that! We also liked the ability to go to all the different pools (only the Alii Tower is not available). We enjoyed the fun pool at the Lagoon tower with the slides and then for a change of pace, went to the Kalia Tower pool on the 4th floor - very quiet and peaceful. The Tapas pool the time we were there was basically a kids day care center so we didn't go there. There are so many different places to eat and explore right within the village too. Nice ABC store and 2 Starbucks, along with many eateries. Hilton does a great job with this Village - and we especially enjoyed the Lagoon Tower. The sunsets were absolutely stunning from our balcony.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My friend and I had a two bedroom suite. The room was very spacious and the view from the lanai was of both ocean and mountain. Very nice. The cleaning could have been better. Dust on the furniture and hair on the bathroom floor. It was quiet and staff was friendly. Pools were crowded and a lot of kids on the property. I prefer this end of the boulevard and the shops of the Hilton Village are really nice. Would love to see more affordable and flexible hours for renting umbrella and loungers on the beach.Food all around the area is quite expensive so just be prepared.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Major communication problems/issues within reservations and time share program. Was offered one price for stay end up paying double due to not guaranteed accomodations from reservation department. Upon arrival check in accomodation was available, but it was not to change... paying more than what was offered. Be aware what is offered note Name and phone number.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I've been an owner at Kalia Tower since 2004 and love it more and more every year. All the conveniences of home with a beautiful ocean view. All Staff always aims to please. The Mandara Spa is also amazing too. I love to spend one whole day there. So very relaxing and special.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the lagoon tower. We had an ocean view... view was very nice. Room is nice and clean and has all the amenities. I love the pool and it was right by the beach. We are owner with hgvc.. will totally come back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have been Hilton timeshare owners for a number of years, and recently purchased a unit in the Kalia Tower. This was our first time staying there, and we were very happy with our choice. Our unit, on the 18th floor had a beautiful ocean view from both the living area, and the bedroom. The unit was nicely furnished. The living/dining area had a queen sized sleeper sofa, large screen TV, and dining table. There was a island/bar surrounding the kitchen area with additional seating. A family of 4 could comfortably stay in this unit. The kitchen was well equipped with sufficient serving pieces for 4, and all the cooking utensils needed to make meals. It included a coffee maker, rice maker, and microwave as well as a full sized range and refrigerator. In the bedroom there was a wall unit that included a desk and closet. We had a king sized bed. Hilton buys the best beds and this was no exception-very comfortable. The unit was well maintained and very clean. There is a pool which is conveniently located on the fourth floor of the tower. Across from the pool is a large work out room that is quite well equipped with stationary bikes, weights etc. The tower is a short walk from the lagoon and the beach. Kayaks and paddle boards are available for rental at the lagoon.There are numerous restaurants in the Hawaiian Village complex. Our favorite for a nice lunch is Tropics, which is a short walk from the Tower, and located right on Waikiki. The Kalia Tower is mixed between time share units and hotel rentals. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, as well as several souvenir shops. Just across the road is a large ABC store where you can purchase chopped fruit, coffee, and any number of snacks. We really enjoyed our 5 days here, and really regretted leaving that ocean view behind. I would definitely recommend the Kalia Tower time share units. I've never stayed in the hotel units, so I can't comment on those, but the time share units are wonderful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have been a timeshare owner at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for over 15 years without a bad experience , This time around I had RCI points to use and a 3 bedroom unit became available at the Lagoon tower, which by the way I own a 2 bedroom oceanfront in the lagoon tower. Unfortunately our 3bedroom in the tower was located next to the elevator. We were not given any warning, needless to say we did not get a good night sleep the whole week. When we called to request a room change we were told that can't be done since it was booked thru RCI points. Couldn't wait to get back home so I can get some decent sleep. The Hilton has always been a top notch place to stay, they have cheapened some amenities, they used to have big beautiful green and white pool towels , they were all replaced with small cheap towels . Now it takes 3 towels to cover one lounge chair but you are only allowed one towel per person. This is something I would expect at a motel 6. The lounge chairs were replaced with uncomfortable slippery lounge chairs. Don't know what they were thinking.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a nice place to stay. Centrally located to shopping etc. The Round Table restaurant has very good pizza and CJ's - located next to the Round Table has good sandwiches. Both have good service and the wait staff is friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: That fricking Generator ruined my week as an owner! No power... Shutting down the building multiple times. Smoke alarm batteries chirping in the middle of the night due to the multiple building shutdowns! Couldn't use the deck. Generator DB levels over 70DB's on 20th floor outside on the deck!Hilton allied posting a letter on all floors saying the power was restored yet the generators continue to run for the rest of my trip.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Best family accommodation, kitchen washing/dryer and lounge room. Plus full access to all the Hawaiian Village facilities. Great restraunts onsite but only 10 mins in a cab from all Waikiki restaurants.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Entire resort is top notch. Clean rooms, great staff, plenty of shops and tons of activities for all. Great for any occasion from anniversaries to just hanging with the family! There are several restaurants from high end like Bali steak and seafood to low end Dairy Queen and everything in between!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is - as Said - a village. The place is huge There is Pretty much everything you need and could potentially desireBig gym, many restaurants, bars and very centrally located The minus is the new tower, where we stayed This time, is located just next to sla Moana Road, so when they Call it City view it is in other words a 4 track free Way view that is extremely noisy - This is not suitsble for such a place !! So dont take that towerThomas

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: No late check-outs here.. or early check-ins. This property is huge and has lots of rules. Bellman won’t hold your luggage at check-out and direct you to a luggage storage room way on the other end of property. Once you sweat your way there, the luggage storage king yells at you that there was a much closer luggage storage. Yells! How can guests know the rules if the staff doesn’t and provides bad info?

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom oceanview room on the 12th floor in the Lagoon Tower and we loved it. Ample space with everything we needed for a family of 5. The view was great especially for fireworks. We didn’t experience lift delays like others have said and the service was always friendly and helpful. I would stay again with kids. My only complaint is the cost of hiring water devices. $45 for one hour on a stand up paddle boards is ridiculous especially when this is after the 10% discount! Also the car parking is expensive.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Shared a two bedroom unit with friends in the Lagoon Tower on a recent visit. This resort is very large and pretty much any service or need you may have can be fulfilled without leaving the property. The unit was nicely furnished and the kitchen well equipped. It appeared that this unit is heavily used and it was obvious that some maintenance attention is/was due. All in all and aside from the previously mentioned observation, I had a fun experience while staying here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed for a couple of nights on part of our trip to the Islands. So much to do and so close to everything around. the rooms were quiet, comfortable and large enough to spread out. my only complaint (if you can call it that) was it seemed to be crowded everywhere around the hotel. Plan time for elevator rides and traffic into time plans.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: As always the Hilton Hawaiian Village made our stay completely relaxing & totally enjoyable providing us with the total resort experience. Staff are always helpful & friendly. Everything you need in the one place.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Amazing place, everything you need in one location. But double and triple check your date reservations! They messed up my dates and I had to switch rooms during my stay which was a huge inconvenience and they really didn't seem to care about my feelings.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you check in late it seems that they give your room to someone else. The gave us an ADA room even though on our reservation it was stated not an ADA accessible room. Room was very noisy. Outside the door was a hang out spot for the cleaning staff.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This property is excellent lot of stuff to do for everyone Would come back again enjoy the atmosphere the staff is great Very friendly willing to help us out with all our needs Will be back Highly recommend

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The lagoon at this resort is amazing. The kids loved it. The beach was amazing, the food was great, the submarine ride was awesome. Our 2 weeks here went very quickly. We were always doing something. There were a lot of people at this resort though, sometimes making it hard to get a lounge in the pool area. It was rather funny when we walked into a shop and the owner asked us (my 2 daughter and I) to be “models” for their website. Ha ha. Believe me, I’m no model. It was pretty fun though.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you want a nice relaxing stay in Hawaii this is the place to stay!This Hotel indeed exceeded all expectations I had. It made my holiday so much better as I was there solo (I planned on bringing someone however it didn’t end up that way) and is located in a safe, secure and friendly environment. The hotel staff are amazing and show an enormous duty of care I say this from my personal experience.Having come from the Australian winter, I ended up with heat stroke. Within that time I was advised there was a Doctor on site as well as other services which were great to know were on site.The location is perfectly situation on the most beautiful beach i’ve ever seen. In addition to this there are so many shops on site you literally could get anything you needed without leaving.I personally recommend this hotel to all Australians who are making there first trip over to Hawaii. The amenities are vast, you can keep in contact with the hotel through the mobile app and they always make sure you receive the best care.When I arrived I was early. I was in a very spacious Diamond Head room with an amazing view. In saying that, I asked if I could upgrade and paid the difference and stayed in a corner room in the luxurious Rainbow tower.There is also a dedicated area where you can organise your day trips. I organised Pearl Harbour tour this way and it was the most amazing experience and is a must do for anyone who goes to Oahu.The entire area is beautiful, given the time difference with Australia it took me a while to kick the jet lag but I highly recommend a stroll on Ala Moana Boulevard, the area is just so amazingly clean and breathtaking with Diamond Head always in view.I also cant recommend enough the Tropical Bar and Grill! The service is spectacular and is the food and drink. It is one of my favourite bar i’ve been too. In addition to this, there is an IHOP on Ala Moana Boulevard and if your Australia you have to check it out you wont regret it.This is seriously the only review I could literally list 100’s of positive point and it would never end. All I can say is I highly recommend it for everyone and if you can spare that little bit extra you really need to stay in the Rainbow Tower.I personally stayed 7 nights and this trip was spectacular. This trip will always be close to my heart and the next time I return to Hawaii I will certainly stay at this resort again.Make sure to put on sunscreen and were a hat as although its beautiful weather its very humid and given most Australians are of European decent like myself you will find yourself burnt very quick. It was the only mistake I made on my holiday.Again I want to thank Hilton Hawaiian Village for such a great stay. I am recommending you to all those I know heading your way.I also want to finally add that Waikiki Trolley was a fantastic experience. If you go and you aren't driving I highly recommend getting a pass. The staff are well educated and will remind you of famous places your passing that you didn't even realise.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A common question facing many travelers is which Hilton Grand Vacation Club to stay in Waikiki. Here is a summary.Hokulani Waikiki – Only club outside the Hilton Hawaiian Village (HHV) cluster, closer to the heart of Waikiki, with more restaurant and shopping options. A 5 minute walk to the beach. Nice rooftop pool area.The remaining four clubs, sorted by newness, are located in the HHV cluster, sharing common pools, the lagoon, parking, facilities, and a two to four minute walk to the beach. Self contained resort, a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Center (west) and the heart of Waikiki (east). Grand Islander – Newest addition (2017), one of the furthest from the lagoon and main pools, some street noise being directly on Kalia, but a couple minutes closer to Waikiki.Grand Waikikian (2006) – Largest rooms, still looks and feels newish. More details below.Kalia Suites (2001)- Mostly hotel rooms, furthest from the lagoon and main pools, some street noise being directly on the main intersection, mostly city views, ocean views are obstructed by the other towers. This usually has the greatest availability.Lagoon Tower (1950s) – Oldest and closest to the beach and lagoon. Higher floors have unobstructed views.Now onto my most recent stay at the Grand Waikikian. Stayed at a two-bed premier room, high floor with ocean view, in the mountainside tower (versus the ocean tower). 1200+ square feet, huge master bedroom and bath with Jacuzzi tub, but a bit undersized living/dining/kitchen area. Can accommodate six, comfortable for sleeping with two per each of the two rooms and two in the living room, but living room could feel slightly cramped during waking hours. Here is the website’s write-up. “This spacious two-bedroom, two-bathroom ocean view suite with balcony features a master bedroom with a king bed and bathroom with a free-standing shower and separate soaking tub. The second bedroom is furnished with a king bed or two double beds and bathroom with a shower only. The suite includes a generous living room with separate dining area, cable TV, PlayStation 3, and queen-size sleeper sofa, as well as a full kitchen with rice steamer and washer/dryer.”Spacious lobby, plentiful bi-lingual (Japanese-English) registration and concierge desk staff. As noted in the hotel’s room write-up, the unit was well equipped with everything you would need to make and enjoy a dinner and night in.I would definitely stay at the Grand Waikikian again if I wanted to spend more time within the unit, at the Hokulani if spending more time outside in the heart of Waikiki, or the Lagoon Tower if going to and from the lagoon or beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We like Hilton Grand Vacations properties due to the size of the rooms, and the kitchens which allow us to cook our own food which is a nice change when on an extended holiday.We stayed in the Kalia Tower with an Ocean View for three nights before a cruise.The room was in good condition and we appreciated the various pools and bars, as well as being only a very short walk from the beach.There are shops on site, although we found more choice and better prices at a nearby Food Pantry shop.Yes it is expensive, especially with the resort charge added. At least this location does have more of a resort feel than the other Grand Vacations places we have stayed at, with the variety of pools etc. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and would return to this resort if we are ever in Honolulu again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Truly a fantastic vacation. The hotel was very clean. Large 2 bedroom 2 bath with kitchen and washer dryer. Balcony off bedroom. Views of mountains and ocean were breathtaking. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Would definitely stay there again.
user_location: Garden City, New York, United States
user_name:
Nancy D
Garden City, New York, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Amazing views of the beach and surrounding gardens. Service and amenities are excellent. So close to all amenities including the city centre and shopping within easy reach. Close to large mall with good variety of stores.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The room was nice, but definitely was not worth $600 a night with all the extra charges ($40 a night resort fee for old ps3 we never used. $40 a night for parking and the high hotel taxes). Room plumbing was not very good. Also, room had ants and gnats on 18th Floor.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Upon first arrival at check-in, Lance was not a friendly face to be greeted by after arriving from a long flight. We had booked open season and a points based stay in studio and he could care less about trying to get us to stay in the studio for the entire stay. He insisted we would have to move. I understood the full capacity at the hotel but his lack of consideration or customer service made it all worse. Our room was old and during our stay our room was flooded with water. There was constant construction in our room next to the elevator so each day we were alarmed by the noise. During our stay maintenance was banging our doors early in the morning. We were trying to get ready for a wedding and could not believe how many people it took to assess the flooded situation. By far one of the worse stays. On our last night, due to the flood in our room, we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite at the Grand Waikikian tower and they left us some cookies from the Honolulu Cookie company. Really? We don’t need cookies, we need to be comped for our terrible experience. As timeshare owners, it’s unbelievable that the level of service at the Lagoon tower is subpar. The dated and dirty room itself, the dreadfully slow elevators, the unfriendly check-in desks - all just so disappointing!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a one bedroom in the lagoon tower which was comfortable, clean and roomy. Appreciate the housekeeping for doing a great job! The check-in lady, Grace I think was very helpful and warm. Hilton Hawaiian Village is always a great place to stay for beach, entertainment, shops and eats! Looking forward to our next stay. If you don't like busy and crowds however you may need to look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: First of all, the location and the lagoon, access to swimming pool and the beach was great. Especially when I was accompanied by 22 month old, it was nice place to be. The size of the resort makes a bit of walk when you are on the other end of the resort, but assuming you need to walk wherever you are staying this was OK.The staff was nice, but for some parts, things could work out more efficiently. When I checked in, I was given a water coupon, which you can receive 2 bottles of water at the concierge for a coupon (You get 1 coupon for 1 night of stay). I went down with coupon in my hand, and the only staff at the concierge was serving other guests in front of me. I have been standing there for more than 20 minutes showing and waving my coupons to the staff, but he was focused on serving the other guest. Even after that guest left, the staff was not paying much of attention to me until I called him out loud. It wasn't really pleasant experience.Also, always put "Do Not Disturb Sign" outside, otherwise the house keeping will be marching in from 9 in the morning until I leave the room.Bell service and valet service was great.Also there are laundry machine in the floor (not sure other floors, but our floor had one) which is accessible with the room key. It came very handy after went to the beach and needs of washing salty water out of swimsuits.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family of 5 (husband, 3 teenage boys & myself) just came back from our first trip to Hawaii. We stayed for 8 nights in a 2 bedroom & 2 bathroom unit in the Lagoon Tower. We had a standard view which overlooked the paradise pool & had a partial ocean view. It was great! We had enough space, we cooked a few meals there which not only saved money & time but sometimes we just wanted to relax. It even has a washer & dryer on each floor with laundry soap provided! It is a great location: 15 minutes to the Ala Monoa Center or Beachwalk & plenty of restaurants within walking distance if you don’t want to eat at the resort. There is plenty to do on the resort itself or if you want to site see you can walk or catch the bus or trolley right in front. Yes the elevators got busy at times & the poolsl crowded but nothing horrible. Not one complaint from the 5 of us. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The lagoon tower corner penthouse with lagoon / marina view was amazing. I enjoyed waking up to this every morning. There was a couples issue that I had. Being a Hilton grand vacations owner, I would think the parking would be cheaper for us but it is not. It’s pricey about $45 a night. I heard regular hotel guest pay lesser. The other issue with the lagoon tower is the elevators. During peak times it takes forever for you to get on the elevator since everyone is trying to go to every floor. If you are in the penthouse level, it will take you forever to get on since everyone from the lower level is riding the elevator up and then going down causing the elevator to be full before it gets to your floor. Other than that I would say it’s a great place to stay at.
user_name:
Ryan S
Tacoma, Washington, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We love to have staycations. This was undoubtedly one of the best ones. Access to pools, lagoon and beach are always a plus. Shopping in the Village was handy to have aroma nd in case we needed anything.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I thought we would stop over in Honolulu for a few days en route to Australia to adjust for major time changes. We chose the Hilton Hawaiian Village and on the very excellent advice of Ms Man Yee at the pre check-in desk, we upgraded to a large corner room in the Tapa tower for our three days. The views from corner windows and balcony are spectacular. The room itself is very spacious and comfortable. Our restful stopover is not only restful, it is truly memorable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Everything was great other than the back that the AC was down for at least three hours in the middle of the day. After spending most of the day outside all I wanted to do was come to my room. We were on the 8th floor and elevators were down so we took the stairs. By the time we got to our room I was extremely exhausted, my head was throbbing and we had no AC. It was a total of three hours before it was turned on and who knows how long it had already been off for.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Outstanding resort, with slightly dated elevators & rooms. Incredible views and outstanding outdoor facilities including the resort pools and magnificent lagoon. Friday night fireworks was a highlight. Costs to ensure a good room view are not cheap so unfortunately not great value for money if a room with a view is not a priority.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were traveling with another couple to Australia and had two stays in a six-week period, once while going and once coming back. Our rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable, and had wonderful views of Diamond Head. Being able to cook meals in our room allowed us the flexibility to eat in whenever we wanted, but we also dined out on occasion. The staff are wonderful and helpful. We look forward to our next stay!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This Resort is Beautiful and Amazing.My room was very cozy and clean. You will have no problem with things to do. Upon checking in I stopped at the concierge desk, and I must say that was a wonderful decision. She assisted me with information in regards tours of Hawaii, also I went to a Luau and many other things. Also the had one of the Best Firework Show Ever. I shopped and ate in the resort...THIS RESORT IS TOP NOTCH. I will be returning next month.Everyone was so friendly and Professional, Ocean view and steps from the beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hawaiian Village gives you a variety of places to enjoy without having to travel far. There are a total of seven towers for lodging with none of them having the same amenities. You are a stones throw from the beach. I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Celebrated my son's wedding with 26 family members. Everything went well and everyone enjoyed the events and had a vacation as well. Hilton came through for everything, could not have been better. John and Akiko (managers) ensured rooms and transitions went smoothly.
user_name:
Stan Lloyd P
Moorpark, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family of 5 (3 children aged 5,8 and 16) stayed in a 2 bedroom Suite in the Lagoon Tower, we absolutely recommend this to any family it was amazing, the facilities at the Village enabled all of our children to find something they enjoyed. The various pools, the Lagoon , the hire equipment (paddle boards / Kayak etc) made for a lot of fun for all of us, the restaurants, the free outdoor cinema it was the best 10 day holiday. The room had a full kitchen and living area (2 separate bedrooms) I can't fault anything on this trip the staff were amazing, we will definitely be holidaying here on a regular basis and will encourage family and friends to do the same!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have a time share/points at the Lagoon Tower @ Hilton Hawaiian Village. The overall quality of the room was lacking compared to previous stays. Would love for the manager to be more hands on and set a higher standard for the room quality and cleanliness.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Nice facilities. Great place with great beach access, and tourist services were helpful in finding activities like our very awesome Pearl Harbor tour. Even though I magically managed to get sick, my wife and I still enjoyed a lot of romantic time together as this was our honeymoon.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It has beach right at front, exotic birds and fishes, and different restaurants on site.Location is at the beginning of Waikiki drag. Very convenient location. Each Friday, it has a show procession of local legend of local history. Firework after is nice over the sea.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you want to take a relaxing vacation in Hawaii, you can't beat the experience at Hilton Grand Vacations. A very short walk to the beach beach, pools, bars, and food you can't beat. The Friday fireworks was a nice touch to a wonderful week. 10 STARS all around.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at the Lagoon Tower. Check in was friendly and faultless. Had a well decorated and comfortable 2 bedroom apartment with a balcony looks big over the marina. Not sure why people criticise this view as it gets the sun in the evening just when you want it. The HGV staff were polite and extremely helpful. The facilities at the resort were fabulous. All in all a great stay would love to go back again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are not vacation club owners. Daughter booked us a separate room, single bed studio. It was a great option for us since it gave us our own space. Room was some what dated. However, it was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the many different venues of the property. We really enjoyed our stay and would return.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the Lagoon Tower, corner 2 bedroom family unit. Large kitchen, full size fridge, large oven, full size cooktop, 2 x bathrooms, 2 x decks. Essentially a 2 bedroom apartment. Perfect for our needs (2 + 2 teenagers). Nice complex, great pools, facilities etc. Tended to dine outside the village, for example Buffalo Wild Wings across the main road which was beyond perfect and catered for everybody.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The hilton grand resort, was such a great place to stay. It is right in the heart of Wakiki. It had a verity of bars, and restaurants to eat at. The pools are really nice, though they could stand it to be open a little later. I found the hotel to be very clean and very accommodating. The valet staff were great also, and learned our names very quickly.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Everything was great here! We loved our stay with the ocean, lagoon, pool with slides and great restaurants right there!! My husband and our 11 yr old twins had a spectacular vacation!!!It was clean, roomy, had helpful staff, and fun things to do!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed there 3 nights. Had a small kitchen but no laundry. Small bathroom. Sofa bed was hard which was normal. We came from Honua Kai in Maui and we were spoiled by the amount of space we had there. Overall a definite upgrade from the normal hotel rooms. Nice to have all the amenities and shopping right there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great resort but the 3 bedroom RCI unit master bedroom is adjacent to elevator motors. Very nosy when trying to sleep. The Balcony wraps around building such that we were able to see sunrise and sunset. The bathrooms could use updating as amenities not as nice as you would expect with Hilton

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here after 2 and a half weeks away and met my parent. We shared a 2 bedroom lagoon room for 15 nights. Wow!!! Is all I can say. It was spacious and so light inside. We overlooked the marina. It was lovely seeing cruise boats come in and out. We have stayed at the HHV 5 times. We have stayed in the Tapa tower, rainbow tower, grand vacations tower and the lagoon. We love the lagoon tower... this is our new home. Can’t wait to return this year. We booked 24hours upon returning back to Australia.Is an easy walk to town or ala Moana. Plus the Hilton has so much to do there...Can’t wait to return this year... only wish we could get our room earlier as we arrive so early from Australia.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What made our Hawaii holiday so memorable was the Hilton Hawaiian Village and its amazing layout. The place is huge and the one bedroom apartment was perfect for 2 adults and 2 young children. The lagoon pool is beautiful and a great place for the young ones to spend hours in. The lagoon rental activities were extremely expensive so we bought our own toys for a fraction of the cost from one of the ABC stores. It was a great feeling to have stayed in the hotel that many famous stars, such as MJ and Elvis, have stayed in. Plus thanks to a couple of private functions held on the the great lawn we saw amazing fireworks displays 3 times in ten days. We all had a blast. Good work Conrad!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Was accessable to every type of store you may want to go to. The lagoon was alot of fun to paddle board in, hotel was clean and very nice. View was spectacular from our room. We got in early so they held our bags until the room was ready while we went and had fun.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just came back from an amazing vacation here at Hilton Hawaiian Village. We loved our 1BR suite in the Lagoon Tower and made use of the full size fridge, the utensils and plates, though we didn't make any food beyond a few bows of cereal, and some fruit. I would say that Hilton has a lot to offer guests of all types. If you want to shop at upscale stores, there are plenty here in the outdoor mall area between towers - not our scene, but fun to stroll through once or twice. If you need your Starbucks in the morning, you have 2 on the property. Even the cheaper ABC beach shops are located on the property and also just on the street side of the property. We ate meals on and off the resort. We really enjoyed the Tropics Bar and Grill for lunch and dinner (great food and location) -- in a different tower on the property, but everything's close. For families with younger kids, in addition to the multiple pools on resort, you have their great shallow sand-bottomed lagoon with small fish swimming around and no waves or current to worry about. The pool at the Lagoon Tower is probably the best on the entire property with water slides, hot tubs, and other fun features. Finally, the beach at this resort is probably the largest and safest in the area. The staff all around are excellent!My main reason for not 100% recommending this resort is that there are so many costs associated with staying here. Over $50 per day for use of an umbrella and 2 loungers at the beach? What is the resort fee for, if not to offset some of these costs. Then the audacity to charge $50 for valet parking (vs. $43 for self park) and it doesn't include PROPER valet service where I can call down from my room and have car ready when I get down. I was told this is because too may people don't come get their car. I'm sure it's a headache for all hotels, but it's a minor annoyance if you are charging this much. Buffet breakfasts were about $10 overpriced. Maybe a couple of free vouchers would have been nice, or kids eat free at the buffet, if you're going to charge the adults $30 each.Also, there is live music at the resort, so sometimes at night it is a bit loud around kid bedtime hours.Overall this is a wonderful location and a great resort, but when people are paying a premium, and are likely going to keep spending on the property (there's conveniently not much else around within a short stroll to eat, drink, etc) maybe don't so blatantly gouge us at every turn

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: we stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment in the Kalia tower. As an owner this is a great tower. Starbucks downstairs, Spa and gym on level 4 and great city/mountain views from the room. Also super close to Ihop, Red Lobster, Outback Steakhouse and Ala Mona shopping center. Checking in process was easy. The concierge desk was left unattended at times which was disappointing. Easy for Uber drivers to find us as well in Kalia tower. The apartment was clean and tidy and new. Just love it. The only negative was the main pools. The public can access which drove us insane as we couldn't find chairs at times. How's that fair that anyone can use the pools when we pay resort fees etc... to use the facilities. There's has to be something done about it. I wouldn't care if there was a gate erected to keep the public away. There also needs to be more wait staff around the pools for drinks and food. we waited an hour sometimes to be served. Faster to get up and go get drinks from the bar. Overall HHV is my fav place to stay in Hawaii and I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit in the Lagoon Tower. Unit was well stocked, clean & comfortable. All the staff were very nice & check in was a quick & efficient. Lagoon Tower is close to the water slide and the lagoon. The only negative is there is only 1 laundry room on each floor. If there were a washer/dryer in the unit I would have given it a 5 Star rating.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a wonderful experience at this beautiful resort. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. Our 1 bedroom was very large with great ocean, city, mountain, and sunset views from the spacious lanai. The furnishings and supplies were top quality, clean, and seemed quite new.  The resort property is very extensive with many choices of pools, bars, restaurants, and shops of all kinds. Plus, the Village is located adjacent to a lovely park and on a fabulous stretch of beach that you can walk along to find even more Waikiki restaurants and shopping.  We also loved swimming in the lagoon and ocean, and the Friday night fireworks were a spectacular treat.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed 4 days at Lagoon Tower in an apartment and it was fantastic . We overlooked the lagoon and the green . Had a great view of the water . The resort is very big but you couldn’t get a better location . We walked Waikiki beach form here . Sat at the lagoon and swam there . Tried all the pools there are three and I even went down the big slide .. such fun . Staff were great . There is so much to see and do . We did tours from there so didn’t both with a car buses and trollers outside if you required them. But we walked wvereeverywhere we wanted to go and some times grabbed a can on the way home if it was late or we had loads of shopping from Ala Moana whxih is about a 15 minute walk away . Totally recommend . Lots to eat there or I’d you have an apartment abc stores everywhere that sell everything you require . And not to far away that you couldn’t go out for dinner outside the resort .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The property is lovely. The staff that we interacted with were extremely courteous and helpful. My only complaint was the rooster that woke us up very early every morning, but that is not the resort's fault.
user_name:
Helen K
West Linn, OR, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Condo well equipped. Comfortable beds-even sofa bed was comfortable. Ample space on the lanai with table and 4 chairs overlooking ocean. Very close to Ala Moana Mall and multiple reataurants in the area.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If one is going to enjoy this resort, you need to know what you are getting into and decide if it is the place for you. We apparently did not do enough research. We are HGVC owners in New York but thought it would be fun and interesting to try a different place in a Paradise resort. The Hilton Vacation Club is huge and situated on 22 acres, right on Waikiki beach. There are three Time Share towers and I believe five hotels under the Hilton Brand, so one can imagine how many people are on site. We did make a point of stopping each day at Lappert's ice cream as well as Honolulu cookie. There are two ABC stores on site where one can basically get anything one needs, as well as a Safeway less than five minutes away drive. There are multiple restaurants and cafes on site as well. We stayed in the Grand Islander tower which was lovely. The front desk staff, bellman and valet were delightful, friendly and helpful. Despite asking four different concierges for help, we found them much less helpful. We were on the 18th floor in a two bedroom and two bath suite. The kitchen and living room were well appointed and had everything we needed. There is also a washer/dryer. The views of the beach were lovely and we also looked out over a park. There was a nice balcony to sit out on. I am not certain I would want to stay much higher up as it is a busy hotel and sometimes there were a lot of stops on the elevator to get to the higher floors. This tower also houses the bus terminal for all of the resort. Our tower had a lovely lap pool and hot tub but it was not an adult pool so virtually impossible to do laps as kids were constantly jumping in on my head. It was the same with the hot tub. While there are multiple other pools, the beach and a lagoon, again there were always too many kids in the pools and hot tubs. There were times that we could not find a place to sit as all the lounge chairs were taken. In addition, one has to pay to rent a chaise or cabana on the beach. There are multiple activities that one can do but again one pays extra. There were beautiful fireworks on Friday evening over the lagoon.There is self parking on site which cost $43/night. As we traveled all over the island, we did use a car a lot but if one doesn't want to go too far, I am not certain one necessarily needs a car. So, I think this place would be great for families as there is so much to do for them. It is close to the Ala Moana and Beachwalk shopping areas so great location for shoppers. Also, if one wants to be in Waikiki, this property is right in the smack middle. It is easy to walk anywhere, either on the beach boardwalk or the street. Lots of shopping close by. I would not recommend this property for anyone that wants a quieter or more laid back experience. People, people, people EVERYWHERE!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Love the location and views. Convenient to downtown Waikiki in one direction and Ala Moana mall in other direction. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms have all the amenities and most have kitchens.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are HGVC members and first chose staying at Kalia Towers because our friend is the manager at the stores downstairs. We are not particularly fond of staying in Honolulu, big city, LOTS of tourist and traffic...but the staff, from valet to housekeeping, at Kalia towers, makes they stay a pleasant one. Within a day or two, the valet remembered who we were and a year later, when we returned, remembered us. Housekeeping does a GREAT job on your room, and are ever so pleasant when you see them. Front desk staff are very nice. They can run a little slow, but it's because they want each and every person to feel they are VIP. Unlike a lot of vacation clubs, this staff does not push you into having to talk with the HGVC people, they don't call your room every day trying to get you to come to a timeshare presentation. In fact, the ONLY time they have ever called us was when my husband had set up an appointment, then forgot and didn't go, They called and I told them we were no longer interested and they were very polite and they didn't bother us the rest of the trip. There is several ABC Stores within walking distance and they carry everything! There are places to eat and other shopping places within walking distance, you don't even have to leave the Hawaiian Village. For smokers., there is a limited amount of places you can smoke, they make it most difficult for you(Hawaii all around is trying to go non-smoking), which I find interesting since a vast majority of the locals and visitors are smokers.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This hotel Really needs to have an adult-only pool. Every pool is full of screaming, unsupervised children, every pool. The beautiful lagoon area was overrun with children, 15 of them in the hot tub.The pigeons are a big problem, pestering us everywhere we went, even landing all over in the restaurants and our balcony.There is no place to sit. I was booted out of an area at 2 PM and was told I couldn’t sit there because I didn’t buy anything from the bar. I counted 28 empty tables.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The rooms are large with a great view. On Friday night the fireworks from the balcony seem to be right in front of you. Can wait to return. Great HGVC property on the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Everything you need is right there if you don’t want to leave the property.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The facility is in very good condition and has a lot to offer: ocean/lagoonactivities, poll slides/tubes, lots of restaurant and shopping choices. The luau isn't the best I've seen but passable, although the location isn't good. Unfortunately, the best beach bar on waikiki has had some menu changes that make no sense and the food has gone downhill. One thing I find hugely annoying is the chair saving around the pools - unoccupied chairs are not policed and it is very frustrating. The west side of the Lagoon tower is very noisy at night with deliveries at the adjacent hotel going on throughout the night.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The lagoon tower is in a wonderful location over looking the lagoon and Waikiki beach. Everything is here you need. Classes in Hawaian culture including hula, ukulele, lei making, implements and more! Loads of restaurants and even Church on the Beach on Sunday. Staying in the lagoon tower offers comfort and a small kitchen so you can do breakfast or sandwiches in your condo. We enjoyed the free movies and the lovely pools. Fireworks on Friday nights at dark are the icing on the cake. They do a great luau as well. We will come back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I travelled to Oahu Hawaii April 2018 and since this was our third time here we decided to stay at the Hilton as we have stayed in central Waikiki the 2 previous times. We arrived at roughly a little after 8am, check in at the lagoon tower was smooth and the receptionist was extremely helpful and friendly, since we were early and check in was at 4pm we were happy that around midday our room was ready. We stayed in the Kalia Tower and had a 1 bedroom mountain view, the room was fantastic, 2 queen beds with a rollaway along with plenty of space and very own kitchen, housekeeping was always on point and the lovely man that serviced our room was so polite and always had a smile on his face. I’m one that loves to keep in shape and the only gym in the resort is in the Kalia tower and it’s the first hotel gym that I’ve used that is fully equipped and has plenty of space.The resort is huge, the time in which we were there it poured down rain which made it difficult to explore Waikiki but the resort has everything you need and more, yes this is a family resort so expect children but I didn’t find the super pool to be crowded and never had an issue with getting a lounge chair.I ate at the Tropics Bar and Grill and the Food was delicious and the service was great and attentive. I’ve read many reviews that has mentioned food, drinks, rentals are pricey, yes some things are quite overpriced but it’s a resort so it’s sorta going to be expected. One thing that I thought it dangerous are the paths around the village, they are very slippery when wet and need a coat of non slip surface coating but other than that my family and I had a fabulous time at the Hilton Grand Vacations and I know that we will be back.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: You dont really have to leave the property as everything you could possibly need is there. Great food, ebtertainment, pools and ocean. Even excursions for hiking, biking, kayaking, snorkeling and more pick you up at your doorstep.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The cost for food, drinks, parking, umbrella and chair rentals is ridiculous. The pools are over crowded. No space between chairs at the pools and there's no place to relax without hearing screaming kids. The workout area was over crowded and has limited equipment for such a large resort.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Love the property - you can stay there and never leave. They have the beach, lagoon, restaurants and ice cream. The staff are friendly and will get you whatever you need. We stayed in the Lagoon tower and had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom with a nice size living room and kitchen. It was clean and spacious.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Lots to do for families with small children. Food can be expensive but very good. No quiet areas to relax. Pools were busy with kids, etc. If seniors or wanting quiet relaxation, I recommend visiting another site.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at this resort for 1 week and it was great. Very clean, friendly staff and nearby good restaurants. No complaints at all. Recommend to rent a car and venture to the North Shore, Waimea falls and other great locations on oahu island.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower and it was fabulous. We had 2 rooms for the 8 of us.The 2 bedroom suite for my daughter's family and a 1 bedrroom suite for my wife and I. The views of the ocean and lagoon were great and we had fantastic views for the Friday night fireworks. The rooms were well kept and the entire staff were great. The pool areas are a little small for the amount of people that stay on this property, but the lagoon is a nice option for swimming and playing with ocean toys. Honolulu is very expensive and everything on this site is pricey. I definetly recommend this site to anyone.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great resort, right on the beautiful Waikiki Beach. Stayed in the Lagoon Tower in a one bedroom with full kitchen. The full kitchen (full size fridge, oven, microwave) was great as we were able to have breakfast in the room each morning. The room was spacious and clean. Great for the four of us. The kids loved the beach. One even tried a surf lesson and got up on her first try! The outdoor movies on the lawn were also a big hit. Free movies, PlayStation games, and great wifi available. There a plenty of restaurants and shops within the resort and also within walking distance.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Lagoon tower this last week. The pool was wonderful, food really expensive but a great place to stay. Although it was spring break it wasn’t overwhelmingly busy. The birds are noisy part of the day but our room was generally quiet and clean.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed 4 nights at the Kalia Suites (studio) through our HGV membership for work. The studio is basically a regular hotel room with a microwave, small compact fridge and some plates and utensils in the room. There floors dedicated to HGV and floors dedicated to the the Hilton Hawaiian Village and you can definitely tell the difference between the two as we have stayed on both floors. HGV floors are definitely more upgraded and have free washers and dryers on each floor (none in the units). Had a great view of the beach, lagoon and the fireworks from the unit. Was able to watch unlimited amounts of movies from the rental machines in the lobby. PROS: Nice room for the amount paying through the HGV cash price stay vs other hotels in Waikiki. There is a Starbucks downstairs (which is always busy in the morning). Private pool on the 4th floor for guests only. Easy access to the parking garage (walk past the ballroom and it takes you to the elevators of the parking garage). CONS: If you don't arrive before a certain time (6 pm?) you will have to check in at the Grand Waikikian --- which is the next buidling past the parking garage. We arrived just before the desk was going to close and was able to check in at the Kalia desk for our keys. There is usually only one person working at the desk (or at least during the times we checked -in and out) so it made for a longer wait. Very busy hotel area with lots of tourists.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Good:Room was great for the 2 of us and our daughter. Very well appointed, seemed brand new. Great location with plenty of food and shopping a short walk away. I finally got to try an advanced electronic Japanese bidet. (not required) :) The Annoying:We did not use much of the facilities and would really like to see a way to opt out of the ridiculous resort fee. We were aware of it ahead of time and planned for it, however it just seems like a new type of scam for hotels. $35 for Fitness Center, Water and Internet access. Not horrible, but a significant amount of traffic noise even on the 10th floor. If you are sensitive to this, go higher. Crazy elevator controls seemed to confuse everyone. No buttons in the elevators at all , you programmed your floor in the lobby and hoped to remember what number elevator to step into. On the flip site, it is efficient and we never waited long for a elevator. Not a single cab or Uber drive knew which tower to return us too as it is very new. The Bad: Concierge was useless, especially for a vacation center like this. I literally got better advice from a waitress at the wonderful Wailana Coffee House on the corner.Picky but also no ATM on site.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Recent stay 3 days in Feb and later for 3 days March 2018. Wonderful stay. Everything we needed was in walking distance. We had a one bedroom condo with a balcony on the front end of our cruise and a studio on the back end. We rarely stayed in the room so the studio was sufficient for us. The fireworks on Friday night were enjoyable. Hilton Hawaiian Village is a very busy property. Plenty of shopping and food options if you choose to stay close by. We used Roberts Shuttle from the airport $16/person but used Uber for all other transportation needs. There is a small bar on site with live music in the evenings. Great spot to watch the sunset if the clouds cooperate. We had a late flight home. Checkout is 10am. They will store your luggage and they have a lounge area with showers/changing rooms if you choose to enjoy the pool for the afternoon while waiting on your flight. We loved the Lagoon Tower!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent 5 nights with a 3y9m and 2y3m in the Lagoon tower and we were not impressed. Elevator: We’ve read about the slow elevator but we were underestimated how SLOW it was. On a Thursday morning around 10am, we waited over 15mins to get down to the lobby from the 11th floor. On Saturday morning, we had to wait again when we wanted to go down to the lobby around the same time. The only way for us to get down was first we had to go up. Then of course, it had to stop at every single floor on the way down. We heard from the people on the 20th floor they waited for about 30mins. This was absolutely ridiculous. Check-in/Concierge/Customer Service: Upon check-in, a booklet with our room keys were handed but there was no mentioned of what’s in the booklet or where we can get a hotel map, activities calendar, etc. The staff we encountered (concierge desks, customer service, towel stations) did not seem friendly (no smiles) at all except for housekeeping. To be fair, we just spent 4 days at Aulani before taking the kids to spend some time in Waikiki so we did have some high expectations coming from such a happy and friendly resort. Pools: the water was too cold. The “hot tub” was too small and too crowded. We barely spent any time at the pools because of this. Towels: one towel person. You have to return the soiled towel to get a new one. This policy makes it tough when we have the little ones. Water bottles: for each night you stay, a coupon for 2 complimentary water bottles was given at check in. (We were not told how these coupons work at check-in). Well, to get your water, you have to take the coupon to the unfriendly concierge who are sitting right across from elevator. They then unhappily asking for your room number and confirm your name before giving you the water bottles. It was so unnecessary. Why are they inconvenient us for these water bottles? Why can this be part of housekeeping? Then it just clicked with us when they started talking about the “welcome packet” and timeshare opportunity. Aha!!! What a mediocre way of pitching!Kids Club: nothing for kids under 5 except ukulele lesson. We tried to sign up after 20 minutes of different people misinformed us where to sign up. Then we were told it’s full and that we should have signed up the day before. What a joke! And if you’re expected to see bath robes and slippers in your room, don’t. We’ll not return to this hotel the next time we visit Waikiki. If you have young children, for the price difference which is not much if you factor in the gear/chair rentals, stay at Aulani. Kids club are awesome there; pools are huge and warmer with unlimited towels; floaties, life vests, boogie boards and sand toys are all free; no $75 charge for chairs and umbrella on the beach; great private lagoon; lots of activities throughout the resort on a daily basis; rooms, bathrooms are nice and clean; staff are friendly; I could go on and on...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations this summer during our trip to Hawaii. We were very excited about this stay because of the great reviews that it received. Image our dismay when we arrived and saw the beautiful beaches, the lovely hotel and expansive gardens. Then we got to our room. First, it took forever to find our reservation, and though we were there at check in our room was not ready and had to cool our heels for an hour and a half until we were able to enter our room. Our room was in the corner, and our view was of the parking garage. Our room was also next to where they had the luau and though we could not see it, we definitely hear it and smell it. I am sure that this is a lovely property but if I stay here again I will definitely insist on a room with a view of anything other than what I got.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great place for family holiday excellent facilities for family great location great restaurant excellent pools great service real had a great time here with my family all the things we need where just down at the lower lobby the abc store was really good to finish of the day to buy snacks and drinks we stayed at the grand islander

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: On the beach, walk to everything in Waikiki from a grocery to restaurant and shopping. Have been twice and loved both rooms! Balconies with water views and fireworks on Friday nights. Clean and beautiful condo style with everything you need from fluffy towels to shampoo and some rooms have amazing ocean views.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful, overcrowded, Rental costs are ridiculous!! Unless...You'd like 90 minute high pressure condo sales pitch with your little kids! Even that doesn't cover umbrella rental for week! Great food though, Blue Water Shrimp is amazing! Sushi is amazing! Employees at all hotels, restaurants are polite and accommodating & super sweet. Pools are fabulous, coi ponds beautiful, oceans crowded but gorgeous view.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great option for a family of two couples, or four or even six! Loads of space, good size kitchen and bathrooms. View from the lanai was over the pool, marina and to the west so great for sunsets (so many photos). Could hear the luau every night but it wasn't too loud and we were out mostly. Great pool for the Lagoon Tower, very handy to the salt-water lagoon as well. A little tricky for public transport if you have a mobility-impaired traveller who is stubborn and won't take a wheelchair, but not too far of a walk.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I do like the resort everything is in one convenient place, food drinks non crowded beach, A couple of employees were not nice and they did NOT give me all my Hilton honors points I was told there manager said to take the awards points off my account The restaurants are quite expensive Hawaii is expensive but I would return solely on locationI’m leaving in a few days again so I hope this trip is amazing as well

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed 9 nights Lagoon Tower room 968 facing the building next door. It was defined as an ocean view room although you must sit sideways to get a view and this time of year has no sun. Elevators were a problem because one was constantly down. People were nice though!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A village as a resort. Provides a wide variety of amenities and restaurants in a self contained “village”. Great for families and a good way to visit as first timers to O’ahu. Highly recommended. Would return.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I love this hotel and have visited several times in the past. It had been twenty years since my previous visit and it still had the magic. I love the lagoon and the sunsets from here. Within walking distance of so many restaurants and shopping. Had a few minor issues with the maid service and some noise but that was due to them maintaining the property. Other than those minor issues, I would highly recommend staying here. We had a two bedroom suite and it was great for our family of 5!
