hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What an elegant, beautifully designed oasis. If we stay again we will definitely take advantage of more of the resort ammenities. I only wish the recreation facilities had been avsilable for early birds, you can't rent a snorkel before 9AM, even then, the booth wasd opoen but there was no one to wait on us!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a great property at a great location. No other hotel in waikiki will give you such nice swimming pools and have beach front access. Since you are in Waikiki, the food options outside the hotel are much better and better priced. Mainly, stay away from the Luau. You're better off going to the Polynesian Cultural Center for a Luau.
user_name:
Philip S
Santa Clara, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Outstanding! The entire six night stay provided a great 35th Anniversary for me and my wife. The Hale Koa military hotel next door added a beautiful experience for any retired military staying at the Hilton. I highly recommend the Luau at the Hale Koa.
user_name:
Alfred H. C
San Antonio, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If we have a family gathering again, we would not stay in this place. Due to the communication issues, after a long time of check in process, it was very late but we had to check out in the early morning. It was a very panic experience. The facilities were very good, but we did not have time to really enjoy it.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Had a great time with our friends. Enjoyed the sun, the sea, and the accommodations were awesome. The experience was well worth cost. We look forward to coming back in the future. Our friends were really happy to be with us their.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My frist Hawaiian getaway but not my last. I loved the accommodations and the location. It had a lot to offer I could of spent another week in paradise , but had to get back to reality. Thanks to hilton for such a beautiful room and plenty of option of things to do.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in a 1-bedroom condo for 18 days. The room was excellent and maid service kept everything orderly and supplies filled. The facility is beautiful and we had excellent view from room.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: One of the most beautiful places on earth! So many things to do. Beautiful pools & waterfalls & koi ponds. Outstanding beaches, great shopping, the nicest staff. Everyone is so helpful. Wonderful fireworks every Friday night!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: May I begin with...Hawaii? Yes, Hawaii! This has always been on my bucket list of trips. Never did I ever think I would go to Hawaii but there I was. We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki Beach on the island of Oahu so don't let the name fool you. The resort? Amazing! The service? Amazing! The food? Amazing! I could not have been more pleased with this vacation. The amenities on site include pizza, pasta, sandwiches, ice cream and my favourite...Starbucks! Two of them to be exact. If all of that was not enough, the shopping is ridiculously great. My favourite store? Louis Vuitton, yes there is a Louis Vuitton on site. On top of everything else, the fireworks are the cherry on top of the sundaes (yes sundaes...plural) that we indulged in almost every night. Our room was immaculate, two bedrooms plus the pull-out sofa, a full kitchen with fridge, stove, microwave and coffee maker. The lagoon was like having your own personal beach, the kids enjoyed paddle boarding, water trikes and kayaks, as well as the basic swimming. The pools were clean and although two of the water slides were closed, the kids enjoyed riding the same ones over and over again. The staff were great, very personable and always willing to help. As for the surroundings, there was no shortage of places to be and things to see. The mall is a short 10 minute walk and there are multiple restaurants surrounding the hotel grounds. Being from Canada, the kids were keen to attend IHOP everyday and the Buffalo Wild Wings was not far at all. The McDonalds was always on the kids list, although we never made it (I want to so this was an accident but Mama Bear, is not keen on McDonalds). Overall, everyone was very pleased and we would take any opportunity to go again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very large complex which can get noisy. At the end of the beach area, but very easy to walk. Typical resort pricing so used Uber to travel to several local restaurants. Our first time, but talking with repeat visitors the hotel is over crowed during the summer. Our unit on seventh floor with was still very noisy from the pool with closed early. Unit was in great shape and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Must do if you are staying in Waikiki ... nothing comes close to fireworks on Friday - great bars and great beaches .... The view from the penthouse is to die for .... and the size of the 3 bedroom is spectacular- you will always remember it .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at this Hotel for three days before boarding cruise ship. When we arrived we had to stand in line for forty minutes to register.They want nothing but you to pay extras for a very poor service.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The resort is beautiful. Perfect location of the beach. Great staff who care about your comfort and happiness during your stay. We usually stay if the lagoon tower which is our favorite. We can't wait for our next trip. Love the place and people

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: as a Hilton owner we were excited to spend 2 weeks in a studio condo with a partial kitchen... in the lagoon towers. Smooth checkin, kind staff and beautiful leis graced our necks by wide smiled employees. once we entree or room though, there wasn't a partial kitchen but a sink...toaster...microwave and mini fridge and there wasn't the first dish to cook with in the microwave. there wasn't any ice on any floor and no ice maker in the fridge. although this was a huge inconvenience all I had to do was dial 54 and they met our needs and requests. day 2 of our room we started seeing cockroaches and called the manager. 3 times of spraying and it got better but my asthma was triggered by the chemicals and required breathing treatments. the hotel was great. management called me daily to inquire on my health and was wonderful to meet all needs. we have 1 week left on this trip but wanted to get this review our there. check weather advisory statements for VOG not fog...but volcanic ash smog. it plays havoc on anyone with breathing issues. I recommend wearing a mask everywhere when bad and I'd needed there is an urgent care hawaii across the street from the village. they are great and short lines. enjoy and aloha. Beautiful huge village resort with several different hotels etc and it's almost like a labyrinth of over priced stores...restaurants and

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Once again another great vacation at the hilton vacation club.I know not to thinks that everything will be perfect all the time, and i treat all people with respect.I always have wonderful experiences and stays at the HGVC locations.I travel to experience different places and enjoy life. Staying at the Hilton just lets me concentrate on other things.Its not cheap, but they do whatever is necessary to keep me happy.Great views, great location, great staff.It is waikiki beach, not a deserted beach on the maui, so how can somebody be surprised.pictures of all these places can be found on numerous sites, even google, and google earth.just do your homework.internet is free.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I stay here just about every year during the summer, but this time we stayed over holidays. HHV is an extremely busy property year round. We choose to stay at the Lagoon Tower because of the size of the rooms, the location of the building, and the ease of getting into and out of Waikiki. It's not smack dab in the middle of what everyone imagines Waikiki to be, but that's what we like. The Lagoon Tower is a converted condo so the room sizes are comfortable, as opposed to the more recently constructed Grand Waikikian, where the rooms are more hotel sized. We always stay in a 2-bedroom ocean front because those are the nicest rooms. These rooms were recently refurbished. Carpets are not as drabby and worn and the furniture is new. Kitchen appliances seem to have remained the same, though. The chairs in the living room are a joke. It's quite possible the designer never sat in the chair. It is downright uncomfortable. There's two of them, so really the only seating options are the couch and the patio furniture.Lagoon still has an elevator problem where you have to make sure you allot enough time to catch an elevator during peak times. They are fast cars so once you get on it's not so bad. Guests seem to have learned to queue better except for the occasional rude head of the family that thinks they are more important than everyone else waiting for the elevator.Aside from that, if you want to stay in the middle of Honolulu with a larger family, hands-down, this is the place to be aside from a vacation rental home. Despite the negatives at this location, it's still our preferred hotel while in town.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Hilton Lagoon Tower in the one bedroom apartments overlooking the swimming pool and yacht/boating area/with a view towards the ocean. We were welcomed with drinks and beautiful lei necklaces made of a brown nut. We went onto the beach area one night to watch the free fireworks show. Breathtaking. Oahu is a paradise in every way. Every family should go to Hawaii at least once in their life!The one bedroom was beautiful with a sitting area, fold out bed/couch, and a kitchen. Down the hall there was a laundry room where we could wash and dry our clothes. Guests that stayed in the lagoon tower were always saying hello to one another. Staff were always kind and helpful. In the village, there is everything you could possibly need. There were various swimming pools to choose from, the beach, shopping arcades, restaurants, jewelry shops, mini marts...even music at night. Our two boys just went bananas on the beach, swimming pool, and play areas. Wonderful in every way!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Where do I start....over crowded, dirty, noisy, chaotic, lacking customer service, moldy, and disorganized experience in a 1 bedroom condo. I expected a 4-5 star experience and, as a frequent traveler, can honestly say this is a 1-2 star resort at best.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: When is an “ocean-view room” not one? When, entering your room, literally the only thing one sees is lanais across at the Ilikai Hotel next door? When not even the first glimpse of water can be seen before two-thirds of the way into the room, and not much more until almost at the lanai doors? Who would call that an ocean view? As I found out when I complained, HGVC does. And no rooms with any more of an ocean-view room were available . . . leaving me stuck with my Ilikai view for the duration of my stay and having to keep at least the sheer draperies closed the whole time to even imagine the ocean was out there.The Lagoon Tower accommodation was comfortable enough and fully equipped, but awfully plain, with clunky furniture more suited to an institution. Also, other guests could be easily heard through the connecting door between our rooms. Still, the Hawaiian Village location, with its expansive ocean and lagoon frontage, wide beaches, lush landscaping, abundant on-site dining and shopping, and proximity to other attractions, including Ala Moana Park and the shopping center, is unbeatable in Waikiki. But on a return stay, an actual ocean view and a non-connecting room would be nice.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Island of Oahu was a "3"... Honolulu was CONGESTED, Restaurants were EXPENSIVE, and cost of everything was way OVERPRICED! (I "Get it"... It's an island, and everything is imported, BUT it's not for this guy! ... As far as this Hilton property goes, it was quite Modern, Clean, and expansive (hence the 5 Stars) BUT I could never go back there again due to the Hawaii lifestyle/environment ... Foodland, a few blocks away, was the most reasonable place for groceries (40+% higher than AZ.) and we ended up eating at the Round Table Pizza place 3 of 5 nights because that was the only sit-down/non-buffet restaurant where you could dine for under $100/couple!... p.s.: Thanks "Round Table" for providing a pretty good pizza and food offering! We did travel the entire island, end enjoyed some tourist sites, BUT the traffic was horrific!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Overall we had a great time at the HHV. The property is immense, and it was nice to have shopping and small restaurants on the property that accepted room charge payments (but were not necessarily part of the hotel's restaurant choices). For example, you can eat in/take out at Round Table Pizza, CJ's Deli, Fresco Italian restaurant, and Blue Water Crab. There is easy quick access to the beach (crowded but nice), the Atlantis submarine tour company is right on site, service at the restaurants was very good and friendly. The pool was very nice, w/ several water slides. 2 were not operational when we were there, but the one that was involved a dark tunnel - very speedy and fun! My 5 year old son had a blast with that water slide. You have access to free DVD rentals of new releases (DVD Now). That is a nice thing for families. Stayed at the Lagoon Tower, one of several tower residences at the HHV. We had a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen (full size refrigerator and 4 burner electric stove, full size microwave, dishwasher, utensils and plates - wonderful for families). The other really great thing is the free use of laundry & drying machines on most if not all the floors of the Lagoon Tower. This was invaluable as we had been vacationing for 1 week at other resorts in other parts of Hawaii, and being able to do laundry conveniently and for free is AMAZING (any family with small children will definitely agree). There is a Play station 3 in the living room, attached to a 50+ inch size flat screen TV. Self parking is available for $32/day. It was convenient. One complaint - no recycling on the property. That may not bother some people, but it did bother me. There was so much in terms of water bottles, cans, glass bottles, paper, etc that were just thrown into the trash. Very strange especially for being in Hawaii (the Target in Maui for example does not provide any plastic bags to customers at check out). Honestly I took my soda/water bottles to the airport and recycled it there when we left!
user_name:
selo11
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Upon arrival we were treated poorly, we were made to sit outside with an infantile child for at least an hour because they could find our reservation, though we had called 5-7 times to confirm. Then we were told we were on the wrong Island, once again we had called continuously to confirm. One of the person could not make the trip due to medical emergency and Hilton Grand Vacation treated us like we had stole something, made threats, and were just unprofessional. This was extremely disheartening because we had gone there with the intent to buy.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian village. We had a two bedroom suite, which was clean, well appointed, and extremely spacious. It was a perfect room for a large family. We were upgraded to a room with a great view of the lagoon and the beach. For the size of the room, the price was more reasonable than the other hotels on property. There are plenty of shops and places to eat on property. The restaurants are mostly average, but is is a quick walk to some very good restaurants and shopping. Waikiki Beach is busy, with lots of families, restaurants, and activities. Hilton Hawaiian Village is located in the middle of it all.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: we`ve been arrived over 6pm at Hilton vacation club at Hawaiian village , then I recognized that I`ve booked the wrong room type for family ,Actually I never did not know that before to arrive. I had sever change to fix the hotel so there`s something mistake happen w/ communication with Hilton honor or by . Then I`ve had an unpleasant experience by the staff and manger. They are very rude , and seemed like to drive my family out even 2year/4year old kids, they said to me to find out other hotel ,and they suggested to pay the over 500$ room per night , even that I can get the cooperate rate room as around $200/night by hilton mobile web as rear time. They do not trying to do their best just said they did their best , but if customer did not feel same?.Specially the manager , she made me so upset by the rude manner and high handed attitude she ruined the our first night at the Hawaii. Good words cost nothing but are worth much. I still have unpleasant memories of that day.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We booked as possible buyers and got a nice upgrade. Spent a week loving the view with big sliders for air flow and two decks to relax. Perfect location to view friday night fireworks. Beware of the door switches that kill the a/c, ask about them.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Resort was fantastic but it was right on the beach! Waikiki is the busiest part of the island which is directly where this hotel sits. Room was great, beds slept wonderful, property very clean. Parking is very expensive as is the food near the hotel. If you Rent-A-Car which I highly suggest you do to check out the rest of the island there are many food trucks restaurants that are very reasonable and very delicious once you get out of the Waikiki area. Allow lots of extra time for travel to get out of downtown Honolulu. If you don't rebt a car there are many places that offer pick up to do the tours they offer. We found the lowest rates for a car at Discount Hawaii Car rental. And I know how to find the good deals, I promise this is the best company to rent from. Lowest rates with the major rental companies. Also, snorkel with turtles and dolphins and watch whales with SailHawaii.comYou won't be disappointed!!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The village with shops was nice. Lagoon and beach were nice but nothing was included. Prices were very high for even a beach chair. Only 2 hot tubs on the whole property and only one tiny slide was working while we were there. Balconies were small and too high for our small children.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There is a $30 resort charge added to your bill. No restaurant on premises. The check in (registration) and elevators are separated. You have to walk downstairs to go up the elevator. The room fan is noisy in the bedroom.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the room alone, but travelled with others staying on the hotel side. It was heaven to me. Yes, it gets busy but the resort is so big there was never a problem. The rooms very very spacious and had everything I could have needed or wanted. I had a standard view, but I could look out over the marina to the ocean. The staff were so friendly and very helpful. I realize it's all subjective. Living in Japan has made me appreciate things like space, dishwasher, and clothes dryer. I felt spoilt. I loved it. The only complaint is the daily resort charge that doesn't cover the beach chairs or umbrellas.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Tower is a 1970s time warp . Even though the room has been modernised by the lift is very slow . In the past visit we have allocated the higher floor so the view is beautiful especially at sunset . This time we were given a lower follor , the noise from the children pool , the sand machine at 5am , the linen trolley , the live musi on Sat night was unbearable . Never again on the lower floor with next to no sleep . Also the Honolulu marathon force us to leave the hotel at 4am some 4.5 hours before our flight . More negative about this hotel - there was glass in the bathroom , no slipper , the kitchen equipment is very basic , the bell men were unreposnsive to most request . On the positive side , the check in was quicker that the main lobby , a text message to let you know when your room is ready ( unlike the Westin ocean Villa in Maui - no communication what so ever- Shame SPG!!!)

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: read my previous review from 7 years ago that was just a gong shownrented this from my friend got booked a 2 bdrooms Oceanview plus for a week at the beginning of December. called in ahead to request diamond head side and a higher floor.anyways arrived at the hotel at 330pm and checked in1(last time I checked in here was horrible.) was informed that the rooms weren't ready but wold be in about 20 minutes. however the front desk agent corrected herself and said it's available now however it's on the 8th floor. having read numerous threads and TA reviews I know that the laua would be loud ish however the agent assured me that it would be until 9pm or so..okay whatever she said that we would be in the room adjacent to the ocean front..as this was dragging along(seriously it took 20 mons to check in..my kids were running around going crazy) I didn't feel like waiting any longer and would accept the compromise for the 8th floor but better view room(865)also they were nice enough to accept packages on my ehalf from amazon so that worked out great..30 minutes later I was given my keys and we were to park at the parkade. now this parkade..first 2 floors are valet only so u gotta bring all ur luggage strollers whatever else you have down..luckyou us the first thing we found was a escalator..where the heck is the elevator??(we found that later on)so after an adventure getting from the third floor to the room man..what a room. The view was gorgeous, couldn't ask for a better view well maybe a oceanfront. Glad to see they updated the furnishings and that tv is awesome..well besides the tv guide not really being accurate. the kitchen was fully stocked with everything you need including a rice cooker.the master bathroom..man I read abut the bidets and I loved it. at first it took a little getting used to but man once you use it you can't go back. The sofa is a pullout bed but we never used.okay now on to my main complaint..it's the noise. we couldn't get away from it. the lounge plays music till 1030-11pm and it carries all the way over. slightly annoying but whatever. my sister and brother rin law took the other bathroom and thr delivery trucks and the little sand grooming carts would wake them up at 530-6am everyday. would a higher floor solve that? maybe..so I regret not going to themanager about the noise.we used the pool once and it was cold..we preferred to go to the beach itself and it sucked not having a shower or foot rinse thing besides at he pool area..hassle to go there with kids and ur beach crap.laundry was convenient we ran several loads but ran into the problem of people leaving their laundry in the machines and not taking them out..house keeping can't touch t so you have to call for a manager to move it and bag it up. housekeeping was great since we were using a timeshare they cleaned it once for us and they were great about providing anything else you needed by calling or texting.the location is good and bad...the good it's way easier to drive here then our usual destination at the wyndham beachwalk. the bad is that it's damn far away from everything 15 mins walk to ala moana or 20 min walk to kapahulu or Kuhio. my feet were killing me by the end of our trip.during checkout the power went out..lol I seriously have the weirdest moments ago the front desk area..always an adventure! that being said..our family enjoyed the hotel and my kids would have enjoyed it more if they were older..PS: food on site is a marked up eg. blue ocean shrimp is $18 vs 15 at the mall..we would drive to get food like at me bbq, poke from foodland or udon from marakume, also a food pantry on Hobron.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Don't book the studio apartments in the lagoon tower - they are right next to the elevators which will keep you awake throughout the night. Otherwise the resort is in a handy location to Waikiki, Ala Moama, and the beaches/parks.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, on Waikiki Beach was awesome. This Hilton Grand Vacation Club Resort is where I always wanted to stay. After years of planning I spent 3 years worth of points for 16 nights in a 1 bedroom Ocean View suite. The Hotel, pools, ground, beach were all beautiful, giving us one of the best vacations ever. With in walking distance of all of Waikiki and the the Ala Moana Center. We even walked to the Ward Center. Waikiki is one of the best walking cities in the world.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We arrived late at night. Excellent friendly checkin. Had a one bedroom plus lock off. Comfortable in every way with all maintenance up to date, with everything clean and working.Large resort, with many activities. The weather was unusually unsettled with extreme winds, but there was always things to do.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I stayed at Hilton Hawaiian Village on November 26 to December 1, 2016. This place is a wonderful place to relax and unwind. Beautiful and clean facility, friendly staff. Plenty of things to do and see in Honolulu, but even if one just stays at the resort, it is also good.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Awful. Everything of this property has gone downhill since its opening. You cannot imagine my disappointment. They don't really care about you at all. My requests for my reservations request went unnoticed when I requested it at least three times for a room away from the noisy Luau above the parking garage. The property is losing its appeal. The new renovations have cheap looking furnishings and very uncomfortable. They really need to improve their staff services. It is a disappointment to the max.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Kalia Tower for 2 weeks at HHV. Our unit had a full kitchen including stove and refrigerator which is helpful in saving on dining. We usually made our own breakfast and sometime lunch and went out for dinner. Our suite was very nice updated and on par with what I'd expect from Hilton brand. The staff was very friendly,helpful and accommodating. The property itself is gigantic and you never have to leave the property if you so desire. There are plenty of shopping and dining choices on property. My husband and I had a great time here waking up every morning to our ocean view. I definitely recommend HHV for shopping and dining but as far as lodging I've only stayed at Kalia Tower and found it to be awesome and would definitely stay again and again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Worth money spent, service and amenities provided are really good, ensure you are not carrying your work with you. I wish flying time specially while going could have been reduced. Hospitality of the staff was commendable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I booked two rooms (via the Hilton Honors Website). When my family arrived we checked-in and were given rooms right next to the noisy elevators. I spent over $ 3000.00 to be next to the noisy elevators, literally 1-3 feet away. After going to bed, you can hear intermittent rumbling sounds all night.I think the hotel should inform guests up front if they book a room right next to noisy elevators. If I would have known this in advance, I would have booked in another tower were elevator locations are completely separate from the rooms. This terrible experience ruined my family's vacation.I also contacted the manager and corprate office and they said sorry, so stay at your own risk.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Lagoon Tower 2 bedroom suite was nice, clean and had comfortable beds. Had a great view of the ocean. The resort is nice and has lots of shops, plenty of options for dining and the main lobby bar had good live entertainment. The downside is it is busy and noisy, the pool area was very crowded and you had to rent beach chairs and umbrellas, also you have to pay about $30/day to park your car.
user_name:
James W
Massapequa Park, New York

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have been to the Hawaiian Islands many times and decided to come to busy HNL to use my points and check out Hilton Grand Resort - The Lagoon Tower. This was a very relaxfull place to just lay back and enjoy the scenery out my window and enjoy the beach and pool. Did have a rental car so traveled around the island several times to different areas but mostly enjoyed "my vacation" at the Hilton.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our first time to Oahu.HGVC consists of several(Hilton) resorts within the complex.Also within this complex are restaurants and merchandise shops.Our stay at the Kalia tower was a timeshare exchange. The way I understand it,the first 12 floors are hotel units and the upper floors are the timeshare units. Our stay on the 16th floor was ocean front and was very nice. I'd guess the unit size was approx 1000 sq ft with typical HGVC features. I guess each resort in the complex has its positives and maybe negatives. One thing that we liked about Kalia was it was closest to the entrance of the Hawaiian village and thus quieter,without the crowd of pedestrians about the area.(Also,you can check in at the Kalia bldg if staying there)There is a Starbucks at the lobby level. Observations:the beach will be the longest distance to travel amongst the buildings. The Kalia pool appears to be smaller than the other resorts/buildings. Incidentally,none of the pools throughout the complex are heated... and they are cold until ya get use to them. Only things I could say that could be an improvement are: The AC fan speeds on high provides minimal circulation. Ceiling fans in the bedroom and living room would be helpful. At times,It felt like a hot 68 degrees.Parking: Parking is not cheap at 32 bucks a day. 39 for valet.Pay the extra bucks for parking,as getting to your car isnt the easiest and... when the resort is crowded or conferences on site... you can drive around a bit before finding a space- Pay the extra 50 bucks(as nothing is cheap in Hawaii).Should I rent a car? YES. If you really want to see the island,just booking tours isnt going to do it... Getting out of Waikiki will allow you to drive to the more natural,scenic areas. Traffic won't be alot of fun but things will quiet down once you get off the "H" highways and cruise along the coast around the island. Restaurants: there are plenty of choices within the area. Some at the village can get quite pricy,which I guess is ok if you are rich like I'm not(30 dollar breakfasts come to mind). Another good reason to rent that car. Also,a drive to the nearby Walmart worked for us for getting coffee and mornin stuff. Other good choices within 1 mile or less walking distances(see those reviews) and plenty of choices by car and cheaper.Lastly: all the staff was very nice and helpful at our Kalia Tower stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: With 3 nights in Waikiki before heading to other islands, the HGVC village was a good starting point. The view from our 1 bedroom 3 room unit 7th floor was terrific--ocean, main lawn, Friday fireworks. The resort is geared to families, which made for good entertainment, watching little ones attend a big Halloween party, then dash for cover when rain started--then ended! Hilton goes all out to work for every guest. One would not need to leave the village--lots of shopping, restaurants, beach, pools, and events!The Army Museum in a WWII armory is just a short walk on the beach and was a very enlightening place to see some of what happened after the bombing of Pearl Harbor. Especially interesting was the history of the Japanese-American military contributions.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My room was supposed to be a studio with a kitchenette. It's so small I can barely move around in it. There is no kitchenette. It's just a regular room that I could have gotten for about 50$ a night cheaper at the regular Hilton Hawaiian Village. Doesn't feel very special. Just stay at HHV.
user_name:
screen_name21212015
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Best stay in Honolulu because the One Bedroom Suite was quite nice. The staff was professional, efficient and extremely courteous. Nice resort with great shopping, high in stores and close to a real nice mall. Starbucks onsite for coffee lovers.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have been a fan of the Hilton Hawaiian Village since my first stay in 1984. Unfortunately, it has become a victim of its overwhelming popularity with the additional towers added over the years. More city like than a resort village, 10 minute elevator waits are common. Then you are packed in like a Tokyo subway.. Crowded all the time, the charm of this still beautiful resort, is a sad disappointment. We won't stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed her before (11 years ago) and came back. Enjoyed it then and still do. There is a lot to do if you have young children or teenagers as well for the adults. Fireworks on Friday night are great. View from balcony was excellent.
user_name:
Sandy E
Bonita Springs, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton Hawaiian Village remains a big part of the Waikiki hotel scene. They have thousands of rooms and thousands of guests. If you are lucky enough to be there when there is NOT a convention from some organization, you may not be as crowded. However, the Great Lawn, is always open to various events, most of which, you cannot attend since you are NOT part of whatever organization is holding the event. The Rainbow Lanai is a waste of space. It is only used in the morning for an expensive breakfast area. It should be opened for ALL dining.
user_name:
Stephen P
Chino, CA, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Tower at Hilton Hawaiian Village at Waikiki Beach was the perfect location to celebrate our 25th Anniversary! The King Plus suite with full kitchen, living and dining areas plus balcony allowed us to enjoy the beach, tour the island and retire to the comforts of home!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: enjoyable but a busy family location with facilities to keep busy or to just relax. Employees are well trained and available to help when requested. Convenient to the rest of the island facilities. Good check in and check out services
user_name:
Robert Nicholas M
Cortlandt Manor,New York, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I go to Hawaii at least twice a year because I own at Hilton Grand Vacations Timeshare. I love the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Lagoon Tower specifically! The Ocean view Diamondhead side is the best! I go at least twice a year. The building used to be an apartment building before the 90s, I believe, so the units are a nice size. Very roomy. The balconies are also spacious. The view from the Lagoon Tower is the best and it is the closest condo building to the water. Last time we were there they were shooting Hawaii 5-0 right below us at the Lagoon! We were able to stand on our balcony and watch. There are many activities on the "Great Lawn" right below us that are fun to watch...weddings, company parties etc...and sometimes there is full on entertainment going on there--hula dancing and all! We also can peak in on the Luau's that happen almost everyday and the view for the Friday night fireworks is awesome! We always have dinner on our balcony that evening. The only thing that would be a bit better is the look of the lobby. It's very worn out compared to the lobbies for all the other condo units in the resort which are all beautiful. The rooms, however, have all been updated, so that is the most important.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We enjoyed our stay. The suite was perfect - very comfortable and luxurious if that is what you're looking for. I normally like a smaller, less commercial place but this was really nice. There was a lot to do in the area.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The reason you come to Hawaii is to be by the ocean, and this resort is right there! The Hilton Hawaiian Village is crowded, because everyone wants to be here, and all of Waikiki is busy, but you don't have to drive to the ocean. You are at the ocean!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Bring a lot of tip money. On arrival if you have a car is 35 for parking a day or valet of 38 I think. You can't use luggage carts there only for bellman. If your not going all over Island don't rent car, you can take a bus everywhere. The drivers are awful. Go to walmart for beach chair and umbrella.Chairs and umbrella are $40.00 something for 2hrs. No top sheet have to ask for when you check in.The Marina side is quieter, all the activities are on the lawn side. First few floors are valet parking only. The cheesecake factory had the best food for the money.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Number of beds for 6 adults and 1 infant was great. Location was wonderful and the ocean view was gorgeous. Fireworks view from our balcony was great on Friday. The garden was busy almost every night with an event.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I recently stayed in the Lagoon tower (Oct 2016) It was myself, my husband, and my 2 sons (10 yrs and 8 months old) We booked a 1 bedroom plus suite with ocean view. We used our Hilton timeshare points to score this luxurious room. Everything exceeded our expectations to having our own check-in lobby that was not busy at all so the process was very efficient and took like less than 5 min. Our luggage was delivered in no time and everyone who works at the Hilton is extremely friendly and very willing to help. Hilton's standards are really high. Our room was fully equipped with a full kitchen and more than enough room for a family of 4. Our view was amazing!!! You literally don't ever have to leave the Hilton Hawaiian Village because everything you need is all there. Many pools to chose from, the Lagoon and beach are right there, so many restaurants and little deli places to eat. We spent most of our time at the Kids pool with the water slides as my 10 year loved swimming there. This was our first time back since purchasing the Hilton timeshare 2 years ago and we decided to upgrade our timeshare. We are so excited to come back. Thank you Hilton Hawaiian Village for making our vacation even more memorable and enjoyable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our home base during our stay in Oahu, and it was heavenly. We did all the sightseeing of the Island that we could possibly fit in during our stay, and then we spent our extra hours at the resort enjoying the pools, the beach, the restaurants, the shopping, the music, and all the amenities that this 5-start resort property provides.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed 12 nights in a 2 bedroom villa located in the Lagoon Tower, 3 adults and 3 children and we had a fantastic holiday. We couldn't complain about a thing, great service, location and atmosphere. I would recommend this resort to couples and families!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Nothing to brag about! However, the personnel and all staff were excellent! A few more shops and restaurants would have been more impressive. Nice to visit, but owning property here would be quite foolish!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Kalia Tower that we stayed in this year is good. Everything goes well from check-in to how the room is presented. We do love staying here, it's quite close to everything, and the resort is really something to behold, numerous pools, dining options and things to do.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Wow, Hilton resorts knocks it out of the park... a perfect suite, with Kitchen and a great view... Ocean, Garden and City/Mountain view, all from one room... the staff are super friendly and the facilities are second to none...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the Lagoon Tower on the 17th floor. Was the 1st Balcony facing the ocean. Please note, they don't tell you which condo you will be staying in ahead of time. We were lucky to get a good location. The condo itself was very spacious. No complaints about the condo except you can hear music and the Luau if you are on the balcony. You can call anytime when you need any towels, dish towels, coffee etc. The lobby area is much less congested than the hotel section. Make sure when you check in that you are at the right building. On Saturday, mostly, the elevator is crazy. There are three elevators of which one is used by the staff for bringing up luggage etc. and only about 8 people can fit in them. They will give you a letter ahead of time to tell you to plan accordingly if you leave on Saturday. Waikiki is only about a mile or so away.All the staff was great and very helpful. There are a few pools, shopping, although it is more high end, coffee/ice cream shop, ABC stores which has just about everything and reasonably priced. Can't say much about restaurants as we did are own cooking.I wouldn't stay again just because I stayed in a condo on the Big Island that was only 4 floors and we were right at the ocean with constant crashing of the waves 24/7. Had I stayed here first I may have felt differently.All in all it was a nice place but expensive.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It was a pleasant stay, lot of activities going on at the property if you wanted to stay. Concierge was helpful to arrange for activities. Lots of eating establishments on property, beach is right there when you walk out the back of the hotel. Pleasant music playing from one of the establishments that you could listen too by the beach. We stayed in a small studio room.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If possible avoid the Lagoon tower side toward the Ilikai Hotel There is a loud irritating high pressure air sound that goes on all day and evening. Makes the use of the Lanainot pleasant at all. Called the guest services and asked to have the sound terminated but nothing was done. Also, the back side of the Lagoon tower is right over the Luau show area so if you like most evenings being assailed from both sides of your condo with a loud hissing sound and drums and yells this is the place to reside.Other than that all was well,,,,nice staff, great accommodations and being in Hawaii was a nice experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was a long saved for holiday for our family of 5 and we certainly hit the jackpot with the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We stayed in a 2 BR / 2 bathroom apartment in the Lagoon Tower and it was fantastic. The beds & pillows were perfect, the apartment was spacious & adequate. having a fully operational kitchen in our apartment was convenient for a quick breakfast as well as having a laundry on each floor of the tower was great too. The facilities at this resort were amazing, access to the pools, lagoon & the beautiful uncrowded beach to snorkel, see turtles & other sea life without crowds was perfect too. Make sure you're staying on a Friday night so you don't miss the free fireworks that happen each Friday night. It is a short stroll of about 10 -15 minute walk along the beach to the shops and restaurants. The location of the Hilton Hawaiian Village was ideal. You won't be disappointed if you choose this property for your accommodation in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the Lagoon Tower. Outstanding room that lives up to the Hilton Brand. I have stayed at other properties on the island and this property never disappoints. Service, accommodations, and location always make HHV my first choice.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: While not an ideal resort for the budget conscious, I loved it. We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment in the Lagoon Tower. Our room was great. There was a wide variety of eating options on site or a fully equipped kitchen for self catering. The resort was clean and staff efficient. Word of warning, don't let the little ones leave their sleep toys in the bed when they get up. We lost 2 precisely family members not to be found by the laundry. Otherwise, we loved the place and will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great Hotel. Our flight was late in arriving so unfortunately we only had a couple of hours to enjoy the pools and the next day we were on a all-day Pearl Harbor tour. The only odd thing was the slides closed at 5:00 p.m.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Disappointed in the studio room size but happy with location, great staff and the outside village holiday amenities offered were excellent. The lighting in the bathroom was not conducive for makeup application and the studio room was not very large so it felt rather confined. We would stay in the location again but would use the Hotel rooms in preference as we have used them before and decided to try the vacations amenities for this time stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have mixed feelings about this review. I love Hilton Hawaiian village and have stayed here about 10 times so far - always in the rainbow tower: this time the hotel was sold out and had to get a room in the timeshare tower - Lagoon. I do not like staying at a timeshare in Hilton compared to the hotel - as a diamond member the benefits are terrible. In the hotel you get all the benefits of being diamond including room upgrades, late checkout and food vouchers for you and a guest each day of your stay (they used to have a lounge but no more). When you stay in the timeshare section you get two bottles of water during your stay and 2,000 Hilton points - that is it! Really no benefit at all which is frustrating. Plus checkout is firm at 10 AM. The timeshare rooms are bigger and have a kitchen which can be useful for some families (I have never cooked on vacation - well, don't cook at home either so I guess I never need one :). Bathroom was outdated. Balcony was nice. Hallway loud with doors slamming all night (that can happen anywhere). Views not as nice as rainbow tower.The Hilton village itself though is wonderful and I would not stay anywhere else on the island. Beautiful grounds and pools. The gym in the Tapa tower could use some updating. The resort fee is outrageous! Come on - 30 bucks plus tax for internet?! That is not unique to this hotel but is just a travesty in the hotel industry. Just add hat to the cost of the room and not call it a resort fee. (Personal pet peeve there).The timeshare sales pitch is relentless. Asked where the bathrooms are and got cornered into a 5 minute spiel. Although we ended up doing the presentation for some Hilton village dollars to spend during our stay. 90 minutes of our time was well worth it and it was pressure free. The beach is amazing. Last minor complaint is with the towel stands. The pools close at 7 yet the towel stand closes at 5 at some pools? It then directs you to another pool and towel stand which was also closed. This happened on two nights. Can't they keep the towel stands open till the pool closes? Overall though will definitely stay at the hotel part of the Village again. But if you end up at the timeshare it is nice as well!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have been enjoying HGVC Hawaiian Villege Lagoon Tower almost every years last 10years, and loving one of the best time share facility in the world, by its location not only near to the beach but also near to the shopping area, spacy room unit, nice view and friendly staffs. Thank you HGVC.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I had a King suite on the 4th floor described as garden view. From the balcony, we could still see the lagoon and ocean through the palms. The room was huge. The TV was huge. The service was truly great. All requests (more coffee, more coat hangers etc. ) were immediately provided with a smile. I was worried the resort may be 'touristy' but it was not. We enjoyed the resort facilities (pools, shopping, restaurants) just as much as we enjoyed exploring Oahu.
user_name:
Simon B
St Petersburg, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This hotel has it all and if they don't have something they will make it available for you. The family had a wonderful time on the private beach and pool. I would recommend it to anyone staying in Waikiki!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great vacation, this property has a lot to offer, 2 ABC stores on property, the pools were excellent. The room was clean, the mattress could've been a bit nicer for an upscale hotel, but it was pretty nice. Staff was excellent and polite. The only thing we ordered from room service was pizza and I can't from wiki wiki pizza I highly recommend you don't order this pizza it was expensive and we only ate half of it tasted rather nasty. There's a roundtable on the property with a much better pizza, but they don't deliver to your room.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed the 3-Day weekend with family and friends at Lagoon Tower, our favorite spacious vacation club property at the Hilton Hawaiian Village resort. In spite of hurricane Lester warning, the weather was great, the facilities were comfortable as usual, and everyone had a great time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Would never do business with HGV if the sales tactics used during my visit are typical. Location was good but too noisy with screaming children around the clock. Better for families but not for couples looking for a romantic escape.
user_name:
Ruben B
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at Hilton Hawaiian village in lagoon tower in August 2016. Room was a 1 bdrm garden view third floor unit facing the pool. Issues: Noise :Due to the fact that we were on a low floor the noise from the pool area was extensive which could be expected however the noise from the pool was still quite loud with balcony doors closed. (very poor sound proofing) I have stayed in low floor units at the grand waikikian (newer tower) and the soundproofing is so much better. (hilton needs to improve soundproofing at next refurb of lagoon tower)Pool with slides: Pool is way overcrowded to the point the pool was shut down multiple times for cleaning. (I am not just talking about unavailable chairs which is also an issue but literally the pool itself and number of bathers) This pool has the only slides on property the majority of families flock to this pool which is grossly undersized. I also question how good of a job they do cleaning the pool based on the dirty towel that was at the bottom of the closed slide the duration of our trip. (see photo) When the new timeshare tower opens which has only a plan for a small quiet pool which won't attract families I can only imagine the crowds then. Another issue I have is that the slides close at 5 pm. When on Oahu I believe many vacationers do activities during the day and return to the resort around this time only to discover that the slides are closed on the most popular pool. (why? cost cutting?) I stayed at Disney aulani and the water slides were open to 9 pm.Pool Staff: I have stayed at a good number of family timeshare resorts (multiple Disney Vacation Club resorts and Marriott vacation club resorts) and the staff here had to be the most unprofessional I have ever experienced. The staff was constantly on their cellphones talking / texting / listening to music and not doing an adequate job of monitoring the slides and pools. adults and children were jumping and climbing on rocks into the pool / at closing of slides adults and children climbed over fences and went down slides / no staff in area (one caveat security officers when on scene did enforce rules) Food: Specifically Poolside Pronto Pickle / food was premade, over priced and disgusting. Again I have stayed at dvc resorts and marriots and understand the premium price paid for poolside food (convenience etc.) however both those hotel chains provide good edible food. (hilton should be ashamed)Positives: Staff Front Desk, bell services, bar staff, restaurant staff (besides pool staff) were all very friendly and accommodating.Rooms: Clean,comfortable and spacious (except for soundproofing) and a good home base for a family visiting Oahu. Location: I have stayed at both Disney Aulani and Marriott Koolina and although I favor those resorts over HHV they are far away from the locations I like to visit on the island (south and east sides) Also as part of my Oahu trips I love to explore the local cuisine and HHV being located in Honolulu provides an abundance of dining opportunities touristy and non touristy unlike Koolina Resort Area which lacks the variety that HHV'S location provides.With the pros and cons of this resort I think people need to be aware of the issues before booking a stay and make their on choice on whether or not to stay here. I just wish Hilton would listen to some of the issues I have addressed as well as countless others which would really improve the quality of this resort in relation to other big name timeshare resorts.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a good experience and we are very satisfied. The service is excellent! Our room has a very nice view looking toward the pool, the lagoon, the beach and sunsets. Watched the fireworks right on the lanai too. We will stay at this place again and again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I'll start by telling you I didn't have the highest of expectations for this stay. While I expected a nice stay at a nice resort, the magnitude of this resort and the surrounding area caught me completely by surprise. I'll try to sum it up here as best I can. As I always do, I'll start with the cons and finish with what I really liked.Note that this is the Grand Vacations portion of Hilton Hawaiian Village, not the hotel/resort. I was very happy to find this time share section separate from the hotel. The hotel towers offered mostly basic hotel rooms and mostly double beds. Here we got a one bedroom, with kitchen and separate living room, for just a bit more than standard rooms at the resort cost. In my mind, it's a no brainer to book with Grand Vacations when possible.I only really have one gripe about my stay, and that was my room assignment. While I looked up floorplans for the building (Lagoon tower) and was happy with what I saw, the room I got was actually a little different. I was given a smaller room than the standard 1 bedroom because of the stairwell next door, so the room configuration was different. Instead of the open floorplan with kitchen+peninsula overlooking the living room, our small kitchen with little counter space was in a space no bigger than an oversized closet. After returning and looking more into it, it appears that these rooms are the *68 rooms on floors above the 8th floor. My brother and his family, who also booked a 1 bedroom, got the nicer floorplan across the hall. At the end of the day it didn't matter all that much to us. Our oceanview room overlooked the pool (from a high floor, very little noise), the marina, and the ocean. We could watch planes take off and land from the airport, and even saw our cruise ship come in the morning of our cruise. It was a spectacular view overall!Other than that minor gripe, I don't have much else negative to say. The resort is massive! I knew that going in but didn't fully grasp the magnitude. Lots of restaurants, shops, and activities right there in the village. The lagoon had a number of water toys to rent, provided a safe/calm area for young kids to play, and was gorgeous to look at. There were a number of pools, however we only made it to the one next to the Lagoon tower, which was the best in my opinion. There really was a lot to see just walking around the resort, it was fun to just grab a drink from the bar and walk around checking everything out. Restaurants ranged from nice sit-down restaurants to quick carry-out type places. It was great being able to grab a pizza and take it back up to our room. The only activity we did was SUP, which was a lot of fun. Very expensive, but the Lagoon is a great place to learn and find your sea legs.The location is great, right there at one end of Waikiki beach. It is possible to walk the length of the beach, though there's one section in front of the Sheraton where you need to go up and walk along a sidewalk right at the edge of the ocean. We walked about half way down the 1.9 mile beach one night before a thunderstorm pushed us back to our own resort. When you're tired of the beach, the Ala Moana shopping center is basically right across the street, and Waikiki itself is very walkable directly from the hotel. We walked to a good vantage point to watch the parade the day after thanksgiving, and then rushed back to the resort to see the Friday night fireworks.Parking is convenient to the tower, but expensive. However, when you have a kitchen if you take a trip to the grocery store and eat in for a few meals, you can pretty much make up for the parking charges right there. While it is expensive, it's a flat daily fee with in/out privileges.We checked out on a Saturday to head to the cruise port, and the lobby area (open air) was an absolute mess with the hordes of people all checking out. I don't know that there's much the property can do about that, as it's probably just a once-a-week occurrence. But it's something to be aware of. It took us about 30 minutes from when we got to the lobby until we were in a cab heading to the cruise port.All in all, I was very happy with the stay here. We definitely didn't stay here long enough (only 5 nights) to do everything the resort had to offer, and we are planning another trip. Next summer we'll be staying in a 2-bedroom for another 5 nights. I honestly wouldn't pick any other Waikiki property.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I LOVE Hilton Hawaiian Village we have stayed here on several occasions this time in the Kalia Tower Suites the room was excellent as is the resort. I always highly recommend this to families travelling to Hawaii.Pain points are that the checkin time when arriving at 6:00am is excruciating. Expensive to park your car (even if it is self parking)WIFI was only available in our room and not throughout the resort.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton brand is always quality. For location and amenities nothing beats Hilton Hawaiian Village. You don't ever have to leave the village but everything else is real close even walking distance. The people make it the best, though.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Loved it. We spent 7 nights in the resort 18th floor. Love: room was beautiful and spacious. The property and Hikton Village was great to explore. The location was perfect to access different parts of the island.Didn't love: late check in time(4pm). The pool was very crowded the slides opened late and closed early. To many small children and toddlers in the hot tubes.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a great resort, very roomy. Many events go around in the vielige, we attended morning yoga free classes with a great teacher, and more than 50 people were there. We love Luau, the extravagant performance was a wonderful experience,

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great place to stay for families. We did a couples trip. So we would have benefited from an adult only ! But overall lovely place to stay. Water front property and wonderful beaches. Great staff but will feel the difference in service if you are not a Gold member!!$$$

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Huge resort nice lagoon crowed pools very rocky beach but that's not the hotels fault. Be prepared for all the extra charges with no clear understanding of what your actually paying. When we checked in we were told "we upgraded your room" however it was what I already booked and they charged me for "free upgrade" not a clear ocean front room at all unless your hanging off the balcony. Resort fee for Internet TV and movies along with other random stuff that you can't seem to get. 15.00 a day for beach chair rentals that should be included in this "resort fee" Book everything in advance or you'll find yourself paying more money for "gold service" because apparently everything is sold out. Food is good same as on the main streets just double the price. Rooms are large showers great lots of hot water

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This place was great. Furnishings were up to date. Concierge was polite and gave great info. Our two bedroom suite was roomy and staff were available to give extra soap, towels, etc. Location was great and everything was within walking distance. Also public transportation was excellent for long trips. Restaurants were close by. Can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I've been a fan of Hilton Hawaiian Village for years so I was excited to return there and stay in the Lagoon Tower under the Hilton Grand vacation club. PROS--gorgeous lobby view, Paradise pool (with water slides) is directly connected to this property, lei greeting. EXCELLENT Bellman service with bag handling and checking out. CONS--slow check-in service, once I declined the full price "upgrade" I felt as though the service went out the window. The room was VERY basic, it looked more like a Red Roof Inn than a Hilton Resort, but triple the price!! Very disappointed in the dated fixtures and cracked bathroom plaster. This was one of the timeshare units, I am used to staying in the hotels there. I am not moved to purchase or attend a timeshare presentation based on this experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were extremely interested in purchasing a timeshare. However the packages did not meet our needs for vacations. The balcony view was very beautiful and the staff was helpful and courteous. I would definitely recommend the Hilton Resort to anyone.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My ohana look forward to our annual "staycation" at the Lagoon Towers and the Grand Waikikian. The family comes in from Pennsylvania, Michigan, Washington State and Nevada and we all meet at the Hilton Hawaiian village for an awesome time, swimming, eating, singing and just loving each other before returning to their homes and jobs. Mahalo for making it possible for the ohana to gather together under "one" Hilton roof. Our Ohana look forward to returning to the Lagoon Tower next summer in 2017. Ahui hou. Malama Pono.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village has so much going for it. The shopping and dinning are so fun and convenient. Our favorites are Lamperts for ice cream, the Honolulu Cookie Company and the Pizza place. There are a lot of other restaurants walking distance or a quick bus ride away. We always rent a car, but it's fun to walk to dinner in the area. The pools are great. My kids love the water slides and we all love the lagoon. We like to rent all of the toys (my favorite is the SUP) and the kids bring their snorkels to see fish and turtles right there in the lagoon. You can spend hours just floating around in lagoon on an inner tube bought from Target. I have stayed in the hotel once, and I will pay whatever it takes to be in the timeshares instead. A full kitchen and a separate bedroom make it a completely different level of vacation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We made this a girl trip and we had a great time! Would love to do more of these trips every year. We had a great time and the service we received from the staff was top notch. The room was great and was very home like. The only problem we had was with one of the sales managers in the sales office. Brian is his name and needs to be fired. We would have bought while there but he lost the sale. SAM was AWESOME!
user_name:
John C. R
Leesburg, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was a sisters trip. We all appreciated the warm lei greeting once we checked in. The bellman was quick to deliver our luggage to our room. We were all pleased with the accommodations.The property is beautiful. There are plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from. The only downside was, the pool and jacuzzi closed too early (7:00 p.m.). It would have been great to use these amenities a little long being that we are in a summer month.Overall our stay was great. The staff did a great job insuring that our stay was pleasant. I would recommend this property to my family and friends.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent a glorious week in the Lagoon Tower. The 2 bedroom condo was tasteful and comfortable. The view was amazing. Staying in the condo gives you access to all of the resort so there are multiple things to do. We loved the proximity to the beach, the lagoon,and the pool. Hilton staff was amazing answering every question and providing great service. The only small glitch was the lack of laundry facilities within the condo. Great place to stay in Wikiki!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: is always full. Really hope they would consider this seriously to set up something new for moee flexible reservation time slot or something for members near future. Otherwise, I really can not recomnend thismservice to others.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here in a two bedroom two bathroom unit with views of the rainbow tower and beautiful partial views of the water and lagoon.. This is a very busy complex with many high rise towers and wall to wall people so if you want seclusion this is not for you but its location is excellent - right on the beach with a lagoon as well which is ideal for kiddies. Two swimming pools one of which is suitable for children with slides etc. walking distance to ala Moana shopping centre and lewers st etc. There are unlimited number of restaurants in the complex and close by. Valet parking available and at times can be a bit slow . BEcause we were doing a lot of cooking in the unit The only issue we had was that the rubbish piled up in the kitchen as there was no where else to get rid of it and the maids didn't take it when cleaning the unit. We did overcome this by ringing down for someone to come collect . A utility room on each floor which could be accessed by guests would overcome this. We enjoyed the weekly Friday night show around the main pool and the fireworks .display

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We recently stayed here in a two bedroom unit in the Lagoon Tower. The unit was beautiful and very big. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, full kitchen - every thing you need. It was fantastic for our family of five. We booked a garden view and i was a bit worried about what our view would be. We had a corner unit with two balconies. The back balcony looked over the road and a carpark but the side balcony had a view of the great lawn and lagoon and beach - it was beautiful and perfect!!! From the back balcony you could see the resorts Luau each night - by night 10 i was a bit over it though!!! So loud! Also if they have a function on the great lawn it is very noisy. They had one the first day we arrived and after no sleep on our flight over it was awful as the children kept waking to the sound of loud drums and singing! Lucky they don't have functions on every night. We had housekeeping daily - all very satisfactory.The Lagoon Tower also had its own check in - when we arrived no one was waiting and the lady at check in was lovely. Compared to the main check in where i never saw a line of less than 20 people i was very grateful for this.The resort is huge - very much a village but we loved it! It was very busy and children everywhere. The pools were packed and there was never an empty pool lounge but if you wait a few minutes people are always coming and going. There isn't enough shade by the pools though especially in the middle of summer. My children loved the beach so the fact the resort was on the beach is perfect. There were so many options..beach, pool, lagoon - it was perfect. Only a 10 minute walk into town too!We ate at Tropics, the pizza store and got numerous items from the ABC store as well. It had everything you need. We ate brekky in our room every day all with items purchased from ABC Store. For lunches you can have ready made sandwiches and salads too - all very nice. You couldn't order food to eat by the pool - you had to go and get it yourself but you could order drinks. It was expensive to hire beach umbrellas and chairs from the resort - crazy you have to pay for shade when you are paying so much for the resort. If you walk down the beach a bit SUP's and umbrellas, chairs are cheaper. Surf lessons should be done on the iconic Waikiki Beach - a lot better than at the resort.The resort was great - we loved it but its huge and there is nothing personal about it. I would recommend it though and stay there again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Whether your the adventurous traveler that enjoys sight-seeing or the relaxed traveler looking for rest, relaxation and pampering, this resort meets the need of every vacationer. The concierge staff are knowledgeable and extremely helpful in making dinner reservations, booking island tours, or another excursion. If you're looking for an escape where you can sit back and relax, the property offers everything from shopping, a wide selection of restaurants, room service, a spa for some pampering, and multiple on site activities (pools, water sports, fitness center, etc.). This, by far, was the best stay/experience of all our trips to O'ahu. The resort suite was convenient, clean, and above all, comfortable - it felt like our "home away from home" during our stay; as such, I'm looking forward to our next stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There was only ONE valet for over 600 rooms of guests! 20 minutes for the valet to get your car each time is too much. Any type of requests that required a real person took forever! Dining reservations, spa reservations, concierge, Wifi help. Any interaction with real people was like they were totally overwhelmed and had no time to help you.
user_name:
Roy Robert Y
napa, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: No other place to visit in my opinion is the Hilton Hawaiian Village hotel. The best location ever! I have stayed in this hotel complex close to 10 times, and the area never failed us. So, we are for sure coming back in two years to this place we are regarding home away from home!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Best time ever at the HIlton Grand Resort!!! Very clean excellent staff. I will definitely come again and stay at the HIlton Grand Vacation Villa. The food and prizes were reasonable. Our family of 21 just had a marvelous time their.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is hands down one of the best hotels and locations when staying in Honolulu. We stayed at the Lagoon tower this time and the room was GREAT! We didn't have the ocean view, but our two-bedroom suite included a double balcony with a front seat view of the Friday firework show. The kids loved it. Our room had a 56 inch flat screen in the living room and 40 inch flat screens in the other rooms. Full kitchen with stove and dishwasher. Awesome room. House cleaning could use some improvement, two of the 5 days we stayed the room was not vacuumed and the room cleaning a bit shady - other than that, excellent stay. Everything you need (shopping, food, activities) all right here on site. A bit pricey, but convenient.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed the close proximity to shops and restaurants in the Hilton Village. My concern is that it appears there are no security personnel to verify hotel guests from non-hotel guests who were using the pools.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed in the Lagoon Tower. This place is an amazing place to stay. The restaurants are really good. Has outdoor movies and fireworks shows every Friday. Parking is expensive. Be prepared for a $250 SECURITY DEPOSIT.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The property is congested and a bit overwhelming. But beautiful. Great view of the ocean at night. Lovely room -- though a bit warm. They also offer a service to allow you to check out and then use a hospitality room to freshen up before the long trip home. That was a wonderful surprise.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We enjoy our stays in this time share. Like nearby supermarket where we can provide food for our breakfasts and a few lunches - as well as snacks and drinks for the evening. Appreciate the bi-weekly cleaning and free DVD's. Also many good restaurants nearby which we have been enjoying.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a lovely property but is very large with many guests. If you are looking for a relaxing quiet place this place isn't for you. There are lots of shops and restaurants so you don't even need to leave. It's in a good location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very pleasurable stay at this amazing resort. Multiple pools and the lagoon was great too. Wish we had more time there. Multiple restraunts to eat at on site as well as shopping, ABC stores (groceries, toiletries, beer, wine, etc.).

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have a 3 year old and this property was PERFECT for our week in hawaii. We had a 1 bedroom in the lagoon tower. She loved sleeping on the fold out couch, we loved having the privacy. Beds were comfy, having laundry on the floor was great. Was really nice to be able to wash out swimsuits and sandy clothes before heading home. So many easy food options on the property, the ice cream shop was a daily treat. Would have been nice if they had an actual market on site but that wasn't a big complaint. The pools and slides were so fun. I wouldn't really recommend this place if you aren't coming with kids. The convenience of having everything so clsoe by and lots of other families around made it a real vacation. But if we were on our won without the kiddo we probably would have wanted something a little more swanky.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The lagoon and beautiful Waikiki ocean from ocean front room will look very good!! When looking at the ocean from the lanai you can see the whales and dolphins. Furniture is also very beautiful and calm atmosphere. There is very wide TV in the living room.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Nice enough place but pressured from the time we checked in and every time we booked a tour or event to see the "90 " minute presentation. ..for a timeshare.We didn't want the free gifts etc (the luau tonight ) was very happy paying. ..but eventually buckled under the harassment to go. Turned out to be 3 hours of hard selling and showing us that we'd paid far too much for our accommodation. .. (thanks for that )When we politely turned down the $30,000 odd once in a lifetime offer...were treated pretty poorly and shown out by someone rude we'd not seen the whole 3 hours. Left us feeling quite deflated. ..even embarrassed for disappointing them.Won't be choosing a Hilton again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
