As we were on the 6th floor, we ended up just using the stairs to save time.All staff were friendly and helpful The grounds were well kept.We found prices for restaurants and shopping a "bit more reasonable" outside the village. Either way, expect to spend $$$$$$

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Older building and definitely due for some renovations, but if you're staying in Waikiki, the Lagoon Tower rooms are some of the most spacious rooms you can't get. It's great for families that like to keep dining costs lower by buying groceries and eating in the room. Proximity to the beach and pools are key. The valet is much improved over the last few years and getting in and out of the hotel is much easier than the snarling traffic through the main part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, where stretch limos block roads for no good reason other than they're too long.The elevators are slow and often so crowded that you may have to wait for another car or two during peak times. The building used to be residential years ago so it doesn't have a service elevator. Housekeeping and other staff use the same elevators, and oftentimes I wonder if their frustration with waiting for an elevator exceeds the guests. But...whatever...you're on vacation. Take a chill pill and roll with it. It is a little annoying that some guests are unaware of the etiquette of queuing for a lift. Some guests make a beeline for any open door even when there is an obvious line in the lobby. Those who do that seem to be older, so I suspect it's a cultural thing that they expect to go first based on seniority. Lagoon Tower is the best solution for my family when we travel to Honolulu. When staying here, it's like having one foot in and one out of Waikiki. You don't have to deal with much of the Waikiki traffic, but you're still central.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent location and facilities. Everything from beach to food to shopping is nearby. However, the early check out and late check in time is always a drag for international jet lagged travelers. Really need to beef up the housekeeping efficiency. Otherwise, after the first day, which is usually wasted, the rest is all so nice...
user_name:
Kin Sang C
california, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed staying here. Great view from room facing water. Option of pools, lagoon or ocean for swimming. Cleaning staff very helpful. Fireworks display on Friday is fantastic. Would highly recommend and definitely stay again when in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed having a full kitchen and washer/dryer. If it wasn't for those amenities probably wouldn't like it as much. Service and cleanliness ok. I would probably stay here again depending on rate and room type.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: we really stayed relaxed very much. For next stay, we will chose Hilton Hawaiian village. I will stay at Hilton Grand waikikian tower, if it will be possible.And I wanna try sea kayack next time.It will be much more happy stay for us.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I recently stayed in the Lagoon Tower on the 16th floor in a two bedroom/two bathroom suite. This was my second time staying in the Lagoon Tower and once again, it did not disappoint. I shared the room with five of my friends, and there was enough room to fit us all comfortably. Since I had been there a few years before, I requested the same room. One of the managers for Hilton Grand Vacations, Keiko Warner-Egami, who I was in contact with before the trip was so helpful in accommodating my requests. I couldn't be more grateful for the wonderful service she provided. I was visiting for my sister's wedding, so most of my family members stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and compared to the other rooms I saw at the Rainbow Tower and Diamond Head Tower, the Lagoon Tower is far better, in my opinion. Yes, it is pricey, but I think it is worth every penny. From my room we could see the Lagoon, Friday night fireworks, and amazing views of the ocean. The full size kitchen is one of the best parts as we were able to cook, bring food/snacks and store them in the pantry and the fridge. The conveniency of checking in at the Grand Waikikian and not dealing with the main lobby at the HHV is another plus. The only downside I can think of are the elevators. There are only three elevators, and since the hotel is crowded it can take a few minutes for one to be available. One of the days our elevator stopped on every floor on our way down. Other than that, I have no complaints. I can't wait to see the Lagoon Tower again when it is fully renovated. Thank you Hilton Grand Vacations for another amazing trip. I can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Bike stolen at Bike rack in Parking garage. They just asked to Filed to the police, but cannot give security cam video to get the clue. Security is low in the garage. Also Elvator motor made noise to room even in the midnight as it was close to the elecator motor room.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Recently stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation LAGOON TOWER.... 6 nights in June 2015. Awesome room. 15th floor with partial ocean view towards Waikiki beach and Diamond head. It was a birthday celebration for my wife and here is why they get 5 stars. I called way in advance about a week or two to start setting up small arrangements for when we arrived. 1. I requested the room be 'dressed up' with flowers and leis..... they did it. They decorated the bedroom with leis on the bed and spelled our HAPPY BDAY with 2 swans made of towels. 2. They decorated the dinning table with the same.. leis all over.. some broken apart and spelling HAPPY BDAY again. 3. They gifted my wife a 10% off spa certificate and some Short bread Hawaiian cookies. ALL ON THEM... I thought it was a great touch by them to decorate like that. Additionally, I ordered two cakes and I had them delivered to the hotel which they took to the room after it was ready. I asked if they could be delivered before we arrived to room.. Done.. perfectly. For that extra service... they get a 5. Going above and beyond their service. The room service is great. The rooms are clean. Great TVs. Lots of great choices for kids for morning cartoons. Sofa Bed came in great usage to save from getting a 2 bedroom. Kids thought it was very comfortable. They are 6 and 4 years old boys. Very spacious. All the staff is amazing. Having the hotel Hawaiian village is great. The lagoon for the Hilton folks is great. The paradise pool was great. Kids loved the slides. All the food and coffee I purchased tasted great. Sure.. pricier than normal... but we pay to have that service to a 3 min walk and not have to drive out all the time for all of it. I enjoyed Lappert's Ice cream and coffee shop being open so early. Me and my two boys would wake up and get coffee and milks and go for walks at 630am. Overall... we loved the stay. The self-serve parking is great. Easy IN and OUT. Not a far walk at all. Better than the Valet actually. We almost bought a timeshare at the new Islander. Almost. We will be back. Sooner than later. Thank you.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Overall a great experience. Close to the beach, lagoon, and pool. Close proximity to Tapas Bar, shopping, restaurants etc. We are timeshare owners since 2005 and love the Hilton Hawaiian Village's self-contained amenities. Last year we had a termite problem, sliding doors that would not close so A/C stays on, and a water main break that cost us two days of inactivity.This year no such problems but couch was missing cushions and things in our penthouse suite were somewhat shopworn. The new room service menu choices and provider was disappointing! Other on-site eating and dining choices are great alternatives such as Tabletop Pizza, CJ's Deli, Benihana, Tapas Bar, and close proximity but offsite Red Lobster.The good news is that they are doing a top-down 10 year renovation of the Lagoon Tower. The staff has always been friendly and accommodating to us over the last 9 years. Love it and would recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a fabulous hotel and I highly recommend it. We have been owners for about 14 years and continue to go. I has plenty of room for the entire family and the on site activities are top notch. Taking a guest family for a two bedroom or bigger helps to reduce the cost and leave more of your hard earned money for other activities.
user_name:
Robert Bryan R
Oklahoma City, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Accommodation ,staff friendliness and facilities are all top class. If you wish to visit Honolulu I would reoommend this resort as the place to stay. It is only a 15 minute walk to the main Waikiki and a similar distance to the huge Ala Moana shopping centre.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Family had a good time. Close to the beach, spa and pool were great. Close proximity to shopping, restaurants etc. Even though the hotel was busy we did not hear much noises from folks outside. Major complaint is just about the car parking rates which is major.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We've stayed at all of the Hilton Grand Vacation Towers in the Hilton Hawaiian Village. You can't go wrong with staying there! We've stayed there for years as a couple and this was the first time we travelled with our kids. We absolutely love everything the Hilton Hawaiian Village has to offer! Our kids loved the pools, the beach, the lagoon, the fireworks show on Friday nights, etc. We will definately be back again! They have the best pools in all of Honolulu!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are HGVC owners, and I was able to book club reservation at the 9 month mark for 2 bedroom Premier Ocean Front room in the Lagoon Tower, at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We have been to Oahu a few times over the years prior to owning with HGVC, and this was our first stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I know the Lagoon Tower is supposed to one of the hardest locations to book within HGVC, I jumped online at exactly 9 months out and got the room and view I wanted. However our plans changed and I was worried about losing the ocean front view, but luckily I was able to change the reservation and got the same room and view.We had room 1467, which is right on the end with an unobstructed view of the Lagoon and ocean. I know some others have complained about maintenance issues, and the dated décor with the Lagoon Tower. However we were pleased with the décor, while maybe not super modern, I would call it classic. The furniture was comfortable enough. The master bedroom was good sized, but the second bedroom was rather cramped with two twin beds. It was just two of us traveling, so the small second bedroom was not really an issue.Being in the middle of Honolulu, we ate most of our meals out. I did however cook breakfast every morning, and enjoyed that on the Lanai reading and watching the waves. The lanai was too sunny for afternoon drinks, at least for me. But it was a great spot for watching the Friday Night Fireworks. We had one maintenance issue, with a shower valve not working right. I called guest services in the morning, and it had been fixed by the time we got back mid-afternoon.The entire Hilton Hawaiian Village complex is centrally located, it’s an easy walk to thee entire Waikiki area and beaches, which is great as renting a car and parking would be hassle in this area. My only complaint about the resort, and Waikiki in general is the crowds. Pretty much everywhere you go there are people. It was often challenging to find a chaise at the pool. I can’t fault the resort for that, but now realize that personally we prefer the less crowded islands. I would consider staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village again if I return to Waikiki,

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What more can I say? It's the best there is, undisputed! Location, service, hospitality, ROI, second to none. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed !! Ask for Chrissy at the front desk. Can't say enough about all the amazing stay we had! Aloha!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: By the title I think you know where I am going with this review... We are elite owners with Hilton and always choose Hilton for a reason. We have paid dearly for our ownership and expect it to be the best of the best (which it usually is!) This is a VERY large complex and you are not something special like most of the other clubs make you feel. Sure, the rooms are fabulous, which we always love! I have a bad knee so getting around is a bit difficult with the very long walks to get to the beaches, shopping and just about anything you want to do. Please do not get me wrong, it is very nice here but it is not your typical elite feeling that Hilton always provides to us. We are but a fish in the large ocean. No upgrade at checkin, no owners lounge, you need to give a card at the pool to get a towel....just very different from what we are used to. Note: parking here is very expensive ! It is almost as much as renting a car for the day. Do your homework on this. I am glad we came but we will go to MUCH smaller resorts from now on!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Though I have stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Hotels for the past ten years at various towers, from Kalia to The Grand Waikikian and now the Lagoon. I have to said as owner with Hilton Grand Vacation the Lagoon Tower is the best location in the resort I have stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: An excellent place to stay especially as a GVC owner. It's central location and friendly staff gave us an enjoyable stay. The Grand Waikikian is just one hotel among about 5 hotels that make up the area called the Hawaian Village. The village is made up of lots of different shops and restaurants which are just off the beach in Waikiki. All the hotels are either Grand Vacation Club resorts or Hilton hotels. The room was nice, well furnished and had a great view of Honolulu, but our side didn't face the beach. I highly recommend the area and mildly recommend membership in the membership in the Vacaton Club depending on how you vacation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The staff at the HGVC were impeccable. From the bellhops and lobby greeters to front desk, we had great customer service. The rooms are in desperate need of renovation, although a display in the lobby says this is coming in Sept. 2015. Wifi was better than in most hotels. We were able to stream Netflix and connect our laptops to the TVs. We paid up for a 2BR premium unit which put us right on the lagoon overlooking the ocean and harbor. Unfortunately, we were on a lower floor (#6) and the noise from the pool and the public lagoon/beach was really loud. It was definitely worse on the weekend, including well into the night on Sunday. I would not choose to stay on this property again on a weekend. The pool was SUPER crowded, there were not enough chairs to accommodate guests. The main village pool wasn't any better. The weekdays were better, although the landscaping activity to groom the lagoon area each morning disturbed the peace of sitting on the lanai. Overall, until the Lagoon Tower upgrades its furnishings (my husband referred to the furniture as "goodwill" quality, as it was scratched, dented, had huge water stains, and the lamps were falling apart, etc.), I would choose a different property. We're HGVC owners, and we would not choose to stay at this location again. We had Room L666 in case management wants to do an inventory check on that unit.In hindsight, while the ocean view was beautiful, we spent so few daylight hours in our room, that we would have been fine away from the hub bub and noise of the beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Recently returned from one week in HGVC package in Kalia Tower. Hilton Hawaiian Village is massive, with many different buildings. The flavor is extremely international, as Honolulu - and particularly HGVC - seemingly serving as a gateway to the Far East (Japan and Korea). This was our second stay in the Kalia Tower, although well maintained, our 1BR Unit was a little smaller than expected, and only one bathroom was disappointing. You have to ask for things like luggage racks and enough pillows/hangers/towels/toiletries for a family of 4. Having free laundry machines on the floor worked well, although having it in the room as some units have would have been better. Kalia tower is far from the ocean and pool, although we had a nice ocean view. The small pool on the 4th floor is underwhelming. Valet was awesome during the day, but not in the evening, when they are understaffed. Valet was expensive $33, but a receptionist removed one day's fee when we had to wait 20+ minutes for our car one evening. We like to walk into Waikiki and the surrounding area - which is a big reason for staying in Waikiki. Kalia Tower was good for that, although the Village is at the outskirts of the Waikiki strip and you have to walk through/around a park which is somewhat inadvisable in the evening (per locals). Ocean is very calm and protected and it is easy to find a spot. No problem getting chairs at pools, but pools are nothing special. Didn't use lagoon (man made). Be forewarned that hotel restaurants are very very expensive. You are better off going off site. Hawaii is expensive, but the hotel pretty much adds 50% to 100%. Walk off property or - better yet - rent a car and enjoy Oahu's beaches, snorkeling and local food stops, especially the food trucks on the North Shore.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is an exceptional place to stay in Waikiki for a family. The location is close to most major shopping areas and it's right on the beach. It is very large and the pool areas seem rather small for a resort of this size but the man-made lagoon is unique and a great place for kids. We had a 2 bedroom suite that had a partial ocean view. Rooms of this size are rare in Waikiki so getting a large place to stay in a first class resort was a real treat. The staff were pretty amazing and very responsive. We had one problem with the concierge but this was a rare. I'm not a big fan of Honolulu (too developed) but the Hilton made this visit special and memorable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I can't say enough about this beautiful resort. As anti-time share as I've been my whole life, their Grand Vacation Ownership Package, I ticked me to buy into a 2 bedroom package. Our suite had 2 balconies overlooking both the ocean and city. We could not have asked for a better setting. Because I had previously stayed at the Hilton on the Big Island, we eventually upgraded to ownership on that island. But we will not miss out on spendings time here every time we return

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We tagged 3 nights here following a heavenly stay at Marriott Vacation Club in Ko Olina and as usual, found it very busy, unable to get any chairs around the pools etc... The 2br Villa we stayed in was ok but rather dated. Just that I always get the feeling that I'd like to head back to Ko Olina. A cab ride to central Waikiki costs around the same as a bus ride in for 4 people...around $12-$15

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I took my son to Honolulu on Memorial Day weekend 2015 and stayed at Lagoon Tower for 1 night (Friday) and at another hotel a second night (Saturday at Hyatt Regency Waikiki Resort & Spa...look for my review shortly). Lagoon tower has "cozy" studios and 1-2-3 bedroom suites and is part of the Hilton Grand Vacations club. I was able to get a last minute deal for a "studio" on the penthouse level (room L2462). We are HGVC club members and our home resort is in Las Vegas and have stayed at this resort several times. On this trip there was no availability using our HGVC points plus and there is a 3-night min. stay on membership points. So I booked this from the Hilton HHonors website and this room literally popped up on my screen as I was looking for hotels. The room was small, "cozy", but functional with awesome views from lanai...this room is probably the 3rd bedroom from the suite next door since there is was an access door in our room (I believe the penthouse floor bedroom suites are 2 levels...living and dining areas on 1st level and bedrooms on second level). The bed was comfortable and big enough to sleep my 21 yr old son and myself. It has a microwave and refrigerator. Upon check-in (Lagoon and Grand Waikikian have separate check-in desk...less crowded) we just changed and headed to beach and ate at the Blue Water Shrimp at the resort (this replaced the ramen noodles place). My son and I met back up in the room to watch the fireworks and just chill on the lanai and planned our next day to Hanauma Bay and North Shore. Look for my review with room pics on the Hyatt Regency Waikiki resort and spa ONLY here at TripAdvisor coming shortly. For people who have never stayed at this resort and have read other reviews, negative or positive, all I can say is Waikiki Beach is a world renowned tourist destination so expect that there will be a lot of people...old, young, kids, etc. This is not a trendy hotel, it's a resort that has everything and you really don't need to leave other than to explore more of Oahu or find more shopping. This stretch of Waikiki beach area is quiet and has plenty of beach space to just chill as compared to other parts of Waikiki beach.Overall it was again....A GREAT weekend at HHV!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: With 3 boys aged 21, 18 and 14, we had a lot of room and 2 bathrooms (a necessity!) in our two bedroom suite, with 2 balconies, full kitchen including dishwasher and ice maker, and comfy beds. Elevators were usually very fast (except during check out time), which is a nice change from most other places. Rather pricey for dining (especially with the 3 boys) but lots of selections and safe to roam about on their own. Concierge (Julie) was extremely helpful in planning our activities/events for the week. Front desk staff very promptly addressed a couple of small issues that we had and went above and beyond to provide us with complimentary use of another room after we had checked out to clean up in before our flight home (didn't leave for the airport until the evening). Value of 2 bedroom suite was good, considering we would have paid at least the same for 2 separate hotel rooms anywhere else to accommodate our family with 4 separate beds. Only negative was the time share presentation which was a little aggressive towards the end, but we did receive two free luau tickets worth approx. $220 US. Location was a little outside of the downtown Waikiki area, but close enough to walk if all are healthy and the beach area wasn't as crowded.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in a two bedroom in the lagoon tower. Was told this was "an older" hotel but the condition was excellent. The entire staff from check in to check out were superb. WE didn't pay for the Lei at the airport and were greeted with one at the hotel. Desk clerks almost competed to check us in. Bell hop was friendly and was helpful on where coffee was available and who had the best. Ate both on and off property with great service everywhere. The clerks in the stores were pleasant and talkative, just truly made you feel wanted without a big push for sales. I watched nearly everyone on staff seem to be genuinely happy to be at work. Even security officers directing traffic for hours had a smile and an Aloha each time you passed. Go here Stay here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Perfectly located in a gorgeous villageBeautiful rooms but it can be a little bit expensiveI still would highly recommend itIt is right on the beachParking is expensive but you can park across the street in the public parking lots for at least half of the priceBeautiful swimming pool Nice restaurants nearby towards Waikiki

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our 4th time staying in the Lagoon Tower over the last 12 years (2003, 2008, 2011). Overall we had a wonderful time. We were fortunate to request and get one of the corner 2 bedroom units. These have 2 lanais (balconies), one by the kitchen/dining table and the other in the living room. They give the room a much more open and outdoorsy feel. The only downside was that we were on the 4th floor and were subject to a lot of noise from the traffic between the tower and parking structure and from staff tearing down tables, chairs, and stages from the many special events held on the 'garden lawn'. The cacophony would continue sometimes to 2-3:00am. If you plan on doing any kind of real cooking in the room I suggest you go to Wal-Mart and purchase a knife or two and a fry pan. The knives in the room were a joke. I was trying to make stir-fry and could not dice an onion without using the serrated knives like a saw. I requested another knife from housekeeping and the one they brought was worse than the ones already in the room. The 2 small fry pans were only big enough to fry a couple of eggs or 3 slices of SPAM at a time. Can you imagine trying to fry bacon for 6 people in a 6 inch fry pan? The HHV staff has always been fantastic. They go out of their way to make every guest feel special. Kudos to the Bell staff. Many times we would stop to drop off passengers and/or groceries. They never rushed us. We made several trips to their station the night before our departure to weigh our suitcases. They have a 50lb scale in the back room. They were helpful and very courteous.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If I will go to Hawaii again, I will stay in this Hotel> There are restrurent,shop & all other facility available with in the village.There are an excellent waiting area if you go there early before check in.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We reserved a studio in the Lagoon Tower in the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It was very small, and looked very old - it needed an update badly. Unlike many other studios in the building, ours didn't have a balcony. Also, the walls are thin - we were next to a family with a very vocal young child. The only consolation is that it did sleep during regular sleep hours at night. The worst feature of the room is that it had a sofa bed, which was totally unnecessary, as the room was too small for it. The sofa blocked access to the only window that had a semi-decent view, and it blocked access to half of the (small) closet. Also, maid service is provided only twice a week. If you need anything in the meantime, you have to call "guest services" - their service was prompt and courteous, but it was still a nuisance for us.
user_name:
George S
Virginia Beach, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you think you're getting a Hilton Vacations Club quality room when you book the Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Waikiki, think again. This is a glorified hotel room with outdated furnishings. We were told that the hotel was going to undergo a complete transformation in the Summer of 2015; unfortunately, we booked too early. Not the quality I expected from the Hilton Hotel group.
user_name:
Robert Henry R
Laguna Beach, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great facilities located right on the beach, and you are within walking distance of "the Strip" in Waikiki. The lagoon is a little private beach, just the right depth for kids to play in safely. Multiple pools to chose from and happy hours a different times at each of the bars. Comfy beds and nice showers. A wonderful place for a family vacation!
user_name:
Andrea Janette T
San Rafael, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If your planning to enjoy the beach, eat and shop in the same time...this is the place to stay at!! Service is excellent. Very friendly and helpful! I stayed at the Kalia tower and I really liked the condominium.. Clean and big! Lots of ABC stores( convenient stores) which has everything you need! Hands down best resort in Honolulu!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We enjoyed our stay tho we didn't do much but sleep here. The super pool was crazy cold! The multitude of shops was great and, surprisingly, not ridiculously overpriced. If we came back, we'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you're trying to find an hotel in Honolulu, the Hilton Grand Vacations is THE place to stay. Everything is near and you wont regreat it. Nice beach, Pools, a Lagon for the youngs one. Restaurant, Boutiques, ABC, even the airport or the cruise line are near ! I will return for sure !

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The resort is beautiful and the staff are wonderful! We have three girls (ages 13, 11 and 3) and had the best vacation we've ever had! The amenities and recreation activities were perfect for all of us and we had a blast at the lagoon!
user_name:
Benito Juan B
Mililani, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: if you want the beach, shops, restaurants and entertainment and scenery at your fingertips in Waikiki, then staying at the Hilton grand vacation towers is ideal. the ambience is plush and peaceful. public transportation is good, fast and cheap so a car is not necessary. (car rentals are available for day use). walking a mile or two can cover the Waikiki "strip" easily or by bus. we snorkeled outside the breakwater jetties and saw enough local fish and even a sea turtle without trekking to haunama bay!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have stayed at all the HGVC towers on the property, and this trip was just the wife and I and it was great. However with kids, lagoon tower is the way to go. The Kalia tower "mountian View" is a view of a parking structure, park, and then the mountain. Definitely spend the extra and get the ocean view
user_name:
Daniel Clifford M
Sherwood, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent all inclusive resort. The pasta was great. Try Lanikai smoothies and oatmeal. The views were awesome seeing the ocean and Diamond Head from the balcony was so therapeutic. Enjoy the eight dollar ice cream cones and there is plenty of great music on the resort.
user_name:
James Phillip M
Patterson, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The constant beeping from the trucks reversing into the hotel over the road woke us up at 6amb every morning. The pool was closed for two and a half days of our four day stay which was disappointing. The hot tubs had many under ages young children in them even though children under 5 were not permitted in them. Generally, children were not supervised by parents enough and were problematic to others. Security could have been more active in reigning them in. To my knowledge there is no adults only place at this Hilton Resort which is a shame as not everyone wants to have to tolerate badly behaved children on their holidays.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Being at the end of the strip the Hilton Hawaiian Village is it's own oasis in Waikiki. However, there's plenty to do. The Hawaiian music at the Tapa Bar - especially "Olomana" on Friday and Saturday nights - is a highlight. The beach is less crowded in April than winter and the restaurant lines a lot shorter. It's a 10+ walk to more action on Waikiki or to Ala Moana Mall in the other direction. The service is professional and the rooms are very comfortable - especially the amazing view of the Rainbow tower.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I will never return to this resort hotel. The room condo timeshare unit was very poorly appointed, not in the best condition and was EXTREMELY noisy. Being put right next to where they held a NIGHTLY luau made for a very poor experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Loved the whole experience in Hawaii in the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We toured the island, did personal submarine fish and turtle watching. Pearl Harbor was very touching. Even if you can't surf there is lots to do. The shopping and restaurants are great also. The Hilton village has so much to do, from couples to families. Loved the Friday night fireworks!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We could have spent the entire 7 days just on the Hilton Hawaiian Village Property. Everything we needed was there. We missed the Penguins and the Ibis. (Our previous visit was 15 years ago.) Thanks so much for the mother duck and 13 babies. They were a joy to watch. We wanted to look around at the Crystal Chapel. The person at the Crystal Wedding Chapel did not want us to look around, just wanted us out of there. She did not ask us if we had a relative who might want to get married at the Chapel. She was polite but missed an opportunity to sell us on the Chapel. She was not a sales person and should not have been employed as such. The Phirana Brothers music at the Tropics Bar was great. We enjoyed all of the bars. I would recommend a bar/ observation deck at the top of one of the towers for the view and overflow from the other bars. Our experience was first rate. Thank you.
user_name:
Jean D
San Rafael, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There were several events directly in front of the hotel tower, lagoon tower, and the noise level was not acceptable. The room was average and outdated. If you are looking for a "party environment", this might be a good spot for you.
user_name:
Norbert Heinz G
Honolulu, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Was pleasantly surprised. As always, accommodations are what you would expect from Hilton. The nice surprise was the "village". Everything you need is contained within the property. The lagoon was an incredible place to "float" your cares away.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our room had a nice layout, great with little kids. Other than that the experience was horrible. Room location above the pool proved to be terribly loud ALL DAY LONG! We tried to move rooms but would have had to wait 2 days then would have had music/party noise till past 10am. The elevator service was the worst I have ever experienced. At least a 20 minute wait/ride to get to where you were going in a packed like sardine situation. No flexibility on late check out despite our gold member status. Then a marathon in from of the hotel left our family trapped and unable to get to an excursion. Overall it was one thing after another at this property and a negative experience.
user_name:
Eric K
Huntington Beach, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Nice trip to Hawaii - great weather. The Hilton complex was a nice place to stay and offered lots of amenities, dining and tours. It was a short walk down into Waikiki and so you had easy access to restaurants, shopping, etc. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Spent 4 days at newly renovated kalia towers, one bedroom suite: nicely appointed, wood floors, comfortable bed, large suite. Ocean view (15th floor) will show the Hilton lagoon and ocean, as long as you don't look down to see the roof top of the convention center. There is a buzz as the Waikiki city noise is near but the suites are very quiet. A few minutes walk through the Hilton Village to get to the beach front. Credit goes to the staff and management of Hilton for running such a clean and efficient and safe property. Concierge was super helpful; had us booked for excursions, given city bus schedules, maps and instructions.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was my 1st time at the Lagoon Towers in the Hilton Grand Vacation Club. It is separated from the main HHV lobby and connected to the Grand Waikikian with the check-in, luggage check and bellmen on the 2nd floor about 1/8th of a mile from the main lobby. If you take a cab or van shuttle make sure that they know the difference or you'll have a long walk with your luggage. Securing a 1 Bedroom Plus for 9 nights required booking 9 months in advance (as soon as you can if you don't own there), due to the popularity. As an owner of a week of Hilton's time-share, the best utilization of your points is to book the weekdays in the beginning and ends of your stay and the weekend in the middle, due to the amount of points required per day. The 1 bed+ is a suite with a full kitchen and, my understanding is, the earlier you book the higher you are placed on floors. I was located on the 23rd floor with only the penthouse suites one floor above me. I was on the Diamond Head side of the Lagoon Towers - good if you and/or your kids want to see the fireworks on Fridays from your balcony and have the sun from morning until mid-afternoon. Of course, there are so many other locations on the property to see the fireworks from that you may not see your room from morning until night. There are free washers and dryers on the floors and detergent in the units under the sink with the sponges, dishwasher and dishwashing liquids, etc. There are flat-screen TVs in each room and the living room has a PlayStation with 2 controllers and you get a free DVD rental card good for your entire stay. If you're on the Diamond Head side you'll hear music at night from either functions on the Great Lawn between buildings or from the band at the Tapas Room until 9:00 or 10:00 - can't be sure, I was out late most nights. In September 2015, the Lagoon Tower rooms will be undergoing major renovations as they have just modified the desks in the Lagoon lobby and are in the process of doing each of the 3 elevators, 2 were done when I left and the 3rd was almost complete.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Could have a wonderful and comfortable stay at your facilities. Also, really enjoyed its excellent location for walking, shopping, transportaion in Honolulu. Quiet and clean room allowed us to sleep like a log every night. We could take part in one of Ho'Okipa Owner Activity - Morning Stretch Yoga - at Ho'Okipa Kid's room. It must be very enjoyable and convenient to us. We would like to take the other activities during next stay. Real paradise indeed!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The ocean front two room suite had a great view. The room itself had a nice floor plan, the issues we experienced were poor air conditioning which only worked when we did not need it to work, clogged sink & toilet upon arrival, stained furniture, and water pressure varied from almost none to very little as well as hot water took minutes to happen. The beds were hard and sagging, they need replaced, I slept horrible compared to most hotel rooms. The views and the balconies made up for the shortfalls, but did not ultimately fix issues that need addressed.
user_name:
William P
Prescott Valley, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The tower was great. It is the farthest from the beach, but if you get to have a one bedroom suite with kitchen - then yes! It was very well maintained. Great kitchen amenities, we didn't hear our neighbors at all (which is always a concern that they will hear my kids) and only a little above from upstairs. The furnishings were nice and a great front desk and bell service. Parking is steep, so if you can avoid the rental car definitely and then the self-parking was a long walk as well. Only a very good on location only as it is relative to the other towers, but otherwise excellent as so close to the beach truly.
user_name:
Aanya Mee Ae L
Seattle, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We recently spent a week at Hilton Hawaiian Village and had a great time. Amenities at the resort are all inclusive, and the concierge was fantastic helping us find fun family activities. It also helped that the weather was perfect!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Two lifts only at the lagoon tower. All I could do was book 3 day alotments for a 10 day visit. Instead of the $55 booking fee it was $210. Given what I originally paid at this resort a number of years ago you would think someone would want to see me about it or try and look after me. I pay $1400 a year and the room wasn't cleaned at any time. I wanted to sell last year as a result of a divorce. Cost me $34000 and the most the offered was $13000 less 25% commission. Nothing like the sales pitch I was given.The lagoon tower is dated. The staff are nice.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Many things were wrong but the backed up sewer, in the laundry room, was the worst. CRAP all over the floor and it smelled like a sewage waste treatment center. Fitness center had no chemicals, or cloths, to wipe down machines between users.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent service, room and opportunities to dine, relax one of the best beaches in Oahu. The Hilton makes you feel as though you belong to their family. Anyone looking for a fabulous time needs to check in at the Hilton Vacations club on Waikiki.
user_name:
John Wesley B
Chicago, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Good, but a cut below what you would normally expect from Hilton. I was told that this tower would be completely remodeled in the next couple of years, so this will likely change. Location is great and you're walking distance from everything.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Staff was very unhelpful and service was inadequate. Hotel amenities were nice (pool/lagoon, etc.) but my family had several issues that were not resolved by staff that seemed to not care. Construction to certain parts of the resort seemed ill-timed based on it being spring break - for example, one of only three elevators for a 24 floor tower was out of service so it could get an interior face-lift (no mechanical issues).

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The views were pretty great from my room in lagoon tower although was hoping for more of an ocean front view with how much we spent wish they would have been a little more clear about the view although not bad. The beds were absolutely wonderful. Very luxurious and comfortable. Down Feather comforters and pillows and very comfortable pillow top matresses. If u have kids the two bedroom suite is nice and spacious. Large master bed. The furniture is a little worn although nice and carpet looks a bit dated(in lagoon tower). Although kitchen and bathroom have been updated and have nice granite counter tops. Nice beaches nearby. If you are interested in paddle boarding or going on the water bike peddles I recommend going down the each a little ways and renting them there as they are way cheaper than they are by the lagoon. Plus more fun to go in the ocean. A paddle board is $15 or 20 bucks on the beach and the lagoon paddle boards on the lagoon is $40 and you cannot take them out in the ocean, only the lagoon. Over all nice stay. Fun water slides for kids and other pools more for adults.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the Kalia towers in a one bedroom ocean view suite! The suite seemed to be newly renovated. Very big and spacious. Had a great time! Staff is accomodating and gracious! Ray from valet was great! He would hook you up with toys from guest who left their toys for others to enjoy!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Love the beach. Great location, close to everything. We were pleased with quality of beds and bedding. Very comfortable. Slightly slow internet for our taste. Overall our experience was good and we would recommend it to a friend.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Having stayed here 4 times previously I thought I would book it again. We thought it would be a treat to stay in the Alii Tower which is a concierge Tower. Boy were we wrong. A/C never worked properly. Very old and worn out room. Noise from below with trucks making deliveries begins at 4 AM . I booked ocean front which was a great view. But with so many things wrong with that place it took the beauty away. The elevators cant handle the masses of people and had to wait many times before being crammed into one. The free appetizers were terrible as people were hoarding them back to their rooms. Very overcrowded with no room to lay at the pools. Noisy can't describe it. ..we had to leave and go to the North Shore. What was once a shining star is now a fallen one. Lagoon Towers are very old and worn also. Elevators and pools just cannot handle these crowds. Sorry Hilton....Never again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: they could not find my reservation, double booked my room, had to move at 10;30 pm to a smaller room. their mistake but because of policy could not help me. No one there would listen tomproblem. Their only interest was to sell me a time share.
user_name:
Carlos P
san jose, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We felt that we were in our own house and I really wanted to stay longer. I was with my kid so it was good. Also you can stay in the hotel all day cause theres everything you need. We liked it so much so hope you guys like it too.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful place! We had a wonderful vacation here. Highly recommended! Make sure to ask for the ocean view. It does not disappoint! We ate breakfast every morning watching the surfers and boats from our balcony.
user_name:
Eric H
Crystal Lake, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The check in process was simple, staff wonderful, room clean and great beds. Balcony a big plus. Great stay! The concierge in the lobby are fabulous. Remember to look in the paperwork you get upon arrival. There are special offers inside your room key package.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Rooms are comfortable and spacious. Great view, lots of very helpful staff. Kids loved the pool and lagoon. Beach chairs availble for a fee, pleanty of chairs by the pools. Lots of options for meals and snacks, and lots to do outside of the hotel. Shopping in the village was great.
user_name:
Wendy S. C
Milford, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just got back from an epic week in Hawaii. We stayed in 5 different rooms in 4 Hilton properties. First night, used points to stay in Rainbow tower. 4 nights after that in Lagoon Tower. Then two different rooms in Grand waikikian and lastly in Hokulani down the streetWatching the Friday night fireworks from the 22d floor of the Lagoon tower was a real highlight and the kids loved it. Being able to swim in the lagoon or pool was also awesome. Having the kitchen meant we could eat two meals a day and then eat once a day at places like Maui Tacos or Teddy's bigger burgers in Kailua--both great!!The beds were very nice but best at the Hokulani. Also the 16th floor pool there was very posh. You can take a cabana for free if u get there early. I hope we go back again soon!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I'm typing this review during my stay at the Lagoon Tower on the 7th floor (suite L770) awaken every morning at about 6am from the traffic noise. I'm here with my family for 10 days for March break escaping the cold Canadian weather.The suite is great ... spacious, clean, free laundry (down the hall), amazing Paradise pool, concierge service, etc. This complaints I have are the windows and walls are thin. I hear the traffic every morning at about 6am when folks started heading to work. I could hear conversations from folks walking below. The windows are basic non insulated single pane glass. I hear my neighbors in the evening when dining. They weren't speaking loudly but I could hear their conversation when seated at the dining table. My concern is not listening to them but more-so them listening to my twin 4 year old girls playing and fighting. We tried our best to get the girls to pipe down so that our neighbors can enjoy their vacation .... my apologies to them!!My recommendation is to find a suite as high up on the tower as possible. I can't recommend or suggest anything on the thin walls .. but avoid staying beside suites with young kids like mine ... :-)The biggest complaint I have, which irks me dearly, are the sharing of elevators with cleaning and maintenance staff. There are only 3 elevators and we found ourselves having to wait because they were occupied by cleaning and maintenance carts. The elevators floors are damaged from their use .... and I am reminded of it every time I use it. They should be using the freight elevator !!! For a $400 plus a night hotel, the condition of the elevator are a disgrace !!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great time with many amenities close by. Concierge recommended awesome snorkeling trip to Hanuama Bay. Extremely convenient shopping located in the village and fun luau. Many activities on site with helpful staff

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The 2floor condominium which is so rare in Waikiki. Fireworks and beach spread out in front. Could see the whale in the distance, too. Nagaoka-fireworks are in front when the time of the Honolulu festival and That is really impressive. Nice, seriously. Facilities are old-fashioned, but that is the value.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: HGVC time share is very exciting to stay with its nice accomodation and facilities. Many various pools are fun. Waikoloa golf cources are beautiful and challenging. Lagoon Tower is good with its roomy unit. Hope to have more facilities in various places in the world.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Lagoon Tower on an RCI exchange. We had a great 1 bedroom condo with a view of Diamond head, the ocean & their private lagoon. Check-in was very easy & friendly, with welcoming leis. We didn't get bothered with time share presentations because we don't belong to Hilton. At 1st, this complex can be overwhelming because it is so huge! But, it was nice having so many restaurants and pools to choose from. We also enjoyed walking into town to the many shops & restaurants by the Beachwalk. There are lots of water activities available near the lagoon. The Friday night fireworks are a nice treat & we were able to have a great view of it from our balcony! Buses and tours are easily available. We would definitely come back here!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We used our HGVC bonus points to book the Lagoon Tower, in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment. After many talks with various HGVC agents, we booked what we thought would be an oceanfront view. On arrival we were given a suite facing another building, with an oblique view of the boat basin and in the distance, the ocean. We had specified oceanfront, and found, to our dismay, that the agents booking these suites know absolutely NOTHING about them or their locations. You must call the hotel directly and ask where the suites are located or you may be disappointed as we were. We did find a front desk clerk who helped to move us to the Diamond Head side of the building which is where we SHOULD have been in the first place. However, we lost 4 days of our week before that happened. Guests staying at the Lagoon Tower should know that no matter where you stay in this building, it will be NOISY. Many of the small tour buses pickup in the early hours and when they back up they beep-beep-beep constantly. Even on the 18th floor this will wake you up. The furniture in this unit was satisfactory, but one bed had a huge hole in a bottom sheet but the bed was made anyway. Furniture in the suite was a bit tired and used-looking. The kitchen was well-equipped. We would not stay here again, but would go further up the beach towards Diamond Head where the views are better and the noise level tolerable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Because traveled one person, instead of the studio, accommodation, was comfortable. It is within walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center to Waikiki Very convenient, built-in coffee gone wrong in the hotel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very nice rooms. Spacious and clean. Staff was very helpful. No hard core sales pitch for time share purchase. A wonderful family resort, with lots for kids to do. Fireworks on Friday night was a real treat. All the grounds were well maintained. Nicely located on the beach and near the marina. A wonderful vacation location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are finishing up a week split between two of the towers that are part of the HGVC properties at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. As much as the Grand Waikikian was a pleasant surprise, the Lagoon Tower has been a big disappointment.No other way to describe this property other than old and tired. The carpet is worn, the vents have grime in them the furniture is worn etc. No elegant bath here. You get the feel from the moment you walk into the lobby that this building has seen it's better days. Even the elevators are old and beaten up.When we checked in we asked for a higher floor and were told that the "class" of suite we were going to get only existed on floors two through five. My first reaction was to think why would one bedroom suites only exist on four of the many floors of this building. I have now come to believe that the "class" (or lack thereof) was meant to define the quality of the suite .. as in second class.Someone mentioned that some of the suites have been renovated. If so, I feel very slighted in that it I have started to feel that the Hilton Grand Vacation Management chooses to treat it's prospective members much better than their existing ones. We have now stayed in six of the HGVC properties and the Lagoon Tower has been the worst by far. If you want beauty, comfort and relaxation, stay at the Grand Waikikian or on the big island (Hawaii) HGVC properties (Kahola Suites and Kings Land). Those fit the standard that HGVC advertises and what we have come to expect.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower section of the hotel and often had to wait 15 minutes for an elevator. Could never find a chair at the pool because they were so overcrowded. Used the spa services and massage for two cost us nearly $500. Totally not worth it. Wouldn't use that property again. Also ocean view is more like harbour view of all the boats. You would have thought hgv would have thought about a more desirable location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband & I stayed here in Oct. 2008; we returned in Feb. 2015 with a college friend who had never been to Hawaii. We all were impressed with the service and the accommodations. The concierge was very helpful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Have stayed at this facility several times in the past and have found it to be quite satisfactory. I anticipate staying there in the future as well. The Oahu location is excellent as well. I have also taken advantage of its amenities.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stays in a grand vocation part of the building 12-18 floors. Room is spacious and view is great. Only one complaint was the concierge service is not great. Won't not help out upon arrival despite seeing us with lots of luggage. Otherwise I enjoy it. However, if you needs to be near the main beach and bigger swimming pool, you would need to choose other hotel towers.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our second stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We stayed in the Kalia Tower which is furthest from the beach but very quiet and fresh. With a room facing the beach we had a wonderful view of the ocean and the Village. The room was in excellent condition with updated furniture, a small kitchen area, and a lanai (balcony). The staff was very helpful and courteous. Waikiki is a high priced area but even so the food prices in all restaurants and grocery store in the Village are very high. We recommend taking a walk across the street to find reasonable alternatives. We found the pool water too cold, very few people were using the pools.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The room/condo was beautifully appointed and had a great ocean view. It was very clean and modern. Kitchen had granite counter tops and stainless steel appliances. There was a free morning paper for guests. The only problem was the nightly noise from the luau. Got to be quite annoying after the first few days.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Clean, beautiful and well located in the Hilton Hawaiian Village located at the western end of Waikiki. The bed was comfortable, the fitness room was well equipped and the beach was perfect and practically part of the property. The Village itself is active and a bit crowded, but there are places to go to get away from the crowds. The Kalia tower pool is the least crowded in the village, so sunning and swimming there is a great option.
user_name:
Thomas Hall D
Parsippany, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Place was ok, but we had to ask for leis, and when we complained about view from the room,they claimed there were no other rooms available. No laundry in room. Stingy with laundry detergent. Everything crazy expensive. Hawaii is really beautiful, otherwisew.
user_name:
Kevin H
Mahwah, New Jersey, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Good suites but large and anonymous resort. As a regular at Hilton hotels (diamond member) I have experienced far superior hospitality and more personal service at other Hilton locations. The location is good and the restaurants are quite satisfactory.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: it's a beautiful resort and awesome things to do around the area which makes it convenient for you if drinking. the food was amazing the pool area was beautiful which we didn't get to enjoy but just by looking it looked amazing very clean and comfy made me feel like home
user_name:
Liza K
pearl city, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are members of Kalia Towe at Hilton Grand Vacation Club. When we arrived the floor in our bedroom was wet by air conditioner. The next morning when it was still very wet I was told they were coming to fix it. Eight hours later no one has come to do so. I called about the DVD player eight hours later and they said the same person they send to fix the air will fix that. When?!? The volume of the phone is broken and the operator did not speak good English so we didn't have a very long conversation. I am shocked that at the end of the day after calling at 10am no one seems to care about these issues. I am disappointed but still like the setting. I just want them to maintain the property when I call.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a nice facility when combined with the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but the room was too small for the price and location. On the flip side the staff and service provided by the staff were excellent.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enormous and anonymous. Far too full of its own importance to offer any personal service.Queued on arrival for 45 minutes at check in, to be told we were in the wrong queue. Made our way to the right queue, to be told we'd need to wait until 4pm for our room. We arrived at midday from the UK! My wife is right - the larger the hotel, the easier it is for them to forget about you. I need to learn this lesson !! In the meantime, we sat and waited, whilst watching others checking in with no problems. Oh yes, check out by 10am, that's the rules. $272 per night. After 3pm we were given our room - a small, dated, grubby standard hotel room. We checked out immediately. I would give zero out of five if it was available. The manager said we wouldn't be charged, but offered no apology or explanation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village was an extremely pleasant and wonderful experience. The staff were professional, friendly and helpful. I would definitely return to this location. They have all the options of activities you would enjoy.
user_name:
Lori Tom C
Hercules, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent amenities and luxurious one bedroom suite. The hotel staff was very accomodating and congenial. The facilities of the resort were the best in Waikiki. The location is walking distance to shopping (Ala Moana shopping center); dining (Waikiki area) and beach.
user_name:
Michael David F
New York City, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location is good and the floors are clean. However my two bedroom unit is no better than other hotels and I can get those by paying less. I am in the room right now as I type this review. The chair and sofa are dirty and old. There are mystery stains on it and blacken edges on the chair. Concierge says they are fully booked and does not have a higher room available even if I pay extra. He can ask the housekeeping manager to come take a look. One thing is for sure. If this was the room they showed me during the timeshare presentation, I would not have joined as an owner. I expected better than dirty furniture. What a disappointment. Will see what happens if when the manager shows up. It's been two hours since I called to voice my concerns. I gave to spend another three nights here and I'm not touching those stains. The least they can offer is to steam clean them. The point is they should have addressed it before an owner had to place a call.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton Hawaiian Villiage is a great family vacation destination. It is particularly welcoming to families with youg children as it has many pools and a shallow lagoon that are kid freindly. At the same time, it isn't overwhelmimgly kid freindly such that couples without kids feel overwhelmed.
user_name:
Clifford S. C
Cincinnati, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: we stayed in a one bedroom suite(timeshare) was not happy about the room in bathroom it needs more room my son is spinal cord injured and the shower was bad the door to bedroom from bathroom only opened half way very hard to move around in just not a good room for someone with a handicap like my sons

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our first trip to Hawaii and we had an amazing time! We are Hilton Grand owners and the level of service we received at the Kalia Tower was second to none. Our suite was cozy and truly felt like our home away from home. We spent our days filled with activities that encompassed the whole island; and when we came "home" it was time to relax and take it all in.If you want to stay close to the village, there is plenty of shops and restaurants near by to keep you occupied for a full 7 days. However, if you decide to venture away from the village talk to Julie or Lewis from the concierge desk; they know they're stuff!As far as Hawaii being expensive... yeah, its Hawaii. We saved some money by eating breakfast in our suite and buying some snacks at Safeway. If you are looking for a tranquil place to do absolutely nothing, this may not be the place for you. There is a lively, non-chaotic vibe that exists in the village... again, if you're looking for silence to to Maui.We loved it and can't wait to go back! Thanks Hilton staff for making our vacation a memorable one!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Noise from the Tapa Bar in the center of the hotels is intolerable at night. The hotel is beautifully located on the widest part of the beach. It is a shame that the noise from one bar in the center of the complex is allowed to impact so strongly all rooms facing it.
user_name:
John Dudley L
Sam Mateo, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Wonderful accommodation with amazing views and lots of amenities. Lots of shopping and restaurants on site. Use the trolley to get around to Waikiki and Ala Moana Center. Downside was the extra costs and expected tipping for everything.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: clean, fast elevators, good for people who prefer to cook . swim pool is small could be full. a bit far from the ocean and ground pool. a bit far from main beach street too. ocean balcony will make it real lovely for such a price
user_name:
Billiana Christ... R
las Vegas, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful view. Could watch the Friday night entertainment & fireworks from our room. Room was very nice with a great bed. Total resort is very large with a number of Hilton Hotels on one property. Beach was close by.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There is nothing Grand about this place. Our 2 bedroom unit has a good view and NOTHING ELSE. The furniture and carpets are filthy and worn. Appliances are old. Housekeeping is done once weekly. The pool is full of screaming, snotty nosed brats and their horrible parents who think it's fine to have their babies paddle around in dirty diapers. We were told room service is available, then no, then maybe, and finally that room service consists of someone running your order up to the room from the terrible deli near the main pool. Worst of all, Management thinks it's just fine to hold very, very loud functions directly outside your windows until 10 pm. ( and the noise after that when everything is taken down and carted away) without any mention that you might be inconvenienced by the ear splitting bad, bad bar band. They do not care about you, the paying guest. Some staff are really rude, ie the doorman didn't thank me for the 3 bucks I gave him just to open the taxi door for me. He just slammed the door and walked away. Wish we could have done same. I wouldn't dream of buying a timeshare at this dump.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed a week at the Hilton Grand Vacations in November 2014. I had priced several different hotels along with comparing the different rates/ room choices at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We have 3 young kids- 1 needing a daily nap. We were so close to the beach, restaurants and shopping it was easy to bring the kids back for naps or shower off the sand! The location and amenities made the HGV worth every penny. We had a 2 bedroom suite and the luxury of not being on top of one other in the hotel was awesome. The master bedroom had a King bed and own bathroom with large closet. The second bedroom had 2 full size beds for the kids. We loved being able to sit on the lanai and watch the fireworks. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Note: The HGV building has its own check in so there is no waiting on some of the crowds at the regular check in. Elevators were fast and although I thought we were to have a laundry in our room, it was right down the hall and free. Note: they provide laundry detergent as well, so no need to pack or buy it (like I did.) My kids loved the lagoon and the rentals. The pool, however, was too cold and crowded for any of us- so stick with the white beaches of Waikiki, just a stroll from the back door of the hotel. The hotel was completely family friendly as we loved the Saturday movie night on the Great Lawn. My more conservative husband even admitted the convenience was worth the money. Tip: the parking garage is close to this building so pass on the valet- it takes longer to wait and except the stairs, it doesn't take any longer to walk to the valet station vs. the garage.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Resort Lagoon Tower. We had an ocean view and beach front access. Absolutely wonderful! The suite had a full size kitchen, living room, two ocean view balconies. Everything was in working order. We didn't hear any noise from our neighbors. Most nights, you do hear the music playing down at the lawn, but it stopped after 9pm. The location is great, only 10 minutes walk from the Ala Moana mall, 5 min from bus stop, many shops, restaurants and the beach a short walk away. The staff were courteous and helpful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This resort is very family friendly and has a convenient location to the ocean and all water sport rental companies. Convenient location to family friendly restaurants and shopping. We would recommend this hotel for family, couple or single travelers.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: just to busy of a place for us. we like vacations were its more secluded. other than the 27 for parking per night, no complaints be ready to pay honolulu prices. great location with a private lagoon and small shopping mall connected to the hotel. the place is kept up well and all the workers were very friendly. great beaches but thats about it
user_name:
Kevin Michio O
chino, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Suites with some friends and had a wonderful time.. The place was very clean and the rooms (2 bedroom) had plenty of room.. The staff was friendly and the service was on par for what you would expect. Plenty to do in the area even though it is a little crowed.. Lot's of restaurant options in the area within easy walking distance so you will never have a shortage of food.. Nice beach but again a little crowded so get out there early.. The sunsets were gorgeous. We do prefer some of the other Islands but if you are picking this area the Hilton is a very nice place..

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The resort itself is great. I will neveer return. I was here christmas - new years. Everything was supper over crowded. It felt like i never left LA.The beach is great but the reef is practically dead from all the resorts and boats. Restaurants and food are sub par. If you are looking for a relax vacation go to Maui.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had stayed at this same resort 5 years ago, and what a disappointment between then and now. The arm rests on the living room chair had enough dirt grime on them to make it look like they came from a mechanics office. We always stay at Hilton Resorts or time-shares when we travel. This was a complete disappointment especially since it was our 30th anniversary.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Had a great time with my family here. Loved the suites design. Good location and beautiful ocean view. There were a lot to do in the Hilton Village. Do not miss the Honolulu Cookies! I will come back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed for a week in a king suite in the Kahlia Tower. They only clean the room and replace towels once a week so we had to call several times for more towels and coffee. They were brought promptly but wouldn't take the dirty towels or the garbage. So we left them outside in the hall where they sat until the next day. The mattress was lumpy and there were no sheets or blanket for the fold out couch which we also had to call for. I actually flipped the mattress myself which helped some but they should be doing that once a month themselves. Every time we stopped at the concierge to ask a question they tried to sell us something or get us to the timeshare presentation. The grounds were clean but very busy with people and traffic. The kids pool with waterslides is small and the ocean beach not very large or nice. Our rooftop pool was convenient and cozy but very cold water. When they did their luau every night (which is not highly rated) the noise echoed all around our building and was annoying. The power went off one day and the air conditioner controls lost their programming so it got hot in the rooms for a day until they came to re-set them. They would not work manually. Overall, it's a good location if you want to be in the thick of things and close to the ocean but everything is extremely expensive on-site. We did not find any good restaurants close by so had to walk several miles for food and shopping or take an expensive taxi.
user_name:
John P
Pueblo West, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Although the Hilton Hawaiian Village is the largest resort in all Hawaii, it does not feel crowded. The staff at the Hilton facilities is extremely accommodating and kind. We are physically challenged and everyone made us feel like we were their first and foremost focus. They shuttled us around the property in a large golf cart type vehicle, even to the beach. We were politely assisted every step of the way. The Lagoon Tower is spectacular for views and comfort. The room delivery menu was fresh and speedy. The restaurant options are excellent.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Location of the huge Hilton "village" is great - right on the Waikiki beach, with weekly Friday night fireworks. It's short 15min walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre and ~15min to the main Waikiki shopping/restaurant strip. Taxi from the airport was 45 USD at 0730, peak hour traffic. Speedishuttle would have been $29 + tip but probably slower.For early arrivals/check out they have a lounge and lockers to have a shower and leave small bags.We had a one bedroom apartment in the Lagoon tower and whilst quite spacious was pretty dark, old and drab. There are newer towers which are probably more updated. We stayed on a point exchange, otherwise definitely would not have paid money to stay in this room.Because it's such a large complex, service is pretty poor. We called concierge and got an answering machine. The return message left on the answering machine was 3hrs later. I've also never seen a group of bell staff look so disinterested when approached.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our first stop on the start of a 5 week holiday. after getting off a long flight from Australia, we where greeted by a very unwelcoming/unfriendly lady at the reception. And the kids where upset that they didn't get given a leith This however was the only unfriendly so staff member we encountered everyone else was very friendly and helpful. Arriving in the morning it was nice to Able to use the guest lounge to wait for our room as jet lag set in, and even better when they advised they had our room available early and we where able to go an settle in prior to usual Checkin time. We where very appreciative.We stayed in. 2 bedroom suite. As we where travelling with our 2 children. The suite was very spacious, clean and well equipped. With a kitchen and washer and dryer. We where woken by the sounds of what must have been renovations with drilling and hammering starting around 9 each morning. the walls did seem thin as we could tend to hear them guests in the hall or talking in their rooms at times. And we could here the noise from the luau. The Hilton Hawaiian village has a lot of shops and restaurants. I recommend the italian Restaurant, Fresco, good food and great service. the hilton Grand Vacation Suites location is good, on the beach, walking distance to other restaurants and shops including the AlaMoana shopping centre. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was a great resort with plenty of on-site activities. However, it's pricey (of course most of Hawaii is pricey). A Don Quioti store is close by...get your food and other items from this place...much lower than the close-by WalMart. Located right on the beach...sunsets are gorgeous. If you don't want to hang out on property...there are plenty of restaurants, etc. within walking distance. A free U.S. Army museum is right across the street...it has a wealth of history.
user_location: Port Saint Lucie, Florida, United States
user_name:
Eugene393
Port Saint Lucie, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were very happy with this hotel stay. Lagoon tower room had a lot of space for us and our 3 granddaughters. Plenty of choices for restaurants, shopping and activities on site and within walking distance to dowtown area. More beach space than I had expected.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
