Patio was a well used feature and the room was a lot larger, I had a garden/ocean view! Both Tower for Fab!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Awesome resort with much to do within walking distance. Different places to eat, hangout, listen to music, dance,or just watch the waves. Great for couples and families. Hilton always has a great staff and delivers excellent service!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great place to go, with lots of activities. Is expensive but there are some great deals especially for military retirees. This was truly a grand vacation at a premium facility with great staff who were always polite, considerate and helpful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We moved to the Lagoon Tower and looked forward to all that went with it. Unfortunately we hit a weekend that they had a corporate event. Instead of a nice restful weekend we were hit with a corp party on Fri night that had not stop noise and other than being AT the party we heard every single song and noise to the fullest. The next day, Sat. they sat up for the next events. I called and asked if we should expect more of the same Sat night as we were up all night with the music and screaming the night before. We were assured there would be no entertainment Sat. night. Well that was 100% wrong. It's still going loud and strong and while I am glad the resort is making lots of $$$ and the corporation is having a great time, I am sad we are using our vacation time for the most unrestful time we have ever spent. This should have been free at best to put up with this non stop. Can hardly wait to see what we have to endure tomorrow night. What a waste of our time off.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed at this location before and loved it. I was offered a week vacation by HGV to listen to their sales pitch. I was offered a price for a week, but asked for an upgrade to a 2 bedroom which they promptly agreed to for a higher (double) price. When I went to reserve, they told me it was for a 1 bedroom at the higher price and weren't offering 2 bedrooms any more. They refused to honor my agreement and said that their notes didn't mention a 2 bedroom. They refused to listen to the recording. I always stay at Hiltons and Marriotts but this lack of trust is making me think of cancelling the two Hilton reservations that I have made for this summer.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location in Honolulu. Honolulu/Waikiki is crowded and traffic is awful. If you're looking for a place to stay in Waikiki, then this is a great place to vacation with family. Close to beach or use the great pool. Plenty of shopping and dining opportunities.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location in Honolulu! Easy to walk around the City; there were trolley's's but we didn't use them. A few too many kids for my liking but the facilities were great! Fireworks on Friday and Saturday night were very nice and free!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed at this resort over christmas and new years. My wife was 8 months pregnant at the time, we had to switch rooms and asked if there was somewhere we could store our stuff until our room was ready or if we could have a early check-in. There answer was a simple NO. We decided to go to the outdoor pool until our room was ready. We had all our personnel belongings with us at the pool, watch, credit cards money iPods camera etc in a backpack. After sting in my pool chair and not even being there for 15 minutes someone had snuck up behind us and stolen our bag right from under our chair while we were sitting there. Security came and took a statement and brought us to the hotel manager on duty. We had roughly 15,000.00 worth of stuff stolen and the managers only response was a story of when he went to thailand and had his passport stolen. He had no concern of what just happened at his hotel to us and did not offer us any help whatsoever. I asked him how he would like me to pay from our stay now that my credit cards were stolen, his ran to the desk and made sure to put through the charges before my card was cancelled. I will never stay at any hilton hotel again. the fact is no one at their hotel cared about what happened or tried to even help us.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location of the property is VERY good and has most everything you would need on property. Property is very good for a family or a couple. You will find it a little pricey but its HI. You can use it as a base to go anywhere on the island

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just completed our 5th stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and have already booked our return visit for October. We love the on-site variety of facilities and activities and we love the Waikiki location. We've rented a car twice (one day rental both times) to drive around the island. Otherwise, we walk and use the local bus to get around Honolulu and Waikiki. We geocache around Honolulu and so get to see areas that are not typical tourist spots. After a day of adventuring, we happily return to the HHV, which is starting to feel like a second home. Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our family spent the weekend to celebrate my daughter's birthday with some of her friends. We had a excellent stay with the friendly service and large rooms to spread out. The kitchen was great for meals and the hotel was right next to the pool and beach. Lots to do and not enough time to do it. Planning our next stay already.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the studio and had a great view of the ocean. The room was very nice and clean. Beds were comfortable. First time using our timeshare and we were very pleased. Wish they had a bar or restaurant down stairs but it is close to several bars and restaurants. The parking is pretty pricey but that was expected.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Can't wait to go back! Have wanted to stay at Hilton Hawaiian Village since first seeing it more than 10 years ago. Booked a room at the resort and upgraded it to a one bedroom condo for a week. We were put in the Grand Waikikian which is part of the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites.We were given the traditional Hawaiian flower lei greeting at reception. Check in was fast and easy. Hilton has an arrangement with Charley's Taxi so it was a $29.00 flat rate from the airport. The condo was clean, spacious, with a kitchen, washer and dryer. Upon arrival we were told which day housekeeping would come into the condo. I liked not having to get out of the room everyday for housekeeping. Additional housekeeping was available with a phone call if needed. Liked being able to have breakfast in the condo and snacks in the kitchen.Only negative thing I have to say about the condo was that the pillows were absolutely the worst I have ever had in any hotel. They were flat beyond saving. Asked for pillows that had some loft to them and were told there weren't any. Next time I'll try to bring my own pillow.Did not rent a car. Parking rates are very high at the resort. Public transportation was a bargain and we were able to go where we wanted on The Bus.There is enough to do at Hilton Hawaiian Village that you don't even have to leave the resort.We took a sunset cocktail cruise on the Spirit of Aloha catamaran. The crew was great and they did not spare the alcohol in the drinks.We liked the resort and our stay so much that we hope to go back before the end of the year. Will definitely book a condo again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I had room 467, 2 bedroom suite. It was wonderful for our 7 night stay. We spent $200 on groceries at the Walmart (We had a rental car). The suite had a full kitchen so it saved having to go out for breakfast & lunch everyday. We still spent over $500 on restaurants for 3 people. We had a view of the pool & a distance view of the ocean. It was noisy, because of kids playing in pool 4 floors below. I wanted a room on 6th floor. It was still a great experience because it was like having an apartment. If you have small kids the Lagoon tower is located by the best kid-friendly pool.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Sometime it took long long time to wait @ reception corner . Sometime it tooks 20 mins. to wait for the reception time. I think you should have idea to cope this issue. Some staff talk too much and it seems loose action we think. Please cut waiting time .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower and it was very hard to leave the room the views from the balcony were so mesmerizing. When we did leave the room it was hard to walk outside of the resort it was so tropical and .... Hawaiian. We loved that the resort is so close to Ala Moana Shopping Center. We often eat lunch at The Pineapple Room, delicious.
user_name:
Jay P
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great hotel. Recommend you stay in either the Lagoon Tower with lagoon view, or the Rainbow tower (either side.) The other two towers dont have the view and are a bit further to the beach. Overall great hotel for the family- We will definitely go back again

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This Resort's location is excellent. It is at the beginning of the Waikiki Strip. The Staff are very friendly and helpful especially Grace in the arrival/front desk. The fireworks are a must see on Friday nights - best location is the beach on the left side of the Rainbow Tower. Laundry facilities are free which was a great surprise - yahoo. The Lagoon Tower is nicely situated for a more quiet stay.
user_name:
Brian Kauhikoa C
Daly City, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were told we could come anytime. When we wanted to book the date we could not get the date we wanted and had to pay $150.00 to change one night. We chose the option for a "free" rental car but were not told parking was $27.00 per night. Too many things we were not told beforehand.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very ordinary but adequate accommodations- suites are very like Embassy Suites. Pools are small, chairs are scarce, and water was cold when we were there. Almost no swimmers, but ALL the reclining chairs were always fully occupied. This alone was a deal-breaker for us- we would not return. Overall, definitely not a luxury hotel.
user_name:
John K
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The overall facility is excellent however some of the furniture is soiled and needs to be replaced. The kitchen and bathroom cabinets have been replaced and yet the baseboards in the kitchen are deteriorating chip board.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed first week of the year and had a wonderful time. I had read a lot of reviews before booking our vacation destination and have to say I was not disappointed we certainly enjoyed our stay here. There were a lot of people but it was not bad like people say, your in Waikiki and there is plenty of sand an ocean for everyone. 1. Stayed in one bedroom in Kalia tower, all towers are short walk to beach and lagoon, was very clean and had full kitchen, stove, microwave, fridge, dining table, our girls slept on pull out sofa bed, not very comfy but adequate for a 3 and 5 year old but you would not want to sleep on it if your an adult. We slept in the king bed in bedroom so nice to have separate sleeping areas with kids! If you have family recommend staying in one or 2 bedroom suites, 1 bedroom suite was perfect for us as we need 2 separate rooms for sleeping plus there is more space/privacy.TVs and blu ray players (PS3) are in both rooms, so we brought some of our own mobile to watch, the tv in bedroom is a little small but we didn't really use it. TV in lounge is bigger and the free DVDs in the foyer is awesome, latest releases, no charge and loads to choose from.Loads of drawer space and hangers on closet as well as a good size safe. The laundry is not in room but in same floor so is close and good to be able to wash and dry clothes there so we were able to bring less luggage. The Kalia tower has its own fitness center, pool and hot tub on 4th floor, I believe all the towers do, so this is great. It also has a day spa that we did not use on this trip.2. Staff extremely friendly, helpful and even got an early check in, our room was well cleaned every day (they even put the girls soft toys in the beds for them) we were really treated like royalty and loved the amazing staff there and the beautiful clean rooms.3. Ala moana mall is close and has great shopping with all the major brands represented (girls love the Disney store) recommend stocking up with food form food land there as resort prices for food are pricey but there are plenty of great places to eat and there are also abc convenience stores everywhere, we had breakfast in our room and then ate lunch in resort and had dinner in room so was a great balance of some nice resort eating as well as dining in our own room making full use of kitchen etc...Parking is pricey, like $30 a day, recommend valet as is only a bit more, self parking I think is $27 a day. Valet is great and worth every penny, your in Waikiki so parking is premium and you just have to expect that and factor it in.4. Beach was great, crowded but still plenty of room to relax on the sand, everyone complaining about beach chairs and umbrellas, just buy them at abc for a few bucks and leave there, much easier and cheaper, we did that for the pool inflatables as well as sand buckets the girls loved playing with all these, when you leave pass them on to another family. the lagoon was great as well, not quite as warm as the beach which was quite warm and the best place to swim for that reason.5. This brings us to the pools, they are cold, and this is the only reason I did not give 5 stars, my girls were shivering in Hawaii! Pool temp is low 70s for sure, for me this is bad, it was the same last few times we were here as well, this is definitely an issue for us as it means the pools and water slides are not a lot of fun and only option for swimming is the beach. My 5 year old braved the water slides for about 6 rides but was shivering and lips were turning blue, I literally had to hug her in line to keep her warm, this should not be the case, the water slides are a great feature but who wants to land in cold water and then stand in line shivering? My 3 year old landed in cold water and it shocked her so she never wanted to go back in, was a shame as she was tall enough for slides so was excited until she landed I the cold water.Overall I might stay here again, we did visit the Disney resort and the pools were beautiful and warm so it is certainly factor in our future decision making, but it did not spoil our time as the girls love the beach so much so although was a shame not to spend more time in the pools we all did have a great time. Thank you for wonderful memories and great staff!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I could spend good time in HGVC in HNL. Two poitns which I wont to point out, Please provide Japnese language transration for new arrival non-Japanese movie although Chinese,Korean Thaioland etc availravle.Why you dont provide Japanese language transration ? We do hope to level up about quality of launge service item not only fro bevrage service but also snack service such as like kcokkies cakes etc.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower in February 2013 for 2 weeks with my 1 year old and 12 year old. Both kids loved the hotel property and paradise pool. The rooms were comfortable with a nice partial ocean view and view of the lagoon. The room had a fully equipped kitchen and we made a few meals in our room. There is a laundry room on each floor. We have been to Hawaii/Oahu multiple times and this is one of our favorite properties due to the amenities, proximity to beach walk, proximity to Ala Moana Shopping Center, and beach. The only problems we had with the room was the noise from the Luau and the fireworks show (since we had a 1 year old on a schedule) .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We took our family in Dec.2013. This hotel was beautiful. The location is perfect, the pools were great my boys had a blast they loved the slides. I loved that you have everything you need in just a couple of steps away no wonder they call it a village it is! Hilton Hawaiian Village totally helped make our christmas vacation the best vacation ever!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Staff service was flexible, gentle, heart warming, and with many brilliant smiles. Other customers were warm and friendly each other. Of course excellent hotel facilities, shops and good location were basis. I recommend this resort especially for the families as much as friends.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had our first visit in Hawaii for 8 days and not sure which building we should stay in, so we stayed 4 days at The Lagoon with an Ocean View and 4 days at the Grand Waikikian with the City View. Once you check in free orchid lei and macadamia nut lei for guys, but you have to ask the lady to lei you. She is not attentive as to who are checking in so you have to physically go infront of her and ask her for a lei. It's one of those Hawaii vacation that you really want to experience, to get lei'd. So they need to have some kind of communication from the desk to alert the lady, so each and everyone that checks in get a lei. For me that's very important because it is a symbol of "welcome to Hawai'i" and your vacation starts now feel. There were 2 adults and 2 kids so we opted for 1 bedroom with a King size bed for me and my husband and a pullout sofa bed for the kids which they love becuase they can watch tv as late as they wanted. The rooms in the Lagoon is more spacious than the Grand Waikikian. Eventhough the decor and appliances are newer and the washing machine is in the room at the Grand Waikikian my whole family would rather stay in The Lagoon (19th floor). When you down on the first floor, few more steps and you are already at the Lagoon, the beach and the swimming pool. At The Grand Waikikian eventhough you walk inside the building it is still a walk. The Village has restaurants, shopping area, ABC store (a very convienient store that has almost everything you need) and a rent a car place (National) which the cars are parked at the Hilton parking building. We rented a car and drove around the Island and stopped by at Walmart to buy food to cook which saved us a lot of money. Both rooms are equiped with everything you need, including a rice cooker, sponge and a dishwashing soap and laundry detergent. We would eat at the balcony and watch the beautiful sunrise and sunset when we were at The Lagoon. The City View is not that appealing at all, so spend a little more for an ocean view. My kids love the gated pool with the slides and at night the pool is heated which is awesome. I don't suggest going to the main pool which is not gated, eventhough it is bigger it is crowded and I smell pee everywhere becuase that's where all the "hotel guests" are staying and anybody who wants to use the pool. They give you an orange card to exchange for beach towel. The only bad part is that they did not explain to us that when you are done with the beach towel to exchange it to get your card back for a new towel the next time you go back in the pool, and to return those orange card when you check out. Upon check in you also get a card to rent free movies (great selection) which is great at night.The check out time is 10am and check in is at 4pm, they have a family lounge at the 8th floor to wait for your room until it is available. When it was time for us to change building I thought we had to wait for our room but surprisingly they were already ready and we did not have to wait at all which is great.At night if we open our balcony we can watch the Luau from the top of the Hilton parking lot. The only bad part is I hated the pillow and the bed for some reason everytime I wake up my back hurts. The blanket at The Lagoon is so thick, its nice the first hour but when I woke up I was sweating. My husband and my kids did not have a problem so I ended up sleeping on the pullout sofa bed. Overall so much fun but if we go back we will definitely pick The Lagoon with Ocean View.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent hotel in all respects. Great open air lobby. Best beachfront location with plenty of activities both on the property and off in all directions. The best was to have restaurants, stores and a dessert shop on the property.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our room was spacious but not exceptionally maintained as I would expect it to be for the price. Also, very early check out and no mention of a room to use for convenience was offered to our party. I like the resort for convenience - shopping, food, pools and beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I am surprised about some of the reviews. Yes, the complex is large, and has everything you need onsite. Yes, the amenities are expensive, but it is HAWAII. Yes, the pools are crowded, but you can work around that. Plus the beach and lagoon are never too busy. We had 4 adults and 2 kids in a 2 bedroom ocean/harbor view. We were on the 22nd floor (of 24). I imagine the paradise pool could be louder lower down. Loved our balcony. Had a full kitchen, with an oven that appeared never to have been used! Newer appliances; older room. Comfortable beds. There is room service until 10pm and came in helpful on several occasions. Glad to have a kitchen to save a little money. Ate at 4 different restaurants on-site and enjoyed all. CJs has something for everyone. Staff very friendly and helpful. Used the washer/dryer. Stayed a week and wish it was two. Looking to maybe even buy in (resale). Great family vacation!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The hotel appearance is excellent, staff is very helpful, but the rooms could use some maintenance, and everything at the hotel is very expensive. Use other sources for activities and dinning. The beach is excellent but to use a lounge chair or umbrella on the beach cost you extra.
user_name:
Sheldon Dewain L
Delta Junction, United States

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The facility did not have the views or the accommodations we are accustom to at Hilton Grand. When I made the reservations, I asked for certain things for the celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary, they had no idea what this facility had or they did not inform me that the facility could not provide the perks I was wanting.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After reading a few bad reviews I thought how bad can it be. I stayed at the lagoon tower ocean view 1 bedroom suite over looking the Marina and lagoon. The suite was spacious, clean and quiet. The kitchen is fully equipped, bedroom is spacious and the pull out sofa is a queen size and comfortable. There is a free washing machine and dryer on every floor which are maintained daily. It was clean. I stayed on level 16. Wouldn't recommend a low floor over looking the pool as all you can hear are kids yelling in the pool. Ala moana 10 minute walk. Lagoon tower pool is great. Mai Tai's are $5 around the pool, however the other bars around the super pool are $11 each. Pools are not heated, the beach is warmer. Overall yes it is busy but it was nice. Staff are very friendly so don't know what people are going on about..

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We arrived as a family of 8 with 4 children and 4 adults and immediately got our lei greeting, bags taken away and to our rooms rooms within 10 minutes. Fireworks started minutes later and then a movie on the lawn. Good greeting to Hawaii if getting there by 6;30pm on a Friday or Wednesday! Upper rooms in the Lagoon tower are amazing, close to facilities and the best is they are huge. Kitchen well supplied and now have rice cookers. No BBQ which we would have liked . Lagoon activites, esp. surf lesson good value, with USB photos much appreciated.Best beach in Waikiki

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Once you've stayed at a Hilton Grand Vacations resort, it's hard to settle or anything less. Stayed here for our wedding, and felt like we were renting a condo by the beach! Loved the space and amenities (full kitchen, dishwasher, etc.) in our room. The staff was super helpful, and the location was walking distance to everything. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed a week at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in the Lagoon Tower, which is the older tower. 2 bedroom was spacious, full kitchen, nice ocean view, large lanai for sitting outside and looking at the scenery. The property has it's own beach area and a little more private given it's further away from the main tourist area. The resort has everything, including multiple pools and small kiddie slides. Very relaxing just staying on property, but if you want activities, they have lots of options that you buy and even a few free ones on property. I say the room is slightly outdated, mainly because we took a tour of their new timeshare, the Grand Waikikian, which had higher end appliances and furnishings, albeit the rooms were smaller. Overall, it's a nice resort and when traveling with a family of younger kids, it's nice to have a kitchen and the beach and pools just outside the door.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Just stayed for the first time in a time share that I purchased last year. Partial ocean view 2bedroom. Agree with other recent reviewer. Room is a little worn for having been "recently renovated". Kinda wish I had ponied up for a unit in the Grand Waikikian. Also, previous tenant left crab and God knows what else in the drain which created a horrible smell. Maintenance came and corrected right away. Resort was great. Not crowded.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have stayed here at the Lagoon Tower before and the room we had was starting to look tired. Some doors were chipped, baseboards need painting and carpet needed cleaning or replaced, furniture needed cleaning. I think just over all the room needed a face lift. It was not up to my expectation of a Hilton brand. We stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation in Las Vegas, on the Big Island and Florida and they are always in excellent shape. Enough about the room. The customer service here is like I expect of a Hilton Brand. It is top notch. Everyone is very helpful and nice.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great place for vacation, great amenities, great restaurants & shops. Enjoyed our room which was quiet & clean. the pools & surrounding areas were just super. Wish hotels would charge less for parking.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have a lagoon tower studio booked for May 2014 , so during my recent stay I asked management if I could have a quick look to make sure it was going to be suitable for my stay because I have read that others have been disappointed upon checkin. having said that. the vacation club staff were wonderful, organising for me to have a look between checkins .well, I was pleasantly surprised, yes it is quite small, about the size of a hotel room, but it has a king bed , sofa, kitchenette with coffee maker, toaster and fridge and table and two chairs.bathroom is very small, but it will service us fine on our 3 day stopover to the mainland, because all we will be doing will be sleeping in it. it has no balcony, but two louvred windows looking down to the paradise pool. if you know what to expect you are never disappointed, so I just wanted to describe it for you.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at Lagoon tower six years ago and we found the space was very tight for a family of four with two teens staying in a one bedroom unit. The renovated units are much improved and spacious. The living room and eating area is spacious and so is the bedroom. I like the colour scheme. There are a few issues that management have overlooked. For example, very obvious paint chips on walls and corners, very cheap utensils and no can opener. I had to called front desk twice to request a can opener. The front lobby washroom is below a two star restaurant standard.Nevertheless, my spouse and I had a good visit and the concierge was very helpful with tour highlights and coupon books.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent one week at the Lagoon Tower, a HGVC property in Hilton Hawaiian Village.While the property itself continues to undergo improvements and expansion, management is not performing much-needed and critical upgrades to the Lagoon Tower.On arrival (room 2065) we enjoyed the excellent view and the slightly-better-than-average room furnishings. Mostly a very good impression.On the 2nd morning, we had been attacked by an infestation of termites. They were literally crawling all over the guest bathroom - in the sink, the tub, over the light fixtures and the counter. They were crawling their nasty little bodies into our travel kits as they hoped for a journey back to the mainland. All together distasteful.Upon complaint, management came in and sprayed poison (while we were in occupancy!) into the bathroom. This helped for approximately 30 minutes, and then the insects reappeared. On further complaint, hotel management agreed to move us.The second unit, 2365, had no such infestation. Unfortunately, it had a totally outdated air conditioning system (the same as the first unit) that had to run constantly in order to cool down the bedrooms (while the main room was freezing cold). The thermostats are old and outdated and could not be regulated to shut the A/C off and on even if a proper temperature was reached. To maintain coolness, you had to run the A/C and fan 24/7.To add to this, we noted huge amounts of mold visible in the vents. One person in our party (me) became physically sick day in and day out. We didn't put the "mold" together with the "sick" until the last day, when we were leaving. This could be coincidence - there's no way I can prove that the mold was the cause of my illness, but it's highly suspicious.Management never followed up with us to inquire if our new accommodations were satisfactory or if we were now happy. They never offered any compensation for the discomfort of the insects or the inconvenience of moving all of our goods. (We were using the parking valet - a simple gesture would have been to "comp" this service and it would have cost the hotel nothing.)This hotel is resting on its laurels and it appears to not much care as to the overall satisfaction of its guests. After many (many!) trips to this facility, I will never stay there again, although I will give the newer sister property, Grand Waikikian a chance to fulfill the empty promises offered at Lagoon Tower.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The concierge service was poor. Not many of them could speak English fluently. We felt we had to speak Japanese to get any attention. The pools are filled with kids jumping around. They should dedicate one of the pools for adults only.
user_name:
Sampath V. K
melbourne, fl, United States
